Reviews.Title: “Great location for price!”
Reviews.Author: Cheree T
Reviews.Content: I made reservations at this hotel for a work conference. The conference was at the Marriott which is less than 2 blocks away, but almost $100 more per night. It included free breakfast and free wi-fi in the lobby which none of the other hotels in the area included. It isn't anything fancy, but it was spotless! I couldn't find anything wrong with this hotel and the price was great. Obviously the breakfast wasn't gourmet, but it served it's purpose for my husband. I would definitely stay here again. There is a cable car stop about 2 blocks away and the buses and street cars are also nearby. There are several good restaurants just down the street and you will also find Starbucks (next to the cable car stop, but you can't take your coffee on the cable car!), Trader Joe's and a Safeway. If you want something clean and conveniently located in Fisherman's Wharf, then this will serve you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TXBarb3
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently went to San Francisco for vacation and chose to stay in the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf. Our stay was wonderful from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. The check in was quick and easy. Our flight arrived in San Francisco at 10 am and by 1045 we were in our room. We had suite #486. It had 2 queen beds and a fold out couch. We had a great view of the bay. Our room came with a microwave and refrigerator. The beds were comfortable with plenty of pillows and the bathroom was perfectly sized. The hotel and our room is very clean and very well kept. I was also impressed with every staff member. They always greeted us with a smile and with a hello. One of the best parts of this hotel was the included hot breakfast. My son especially enjoyed the pancake maker! I did not drink the coffee available in the room since they had yummy fresh brewed coffee with half and half in the breakfast area. The other part we love about the hotel was the location. We could walk to Fisherman's wharf in less than 5 minutes. We were able to walk every where and the locations we couldn't walk to had easy access to Muni/Trolley/Cable Car transportation. We plan to come back again next year and will definately stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “SAD”
Reviews.Author: Max J
Reviews.Content: not a bad hotel, just that the staff were abusive, unhelpful, sour, but then i found most people in San Francisco like that sadly, a beautiful city if you take the people out of it, sad

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: BTatroE4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during April 2012. Paying in advance resulted in a good discount on the room rate. The rooms were nicely furnished and spacious. The hotel seemed fairly new; everything was in good shape. The staff was very helpful. Breakfast was good, but unchanging, i.e., same menu every day. No pool, but you can use the pool at the nearby Holiday Inn. The hotel was literally two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, and also two blocks from public transportation (cable car, trolley, and bus). The $27 transit pass for a week was a good deal. Without the pass, a cable car ride is $6.00 one way, so it pays for itself pretty quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned, okay suite, for the price.”
Reviews.Author: terryelewis
Reviews.Content: Five of us shared a suite which was quite close for a few nights. The suite was a single room with two queen beds and a sleeper. It was very tight for those days, but fortunately we spent most of the time out of the hotel. Free breakfast was an attraction, however there were many people crowding the breakfast area. The rental car had safe off-road parking. We were within walking distance of most activities/public transport, so the hotel served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Four day trip”
Reviews.Author: carol s
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HIE on a short break. Arrived SFO and got the shared shuttle bus which was excellent value 17 dollars each which I thought was great value instead of getting taxi or Bart as didn't know where we were going. Arrived at HIE check in was simply and given plenty of info on hotel. Went to room which wasn't quite ready but hey no problem girl said she would be five minutes so went downstairs and had look about. Got into room and we had king room - large room and very clean. Bathroom was very clean and well stocked. Breakfast was good and plenty of eggs,bacon, sausage, cereal, breads etc and juice tea and coffee although a little busy but no problem you could take breakfast to rooms. The hotel is well placed for fishermans wharf couple of minutes walk - and for everything. We booked a city tour through internet and was getting picked up at hotel - which we did to take us to the pick up point - however it was a couple of minutes away at pier 41 we could have walked quicker lol. The tour was great and in the afternnoon we did Alcatraz - a must - put on good shoes. The first night we ate in CHinatown - terrific and north beach Italian the second night very good. Third day we went to Sonoma and napa valley....my kind of country well worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you are visiting downtown!”
Reviews.Author: MisGee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and were put into the executive building next door which was nice. We had a great view and our hotel seemed in good upkeep. Didn't get a chance to try breakfast so no comment on that but the hotel was loud as there were a ton of kids running up and down our hallway at 9 o'clock at night and security was called more than once to resolve the issue. You definitely pay for location though so if you are going to be renting a car or have good transportation, I would pick the La Quinta Inn in south SF off Airport Blvd. We stayed there for the second part of our visit, the hotel rooms were actually a little nicer, the hotel itself is nicer, they have a hot tub which Holiday Inn doesn't AND it's almost $100 cheaper per night so like I said, if you have transportation, save your dollars!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: 620irene87
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 30 teenagers from my son's choir & jazz band. The service was good, continental breakfast was really convenient with a large group. It was very crowded at breakfast so I found it handy to grab some fruit,coffee & yogurt to take to my room. Rooms were beautiful- looked like they had been recently renovated-loved the new bathrooms, beds were comfortable and our room was spacious. Not a great view but we didn't have time to look out the windows anyways. Very convenient location- so close to everything. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: katesgame1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2012. This was the first stop of our USA road trip. Firstly I would give this tip. If this is your 1st stop like it was ours. Don't bother collecting your hire car until you leave. This hotel charges around 50 dollars a night to park (the ONLY hotel we visited that charged). We easily got around San Francisco without using a car and Fishermans Wharf is in easy walking distance. We saved three days parking and car hire costs by changing our booking. We caught a taxi to Alamo when we left which cost us less than 10 dollars. The hotel is in a great location but that is about all I can say in favour of it. The rooms look very old fashioned. There is no view unless you like looking into other peoples windows. The breakfast is shambolic. There are not enough tables and the eating area is at the side of the reception area, there were people sitting in reception eating breakfast and plenty more who couldn't get a seat. There is no wifi in the bedrooms, you have to sit in the lobby. There were two computers for customers to use. There is no bar or restaurant in this hotel either. Apart from it's location I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely crowded, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AVeryPickyTraveler
Reviews.Content: The thing I hate most about this hotel is that it is PACKED with crowds. Fisherman's wharf is a very crowded touristy place. But I feel like this hotel is overly crowded. The line for breakfast in the morning seriously went through two rooms. I would say it took 10 minutes to get through this line and by the time I did, many of the options were gone. All the bacon was gone at 9 a.m. and even though the breakfast went until 9:30, they said they were not bringing more out. I waited 10 minutes to get a bagel and some cereal. Then when I got through the line, there was literally nowhere to sit. In the morning every single table is taken, every piece of furniture. There are people literally sitting on the floor in a corner eating ... or standing up and eating. After the first day, I said forget it and bought breakfast outside of the hotel. There were groups of kids there as well ... I would suggest if you see large groups of middle school and high school age kids hanging all over the lobby, you should ask the front desk to put you on a floor away from them. They get loud. Also, in the mornings and at night, the elevators get packed and crowded. It takes several trips of people jamming into them to go to your room. And of course many of the European tourists don't exactly grasp the concept of waiting in an orderly line, so many rush into the elevator even if you have been waiting there before them. A lower floor would probably be better. The service here is poor as well. I asked for an extended check out time and they would not give me one, even though I am a top tier rewards member. I am supposed to get a 2 o'clock check out if I request it. Not so at this hotel. Also, I am entitled to a room upgrade, if available. Not only did they not have a room upgrade for me, they said that they did not have any king beds left when I checked in. When I told them I was sure that I requested one on the website, they told me they were sorry but the hotel was full. So I got a room with two small beds. I was dissapointed to hear that there was no wireless internet. There is a free wired internet access port in the room, but that means you will have to sit at the desk if you want to go online. Another annoying thing is that there aren't many cable stations at all. There around 11 channels. 3 are sports related and 2 are hotel/local area related, leaving around 6 stations to watch. The hotel is clean and in a great location, right on fisherman's wharf. Every other hotel chain has a hotel in this area. You can easily and safely walk to the wharf. At night there are lots of homeless people who sleep in the allies near the hotel. This might be a concern for people with kids. These people aren't aggressive for the most part, so I didn't feel threatened by them. However, fisherman's wharf isn't the nicest of places after 11 o'clock at night when the crowds are smaller. You can walk a few blocks to the wharf or In N Out Burger or lots of restaurants. I love the location of this hotel. The lobby and furnishings are nice. The hotel is new. Valet parking is $30 per night. Kind of a rip off considering the hotel has its own connected lot. So keep that in mind when booking ... you are spending $30 per night extra on parking. Pretty standard for Fisherman's Wharf. I think there may be a cheaper lot connected to Enterprise Rent a Car on Beach Street, a block away, which might be worth a check out. Overall, this is nice and clean and in a good location. However, I would much rather stay somewhere with wireless internet and less crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 18sunflowers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in April, for the first few days of our honeymoon. All the staff were very helpful and informative. The free breakfast had a good selection of foods and was very popular- get there early though as the queues can get long! It is in a very touristy place but we found it quite easy to get to different parts of the city using the hop on/ off buses.

Reviews.Title: “Like being in a train station”
Reviews.Author: My-Ooops
Reviews.Content: Very turistical, ugly, unclean. I did not like this hotel at all. There are much better Holiday Inns. I will certainly not return. Breakfast is of very poor quality. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights with my 2 kids aged 15 & 16 for our 1st trip to USA ,great location to explore San Francisco once get to know local transportation Hotel provided a sound and secure foundation for our stay,staff very, very helpful and friendly ,front desk staff especially giving a very efficient service checking in and any other information I required, also when my return transfer pick up running bit late,they were straight on to it for me.Rooms cleaned and serviced perfectly everyday.Breakfast queue got bit long some days but hey get up earlier !! Overall had a brilliant time and thought hotel excellent value,good size room plenty of space for 3 of us- 2 double beds and a roll out.Thank you again.had an excellent stay and would definately recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Noisy Hotel, Terrible Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rachel J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November 2011. The hotel is located in the central area of Fisherman's wharf. The room was really small (similiar to NYC hotel room sizes). The room was clean though and housekeeping always cleaned it. The walls in the hotel though must be very hollow because we could hear the loud european tourists come back from a bar in the middle of the night talking down the hall. It takes about a 5-8minute taxi cab to the main city where all the shops are and costs about $10 bucks. You can get a tram but it takes 25mins and costs about $2 bucks. The free breakfast was pretty crap, i just got a bannana and yoghurt. The bacon and etc was EWW. So many contiki european tourists stay here and are so loud and rude. I wouldn't stay here again. I would prefer to stay at Sheraton across the road. I believe it costed about $20 dollars more a night to stay at Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Sasha-Rose F
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is the most beautiful city I have ever seen and this hotel was a great base to see it from. We had transport from the airport so I can't help with directions I'm afraid but I can tell you that the staff were excellent. They were so helpful on every issue. They were happy to give you directions, public transport information etc. They provide you with a map of the area. The room was lovely and clean and spacious enough. The coffee machine was in the bathroom which was a bit odd but hey, if that's all there is to complain about it can't be bad. We did have breakfast included and as you would expect at times this gets busy so you need to be there before 8am if you don't want to queue and want to get a table.

Reviews.Title: “everything you need”
Reviews.Author: shoalbay01
Reviews.Content: pros-- great location, good room but showing its age. complimentary breakfast was good cons-- room showing wear, expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hilltowngal
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel. The room was clean and quiet. The shower was exceptionally good for a hotel room. We found the included breakfast to be perfectly adequate. It wasn't gourmet, but we didn't expect that. The location is excellent. Two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and within easy walking distance of lots of activities.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: EricT822
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf San Francisco is my favourite hotel in the world ! The rooms are clean, spacious, and comfortable, the staff are so friendly and helpful, access to PCs is free, and you get a good hearty breakfast ! I stayed there this Easter and the staff gave me a friendly greeting and quickly checked me in. I wanted to go to a ball game and they explained how to get by train to the Oakland Coloseum stadium. On my last day my driver had gone to the wrong hotel, and the lady at the desk rang and sorted it immediately. I love this hotel - it's situated perfectly for the Wharf district, one of the most vibrant and exciting places in the world. The guests here tend to be very nice people, and I've made friends with many over my two visits. If you happen to be a smoker there's a good smoking area outside with a seat and a light. I've made many friends here ! San Francisco is a wonderful city and this is a great place to stay. One downside - if you have a car the parking is extortionate ($45 a day !)

Reviews.Title: “Super for families”
Reviews.Author: khind1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in San Francisco. Hotel very quiet, comfortable and excellent breakfast., although huge queues after 8am....only negative was having to pay $50 per night to park car we had rented to explore california.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco here I come”
Reviews.Author: Tom O
Reviews.Content: Great location, was about 50 dollars a night more than the Holiday Inn across the street, I guess that was for the breakfast. Stayed 4 days and even though it rained for two of them the place was packed. I was happy I chose the Fishermans wharf location because it seemed to have all the action. Close to all the tours and restaurants, if you are a first time visitor this is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sharon L
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to San Francisco and had previously stopped at Holiday Inn next door so we knew the location was excellent, we only changed to this one as it provided complimentary breakfast and this was adequate with plenty of choice. Our room was large with two double beds and a settee with small kitchen too, very nice and cleaned daily to a very good standard. Staff were excellent, nothing was too much trouble , internet access was great with teenagers who need to keep in touch with the world. Everything was nearby so provided an effortless break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel for a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Jen D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here. The staff at the front desk were very helpful with any questions we had about the area. The hotel itself is in a good location. MInutes walk to Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, and other fun destinations. The rooms were clean and the bed was super comfy. The room itself was on the small side, but we didn't expect or need anything huge. The biggest plus was the free breakfast. It was really delicious too. Big warm cinnamon rolls, biscuits and gravy, pancakes, eggs, sausage, bagels, toast, yogurt, and cereals. Having a free breakfast every morning saved us at least 20 dollars a day. I would stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean & good location.”
Reviews.Author: emngsmom
Reviews.Content: It's a Holiday Inn Express...and we got exactly what we expected. It was a family trip, 2 adults 2 kids 9&12. We stayed only 2 nights during the first days of spring break and moved on to visit family in Central CA. The floor we were on seemed updated. The room and common areas were clean. Decor is bright and fresh. Our room had a "view" toward the wharf, it overlooked a parking lot but was nice for the Fisherman's Wharf area, although we got a bit of traffic noise from the street below. Many of the rooms' windows face each other in a sort of courtyard that is just cement and stucco, so I preferred the noise over a view looking into another guest's room. The hotel is older and if you look under the surface of things you can tell, but our room had newer furniture, the beds were comfortable and the carpet was clean. Housekeeping seemed to do a good job. The free breakfast was fine, typical free breakfast food, and they had a make your own pancake machine that enthralled the kids and looked like an Easy-Bake oven...press a button and 2 pancakes come out the other end in 2 mins. The front desk only had 1 staff member, but we lucked out and it was never very busy when we needed them. Location is GREAT if you want to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area. I've been to SF many times, but it was the first time for my kids so it was a lively fun area to explore. Walking distance to Alcatraz boat, Ghirardelli Sq., cable cars, Pier 39, and all major transportation. If you don't know SF, Fisherman's Wharf isn't the cleanest, most scenic, or freshest smelling area and it is dominated by tourist shops, attractions and all that goes with that, but as a tourist, I didn't mind it for this short trip. We had a rental car, which can cost a lot to park in SF. Our room rate included parking. While researching hotels in the area, we found comparable hotel rooms for a little less money, however they charged $40-50/day for parking and did not include a free breakfast. The Holiday Inn Express ended up costing less when you added in the extras. San Francisco is an expensive place to stay, so I thought $220/night for parking and breakfast in a great location during spring break was well worth the money. We would recommend staying here if you're not expecting the Ritz, want a basic, clean hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a great SF vacation.”
Reviews.Author: recorder
Reviews.Content: This place is in a good location. You are short blocks away from all the action at Fisherman's Wharf, two different cable car turnarounds, cross town and local bus stops, Ghiradelli Square, Hop on-Hop off bus stariting points and maybe most important a Walgreens. With just a little effort you can walk to North Beach and Little Italy. This place is well staffed with helpful people, clean and comfortable. Did I mention the breakfast? Bacon, sausage, pancakes, eggs, biscuits and gravy plus all the other regular free breakfast items. The only drawback I found is that there are no stairs to assist the overworked elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great location;nice staff”
Reviews.Author: nancy1965
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a terrific location. It was 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and within blocks of major transportation (streetcar, cable car and bus to downtown). The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We got there really early and they let us check in and go to our room. When we were leaving, they let us check out, but still held our luggage until time to catch our plane that evening. Once, the housekeeping staff forgot to leave washcloths. I called the front desk and I bet they were there at our door within 60 seconds. I can't tell you how the breakfast was. It was too crowded in the breakfast room to bother and there was a terrific cafe next door, called Hollywood Cafe. If I had to say anything negative, it would be the bathroom is a little on the small side and they could use some more channels on the cable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday base”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect holiday base to experience Fisherman's Wharf area, and Little Italy, cable cars and the Ghiradellis building are short walks away. we had a large room with 2 double beds, acres of room, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The included breakfast option was more than acceptable for a quick breakfast before a day of sightseeing. The winning factor for us for this hotel is its location - hard to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor quality”
Reviews.Author: W A
Reviews.Content: We had initially picked this hotel because of it's location. It's perfectly located one block from the Wharf, which is nice since we could walk to most things at the Pier. The hotel itself isn't in the greatest condition - and neither is the service. There is only one person at the front desk, who isn't always available, so when u need to check-in or out, you do so by calling the operator (a little strange, but it works). If you want to grab breakfast, they only have a Denny's downstairs, otherwise you can walk across to the newer better holiday inn across the street where they serve a medicore breakfast. The hotel is also located minutes from where the bus tours start and end, and from bike rental shops as well. overall it was a nice hotel. I wouldn't mind staying there again. One thing to be aware of is the daily parking rate, which for us was $40/day.

Reviews.Title: “great location but not cheap!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location, 2 blocks from Fishermans Wharf, 3 different cable cars leave from here to go to Unions Square. The hotel was clean, the staff very helpful, Brandi is just lovely! our room was a decent size but small bathroom. We paid $214 a night + all the other taxes they put on our 2 nights stay came to $495, we paid much less for the Bellagio!! I guess because it was spring break the prices go up! Would recommend a lively dinner a Bubba Gump Shrimp Co and a bike ride over the Golden Gate Bridge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MittMor7
Reviews.Content: Wow, we got in and checked right in. We had a huge room with two double beds, pull out couch, sitting area and an amazing window. We were on the front corner of the building that is round so our window was huge. Large Kitchen type area, plenty of room for the five of us. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My only complaint would be the $45 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: suzysw
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. the location is perfect unless you plan to spend a lot of time in Union Square at the expensive designer stores. This hotel is very close to everything you need and a great location especially if you plan to do bus tours. Most of those pick up and drop back to the Wharf area. Cable Car stops are also close by. Hotel rooms were quiet, and very clean. Very nice breakfast, free internet in rooms. Staff very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend and I will certainly stay here again whenever I return to San Fran...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stole My Coat”
Reviews.Author: Diana M
Reviews.Content: I'll start with some positives... Brandi at the front desk is fabulous and clearly customer service is her calling. She was great. The location was also very convenient for our trip. Now, a MAJOR negative... The cleaning staff can't be trusted. I was traveling from Boston and left a very nice long wool coat in the closet in my room. It was warm in San Francisco and I wasn't wearing it, and I forgot it in my room when I left. I then called the hotel so they could send it to me, and they said they never found the coat. I am 100% certain that this coat was left in the closet in my hotel room at the hotel. It is sad that the employees at the hotel have yet to return this jacket to me. If they happen to find the coat and return it to me, I'll take back everything I said here, but as of right now, they have ruined my experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AgustinaB
Reviews.Content: I sayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The Breakfast is outstanding and the best part is if you are too late for dinner, there's a Denny's just around the corner. Its close to all the turist spots and within walking distance from the Fisherman's Wharf and the Girardhelli Ice Cream Shop. Also, you can walk down to Pier 37 for some more fun! The service at the hotel is great, clean, neat and the staff are very friendly. The only think I could find as a negative is that the maids are not very quiet even when you put your do not disturb sign. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: sweetesteye
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious enough with the basic amenities. Overall it was clean, but I was still wary of walking barefoot on the carpet. With a good selection of channels on TV and lots of closet space, in addition to a reasonably unobstructed view, the room met my very basic standards. A major drawback was the absence of free in-room wireless internet, although a wired connection was available. In an age of e-readers and ubiquitous wireless devices, I find this ridiculous. The free breakfast buffet was more than adequate. In addition to the usual cereal, muffins, etc. there was a pancake machine that produced perfectly edible fare. Check-in and check-out were pleasant if not particularly friendly. The platinum amenity is a joke. When I returned home there were two strange charges on my credit card that disappeared within a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a Great location!”
Reviews.Author: scotsman2011
Reviews.Content: Currently on a West Coast USA tour and spent the 1st four nights here in the Holiday Inn Express Fishermans Wharf. I have booked 4 hotels from this chain so I was really happy with my 1st choice!! On arrival at the hotel after a near 24 hour trip to get there, we were warmly welcomed at the check-in desk and the check-in process was very quick which was a welcome! We were in a Junior suite which was spotlessly clean & spacious with comfortable beds! Delighted with the room and served us well for the four nights. Breakfast was great, a good mixture of hot & cold items and was a good start to the day. Ideal location with various forms or transport basically on the doorstep. Theres a Dennys round the corner with an Ihop just along the road. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would recommend this hotel to visitors in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AllySM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and it was very clean, had a decent breakfast and was in a great location. Yes it's touristy but we were tourists and loved the gift shops, restaurants and location so close to the wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MalaysianAged28
Reviews.Content: 4 of us travelled together and this hotel provided us with two queen sized beds. FACILITIES Two (2) Queen Sized Bed One (1) TV Hair Dryer Fridge (but it was not cold – we found out later when our ice cream melted) Coffee Maker (which can be used to boil water) Microwave In-room safe No bedroom slippers TV Standard TV channels. AIR COND / HEATER One air cond / heater was provided. STAFF Very friendly and helpful. If you don’t know what to do next, just drop by the front desk for ideas. BATHROOM Soap, shampoo. If required you can request for a tooth brush, shaver, shaving cream, comb, etc which is provided free of charge. Clean bathroom. Good water pressure with hot and cold water. BREAKFAST Breakfast was provided. This is the standard Holiday Inn Express breakfast. The spread was sufficient with burger / bacon, eggs, muffin, bread, bagel, pancake, yogurt, cinnamon roll, juice, coffee & tea. Although a good variety, you can easily get tired of it as we stayed in Holiday Inn Express in Vancouver, San Francisco, Grand Canyon, and LA and it was ALWAYS the same breakfast. OTHER COMMENTS There was no additional hidden charges such as “resort fees” which is charged by most hotels. I paid about $150 a night for a three-night stay on Wed - Friday which I think was affordable when sharing among 4 people. No Free Parking – but we didn’t drive so it was not a problem. Parking in SanFran is very expensive. Near the wharf it is $2 per half hour. There was free Wifi but the signal was not strong enough in the room. We had to go down to the lobby to use the Wifi. If you plan to get work done in your hotel room and require Wifi, then you will be dissapointed. LOCATION Five minute walk away from the main eating and shopping area at the wharf. A convenience store, Walgreens was also nearby. We could easily catch the cable car or tramp to Union Square or the Lombard Street, the world’s most crookedest street. SURPRISES The town closes quite early. We went out for dinner at 8pm and most shops were already closed. OVERALL I paid US$150 per night and stayed on the 7th – 10th Mar 2012. A satisfactory experience as this is a family hotel and nothing too fancy. It was quiet and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “! The Perfect Location For Staying at Fisherman's Wharf !”
Reviews.Author: chynna
Reviews.Content: We chose the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites as we had less than 48 hours in which to experience San Francisco, and this offered the most flexibility for all the activities we wanted to do. The rooms are reasonably spacious, and clean. There is also free internet in the lobby, which was great for confirming our next flights etc. Breakfast is buffet style, but basic. However, we were impressed with what was on offer - and had also chosen this accommodation because of our limited time in San Francisco and we didn't need the hassle of trying to find a breakfast place before beginning our exploration of the city. The location is less than 5 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf, and Pier 39. The crooked part of Lombard is about 10 minutes walk, and the ferry to Alcatraz is about 15-20 minutes flat walk away from here. There is also a range of San Francisco sightseeing options at Fisherman's Wharf, and we found it easy to catch a double decker bus which took us over the Golden Gate Bridge and back. I've since recommended the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites to others, and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for 1st time visitors”
Reviews.Author: finallyavacation29
Reviews.Content: I live 3 hrs from SF and the first couple of times we always stayed here. Nice location, great continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, great quality.”
Reviews.Author: Paletrees
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 days recently at this hotel, and had a very pleasant stay. Location-wise, you can't beat it. Being a solo traveler on foot, it's always important for me to find a place that's walkable/close to transit. This hotel definitely met that requirement for me. Room-wise, it was quite clean. The bed was comfy, bathroom quite spacious, my only complaints were the view (right across from other rooms) and the tube TV (only a handful of channels, and poor picture quality). Other than that, service in the room was very efficient & friendly. One other small comment, their breakfast service is from 6:30-9:30. If you're an early riser, it's great. If you're someone who likes to sleep in a little bit longer, not as good. It would certainly be nice if it was a tad later, say, 7-10 or 7-11.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: De A
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf. The outside of the hotel is not the nicest but the room itself was very comfortable. The bathroom was also very nice and clean. I was in the room by myself so I really got to enjoy what it had to offer. Although i did like the location of the hotel I feel the Fishermans Wharf is to touristy for me and I will try to stay somewhere else whenever i return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent business”
Reviews.Author: Christina G
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges your credit card for the full amount when you make a reservation and will not refund the amount if you cancel the reservation. DO NOT BOOK A ROOM HERE! THEY STEAL YOUR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: NemoNik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate for a stay in the SFO area, be it for business or pleasure. The rooms are clean and well furnished with free wired internet. The internet connectivity speed is good. The CRT television seems a bit outdated now a days. (even Comfort Inns have LCD TVs, if not HDTVs these days); but it does not matter unless you plan on actually watching TV. Sometimes you do hear noises from adjoining rooms but that is normally the case with most hotels. The breakfast service isn't as good as I have had at other places but since it was complimentary and there were a large number of people, you can't harp too much on it. All in all, I would say its a good place to crash at night at a reasonable rate. It is close to the wharves, Pier-39 and Ghirardelli square and on the F-train route if you need to go downtown. However, if you are looking for something more elegant than an "adequately" furnished restaurants, there are other hotels in the immediate vicinity albeit at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; clean; good value.”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninEurope10
Reviews.Content: We spent the week here and were happy with the value and experience. It is a great location for Fisherman's Wharf, and easy connections all over SF. It is a family place so the free breakfast is well-attended and busy. But we never had a problem getting our food and finding a table. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the room was large and quiet. You could spend a lot more in the area and not do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable rooms near EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: Seahawksman
Reviews.Content: I am writing my review from the hotel so it's fresh in my mind. I've stayed here for a week now and have slept like a baby. The beds are new and the linens are clean. The wallpaper, TV, and curtains do need some updating, but it was acceptable for an HIE. The staff was very friendly and helpful! The breakfast was probably the best I've ever had in a hotel! tons of variety and plenty of it! There are several hotels around this very same block, but I'd book here first!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Rob2159
Reviews.Content: Great price and location at time or our visit. Since I think Holiday Inn has increased the prices but great location. Property bigger than most "express" locations more like full hotel. Good larger rooms with windows able to open and get some bay air. Nice views, great large free breakfest buffett, nice garage parking.

Reviews.Title: “rojo”
Reviews.Author: travellerMooroolbark
Reviews.Content: we loved the proximity to everything. we also had no view, so would ask for view next time. front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. thought it was value for money. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for the money. Take the breakfast option.”
Reviews.Author: dontSeattle
Reviews.Content: We loved the proximity of this hotel to all the Fishermans Warf activities and the cable car.malso the breakfast buffet was very complete. The room was a reasonable size and well maintained. You can walk to Pier 39 and the shops and restaurants as well as to the Alcatraz ferries. Two cable car lines terminate within a short walk so you can take a round trip easily.

Reviews.Title: “Average room but a great location - great view of Alcatraz!!”
Reviews.Author: Ffi0n
Reviews.Content: Room was average, and cleanliness was average, walls were pritty thin could hear people in the neighbouring rooms clearly; BUT the high point of the room was we had an amazing view of Alcatraz. Location was excellent, only a 2 minute walk to Pier 39 with all of the attractions. Had a wicked Philly Burger in Denny's Diner within the hotel and reasonably priced. The good points outweigh the bad points. We didn't spend much time in our room thou we had so much stuff to see in San Fran!! Brilliant place!!

Reviews.Title: “Makes it easy to stay a night for work or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: PBandJ01
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay for a couples' night in San Francisco followed by a 3-night business trip. It's easy to walk around to the sights and activities along Fisherman's Wharf and the Embarcadero. For dining we could choose from everything from Denny's to exceptional seafood. The cable car was just a block away. Hotel was solid for business too with everything needed for the next 3 days of conference. Friendly hotel staff. Parking at $45 was offered, but found $20 per night parking at Anchor Center 2 blocks away with in and out privileges after talking with the attendant. I'll be more eager to go to the city for a night in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: kacijo204
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with family of 4. Unbeatable location, removed from the tourist area yet close enough to walk to the Wharf, North Beach and Telegraph Hill, as well as all mass transit options. Convenient and very cost effective breakfast. Nearby Trader Joe's is very healthy and affordable, offering many prepared salads and wraps for under $5.00. Front desk friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “So you think you've got a deal.....”
Reviews.Author: Richard L
Reviews.Content: My disappointment occurred upon arrival. I thought I had booked a "two room" sweet and upon arrival was told "we don't have two bedroom sweets ...we only have a sweet with two beds"...... Small beds at that. Upon inspection, the room was smaller than most regular hotel rooms. I asked what classified this room as a sweet and was told it was because it had a small refrigerator and a sink. Result, two expensive nights and a great deal of disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Strange happenings...”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie A
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed here for spring break of 2011, I think about our stay often, and wonder if I should write a review. The hotel as a whole was a perfect fit for us, it's close to everything you could want to see in San Fransisco. The hotel is clean, my kids loved the breakfasts in the morning. The one experience I personally had was of a paranormal nature, can't say that I used to actually believe in ghosts, but I do now. Our room was on the 3rd floor, the room was always hot during the day, I called maintenance for this issue, at night it was like a freezer in the room. My bed was closest to the window, along the opposite wall is the double mirrored closets, while laying in bed you have a clear view of the bathroom. The second night of our stay, I awoke at 2:30 am to see who I thought was my son, head bent sitting on the commode looking at his phone. the room is totally dark and when the i phones light is on, it kind of glows like a flashlight . I at first didn't think anything of it, 17 yr old teens use their phones at all hours. I went back to sleep, and at 3:00 woke up again, only this time I called his name, asking what was he still doing on his phone, the person that looked up at me wasn't my son. I slammed on the light next to my bed, only to find my two sons asleep in the bed next to me. I was struck numb and speechless, with the nightstand light on, I could tell that the person wasn't solid. I always thought that it would be fun to see a spirit, after my experience, I think a bit differently. I was so scared I couldn't leave my bed at all that night. We all had weird things happening with our phones, the lights in the room, after that 2nd night we slept with the door closed. We wanted to change rooms and used the air conditioning as an excuse, the hotel was fully booked. I then called the manager from my cell, to ask if there was any experiences like this on the 3rd floor. I was embarrassed and a bit freaked out. they said no but asked for me to please tell them what room I was in, I caved and told them our experience. They were very sympathetic and said that I was the first person that this happened to, they explained to me that the hotel is fairly new, and they didn't know of any deaths in room 315. I really struggled with the idea of sharing our experience, I know that I would've liked to know if someone else had these weird experiences. Even after everything...we would stay in the hotel again, just not in 315.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: kiwipaul_8
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel about 3 months in advance.got a great rate.check in was very easy,great girl on front desk was very pleasent and gave a good welcome.room was ready despite me being early.room and bathroom was very nice and spotlessy clean.bed very nice and comfy.hotel is in a great location.about 1 block to fishermans wharf and about 5m walk to pier 39.heaps of places to eat and very nice food it is to. breakfast was pretty good and no shortage of choices,and heaps of tables..pancake machine very cool. would stay here again.recommend!! don't forget to go see the sea lions at pier 39.very funny and don't forget camera.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: drjandthemissus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 7 nights at the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman’s Wharf on a recent trip to San Francisco to see friends and tour the city. The room rate for a king bed averaged $160 per night (weeknights were slightly more, weekend nights were slightly less). A full breakfast was included (bacon, sausage, eggs, biscuits and gravy, hot cinnamon rolls, as well as pastries, fruit, coffee, tea, and juices). Quality of the food was consistently good. Wireless internet is available in the lobby free of charge; wired connections are available in-room free of charge. The room was clean, of reasonable size, and with new furnishings. The bathroom was not large, but was of adequate size and was spotless. Common areas are similarly clean, modern, and with new furniture. I would guess that the hotel has been built or renovated within the past two years. Staff were friendly and professional. One of the best features of the hotel, however, is simply its location. The hotel is located less than 10 minutes’ walk from Fisherman’s Wharf, Pier 39, the Alcatraz Ferry, Ghirardelli Square, both cablecar lines, and numerous tram and bus lines. The Golden Gate Bridge is viewable from several of these locations. This is a great location if you’re touring the city. In summary, this hotel provides unspectacular but consistent quality – it’s what you would expect at a nice, new Holiday Inn Express. Furthermore, the hotel charges a reasonable rate (in a very expensive city) and it has a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: denmartravelbug
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel...it was clean and within walking distance to the Wharf. There is a city hop on, hop off bus tour that picked up on the corner off the hotel, which was really convenient. The breakfast was a great start to the morning. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Hankaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in this hotel last September. It was so convenient to everything. And a full breakfast was included in the rate. We had no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel within walking distance of most attractions”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel25_11
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in San Fran. This hotel was great mostly due to its great location. The hotel was beautiful and offered a great complimentary Breakfast. Walking distance to fisherman's wharf, shopping, Ghiradelli square, Hyde street pier (where you can catch the trolley up Hyde street) The line can get really long to make sure you plan ahead if you want to ride the street trolley up Hyde street. We also walked to Lombard st and over to Pioneer Park to see Coit Tower (This was a pretty long walk up and down lots of hills but it was beautiful and a great way to see the city) It is also fairly close to the fairy terminal for Alcatraz tours. Hotel is great if you want to stay at a nice hotel for a decent price with in walking distance to all of these things. We felt safe at this hotel, but a few blocks over it was a bit sketchy. Make sure you look into that before booking your hotel. I was surprised to find that a very well known brand hotel was located in an area I would never stay in. Hard to tell the location when booking everything online.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: travelguy537
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night during a technical conference in San Francisco. This hotel was within 2 blocks of both cable car lines to Fisherman's Warf, and about the same distance to the Warf itself. Got great advice from the front desk for local muni buses and trolleys to get around the city without a car. Overnight parking at the hotel would have run $45. Breakfast was okay - eggs, bacon, sausage patties, pancakes, yogurt, cereal, breads, etc. Tube TV had problems with the remote. As others have noted, flat panels are cheap these days. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Clare C
Reviews.Content: Took my mum for her 60th birthday and we stayed in the express. The rooms were very good, hotel busy but then again it was Christmas but it had a very express feel about it. The breakfast was awful i recommend anyone staying there to eat out. The plates are paper with plastic knives and forks, coffee out of a machine and long queues into the area where the food is which on our visit consisted of a machine that made small pancakes, cereal section (best bit) and bread, bagels and one toasting machine. There is an area where the have strips of i am not sure as it certainly could not be called bacon, the egg was rehydrated and the biscuits and gravy had been sitting there for ages. The place was so busy to have such a small area for everyone to get their breakfast is crazy in the end we took what passed for food e,g, fruit, yogurt and ceral up to our room. The Holiday Inn down the road looked a lot better at least they had china plates.

Reviews.Title: “The Breakfast was great”
Reviews.Author: krbsmile
Reviews.Content: I was invited to go on this 5 day/4 night weekend to San Francisco with my boyfriend and his family. We had one suite and two rooms. There were 8 of us total. I had read some reviews on here and was not really sure how it was going to be. It did not really matter since I was not the one booking/planning. However, I was very impressed with the staff, location, complimentary breakfast and the room. It is a typical Holiday Inn Express with a very accommodating staff. If you want to be close to the Wharf I highly suggest this location. I did not have any noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, good value, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JennyPeter
Reviews.Content: Almost every year a group of us go to Sonoma to stay for 3 nights at the Cottage Inn B&B but on our way into town we stop in San Fran at the Holiday Inn Express for 2 nights to do things in the city. We have been doing this for years and find the hotel consistently good in all aspects. We talk a shuttle from the airport what drops us at the door, we can walk to just about everything from the hotel, great restaurants, attractions, super continental breakfast in the morning and the price is a good value for the city. We keep going back. They have corporate rates so check to see if your company has special rates there too.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Hiker114
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year's Eve here. We had enough points for a weekend stay. The front desk clerk gave us a little goodie bag, thanked us for being rewards members, then said she was giving us one of the best rooms. It think it was. We were on the third floor and outside of our window we had Alcatraz! We heard the fireworks, but couldn't see them. The room was a nice size as was the bathroom. We never had the hotel breakfast, but went down and saw they had the usual. By the Way...my husband swears that Holiday Inns have the worst coffee! Our room did have the Tube TV, which did not seem right. I've gotten used to the flat screens now, it just seems wierd to still see a tube TV. That's the only knock I have...if it's even a knock. A couple of other things I woudl like to mention. This was only the 2nd time I have ever been in San Fran. My first experience, while memorable, was not fun. This was much better. We flew into Oakland, and took the Bart to San Fran, then caught the rail/bus thing within a block of the hotel. We walked to the warf and ate IVARs Chowder (awesome) and walked over and ate chocolate at Ghirardelli. I know...I'm bragging. We caught the bus to ATT park, which is why were were there, to watch Illinois vs. UCLA. We ate dinner at the Fishermans' Grotto one night. The food was okay, but the view made it all the better. Clear night. We ate breakfast one morning at the Hollywood cafe, which next door to the hotel. That food was tasty! Oh, and I had my first ever In and Out Double Double burger. Just for the sake of saying that I've had a "double double".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Pier”
Reviews.Author: Lee D
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable rooms, breakfast was included which increase the value for money factor. This hotel is in a great location for the wharf and the hop on hop off bus, there are lots of places to eat close by as well as a Walgreens which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Blake311
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after I was displeased with another hotel I was staying at on the wharf. This hotel is down the street from the regular holiday inn, and was extremely nice. The hotel is newer and very, very clean inside. I found the staff to be very helpful with directions, requests, etc. The breakfast was just OK, but definitely had enough options for me to enjoy. The location of this hotel is absolutely fantastic and I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place @ the wharf”
Reviews.Author: Stua76
Reviews.Content: We love this place. Breakfast is decent and included in the cost. Staff were awesome with cleaning and the concierge let us park in the drive way for 20 mins until we could return the car. $30 for overnight parking is steep but thanks to other reviews on here we knew to not use the valet services. Walgreens is close and there is free wifi in the lobby free wired Internet in the rooms. As well as computers in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but probably wouldn't stay again..”
Reviews.Author: Glamgran56
Reviews.Content: The accommodation itself was perfectly fine, standard Holiday Inn. I was first given a dark room at the back, my request for another room was given without fuss. So my room was big, two beds, great shower and view of the SF skyline. BUT as with other reviews the breakfast was horrible, greasy and carby. Horrible looking burgers, horrible bacon, horrible eggs and some horrible looking goo that turned out to be gravy. GRAVY? A pile of bananas, and very sweet cereals. More fresh fruit is surely not too much to ask in a city where you can get any kind of cuisine. On the up side staff were very helpful, and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Foodeatersa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location with Fisherman's Wharf on your doorstep. Ask for a room facing inwards because the others are very noisy. The rooms at very small. From the photos the mini suites look like they can comfortable sleep 4 but they are too small. The sleeper couch couldn't even fold out. After moving the beds around a bit we managed to fold it out. It was disgusting and we couldn't use it. We needed to hire an extra room for the next nights we were there. The manager was very helpful in accommodating us with an extra room at a lower price. Breakfasts were very crowded if you don't get there very early. The Internet in the rooms didn't work, you needed to go to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mellytexas
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent. The room was rather small and it would have been nice if the sink was outside the toilet/shower area. One of the elevators wasn't working the weekend we were there so we used the stairs the majority of the time which sucked dragging luggage down them. We enjoyed the breakfast and it is funny someone commented on weak coffee because we thought it was awfully strong. The free internet was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice price”
Reviews.Author: jernesto55
Reviews.Content: We were at Fisherman's Wharf, the last december and stayed at the Holiday In Express. The experience was very good. The rooms were comfortables, the hotel staff was very nice, especially the counter girl named Brandy, who made us feel at home since the very first minute of our arriving. The breakfast (complementary) was very good. The complementary internet and the use of the lobby computers..OK. The MUNI transportation services were walking distance fron the hotel. I suggest the highest rooms, more quiets. Need more dust cleaning in the rooms. Walking distance from everything. I should return.

Reviews.Title: “just fair - "free breakfast" is an endless choice of processed fats & carbs”
Reviews.Author: WBM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to Fishermans Wharf and is therefore all tourists and families. That area is tacky tourists galore - so be prepared. The room was decent - and I got a great rate that included a free breakfast. Breakfast is on paper plates - in an area that was not well serviced. Witnessed a staff member open the carton of half-n-half by putting his bare fingers in the pour spout and pulling it open that way. The food is unhealthy, fatty, cheap and very processed - green/unripe bananas were the only fruit. Even the yogurt was a cheap, kid brand (full of sugar and artificial flavors and colors.) We skipped on all that and ate elsewhere. If you're on a budget and/or with family and want to stay in this area - I would reco. Otherwise stay over near Market Street / Union Square area -- it's a much better location with higher quality hotels. After two nights here, we moved to another (albiet more expensive) hotel in that area.

Reviews.Title: “nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: peetsheets
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco with family and this was a great meeting spot, close to the wharf, and with in walking distance to the cable cars. The hotel must have been filled to capacity, as the elevators were very difficult to get. We walked the stairs, but was unable to find our way back to the lobby without having to go outside, and back in the front door. Breakfast was good and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lesley h
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this hotel at the moment Exceptionally good value , the room ( and hotel ) is much better then I thought it would be , considering the price we paid ( around $99 /night ) We have a large room , the furniture is a good standard and looks new as does the rest of the hotel . The breakfast is more then adequate , but suggest you get down there early as it can get very busy . The location is good , in easy walking distance of many places / cable car stations or even the street cars which run along Fishermans Wharf then down Market Street to Castro ( you can get off along the route and walk to Union Square ) Fishermans Wharf is very 'touristy ' in places especially at night The hotel also provides free internet , its WiFi in the main areas and cabled in the room ( cable provided ) I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CraftingChris
Reviews.Content: Good location close to main Wharf area. Staff friendly and efficient. The room was spacious, well maintained and clea. The bed was really comfortable. There was some noise from people in the corridor on an evening. the complementary breakfase was good but the restaurant was very busy. This hotel is used by tour groups and there is a tendancy for large groups of pople coming down for breakfast together. Only disappointment was the free wifi is only available in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “ideally placed for Fishermans Wharf, the f Line and the cable cars to get to the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Davetheaddick
Reviews.Content: We booked this based on location and price as we were only stopping in San Francisco en route to Portland and the room was only intended as a place to sleep. The room was clean and of a standard Holiday Inn layout, the hotel is ideally placed for Fishermans Wharf, the f Line and the cable cars to get to the downtown area. We normally stay in the Holiday Inn along the road but have stayed in other Fisherman Wharf hotels and if you are planning on making the most of the San Francisco nightlife and only want somewhere to stay that is clean then this is worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Niksia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with 2 adults, 4 children in a studio suite. On entering, the lobby, public areas and the room looked well maintained. This hotel advertises free wifi, which it does but only in public areas. To access internet in room, you need to have a computer with an ethernet connection. As we only traveled with an ipod, we couldn't use this. The next issue we encountered, was that there is no laundry facilities in this hotel. You have to use the Holiday Inn facilities next door (Across the road, down the street). Where they only have 3 washers and 3 dryers (only 2 working) for 2 hotels. As we were travelling with children for two weeks we did accumulate some laundry. It was easier to buy new clothes. With the suite, we had a small refrigerator, but I believe this is not standard in all rooms. The televisions are still old box ones and one the one in the studio lounge room is located at ground level. Also in this room there is a coffee machine, but no power outlet to use it. You either have to take it into the small vanity in the bathroom or use the side table in the lounge room. It is small planning issues like these that really let the hotel down. Breakfast is simple are heavy in carbs and light on protein, but ok to get you going. Fisherman's Wharf is not the best place to be staying and if we returned, we would stay closer to Union Square. Homelessness in this area is rife and we felt quite unsafe to be walking around the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Leyongt
Reviews.Content: I always believe location is the key of any hotel. This hotel as well, it is quite near the famous fisherman whalf. The room is clean, and there are some gift and grocery store around. Overall very good!

Reviews.Title: “HIE's are good value for Biz Travelers who like a little extra”
Reviews.Author: K B
Reviews.Content: As I make way up California I've discovered that Holiday Inn Express is a good value for Biz. The included Internet Access, Breakfasts and upgraded rooms make for those little extras that make long stretches from Home a little more pleasant. InterContinental Hotel Group seems to hold their Peeps to a high standard in a manner that is successful...... Thanks Again !

Reviews.Title: “We stayed six nights in Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: Charles H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a room with a king size bed on the second floor. The room was clean and quiet. The free breakfast each morning was very good. There was a good selection of items to choose from and the eggs, bacon and sausage were better cooked than I have seen at some other hotels. The room was a little on the small size. However, the reasonable price that we paid for the room and the great location of the hotel more than made up for the small size. The hotel is located near Fisherman's Wharf, near various tour and boat rides, near many restaurants, and near two cable car routes to downtown. When we come back to San Francisco, we plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: mendoza830
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Thanksgiving weekend for 1 night so that we could go to Alcatraz. The location is great. It's close enough to walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The parking is 45 plus tax, expensive, but they let you know, so I planned for it and it's fine. It's San Francisco. Our room was on the 2nd floor, way at the end of the hallway. It smelled like a casino even though it was non-smoking. The room was decent size. The carpet was very much in need of a good cleaning. I Requested 2 extra blankets and sorry to say one had vomit inside of it when I unfolded it. I took it down to the desk and they were very sorry, the manager also called and aplogized. After that, the kids didn't want to sleep on the bedding. It was very uncomfortable the rest of the night and we were happy to leave in the morning. The breakfast was not so good, but hey, it's free. The manager on duty when I checked out, Stephen, was very nice and discounted the room and took care of the parking fee. The entire staff was very nice. I have nothing bad to say about them.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base - but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: j3tsetter
Reviews.Content: - Carpark cost $45 per night... Plus tax/tip = $120 for our 2 night stay. The receptionist was unable to do us any deals on this and disputed the fact my friend had got a deal when she was there earlier in the year. - Breakfast's only healthy item was banana, the rest was pre-made junk food- burgers, omlete, cinnamon buns still in their boxes straight from the freezer. All the drinks were sugar based & syrupy. Never seen anything like it in my life. I'm a 42 year old qualified chef. - The view was the windows of an adjoining concrete block, we could see something of a view, but as we'd specifically requested a high level room with a view, this was a disappointment. - The room was clean and the hotel is in a good location for fishermans wharf, that's what you're paying for here and that's all you get.

Reviews.Title: “Works just fine”
Reviews.Author: Nrhfamily
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, nothing fancy. However, this place was just what we needed. Affordable, comfortable and reasonable accommodations. Breakfast was lame but there is a wonderful little breakfast cafe next door. Hotel is close to everything (just about) too.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Courtcase
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here, the last time being 7 years ago. Nothing has changed but I have no complaints at all. The staff are friendly and very helpful and efficient, the location is fantastic, two blocks from Pier 39' two blocks from Safeway and other shops and a block from the bus into town. Getting around SF is so easy. The rooms are averaged sized but very clean. We are early risers so found no problem with getting a table for brekky, although we did comment how busy it was after 8am. Breakfast is not the Ritz but it offers cereal, toast, bananas, yoghurt, pancakes, bacon or sausage and yes, powdered scrambled eggs. However, if you are staying for a week as we did, we appreciated the saving on having to buy brekky each day. Overall there's very little to find fault with. Beds are extremely comfortable...a pleasant change from our stay in Thailand last year! My only complaint is the lack of wireless Internet in the rooms. There is an Ethernet connection but this is no good for using an iPad which a lot of travelers do now. There is wireless connection in the lobby but after a long day sightseeing we didn't really want to sit down in the lobby to use the Internet. The room TVs haven't yet been updated to flat screens. Overall though, its a reasonably priced, friendly and good hotel for the price, considering the excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location to Wharf Area”
Reviews.Author: Melanie S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night to check out Pier 39, Fisherman's Wharf and to go to Alcatraz. There is a parking fee of $40-$45 but most nice hotels have that in the area. The nice thing is you don't have to worry about your car when its parked in the garage and the hotel is a 1-2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed in a King Room. It was nice--nothing to jazzy or special but it did the trick. The breakfast in the morning was good as well. Staff was nice. I'm rating this place a 3 for some reason and I'm not quite sure why. I just didn't get that above and beyond service or warm fuzzy feeling. Nothing was really wrong either, it was just so-so to us.

Reviews.Title: “We expected more”
Reviews.Author: BelgiumItalialover
Reviews.Content: Plus : (1) Location is perfect if you are in SF as a tourist, (2) Room was kept very clean Minus : (1) Public hotel space as well as room were very worn out and urgently in need of an update, (2) Breakfast was very poor quality in a chaotic environment, and tables where not cleaned due to lack of staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location... skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bbcampbell
Reviews.Content: Really nice and clean. Good sized room. Missed having a fridge. A little bit out dated and needs modernizing but still very nice. Perfect location situated at the end of the tram line and walking distance to everything especially Pier 39 and Fisherman's wharf. Our booking included buffet breakfast. US buffet breakfast is very different to a breakfast buffet in Australia. Basically it was powdered scrambled eggs, sausage patty & scone/biscuit, yoghurt & banana's. Not what we expected. It was also really busy and so by the time you lined up and got some food it was being closed up. You had to fight to find a table and because of the mass amount of people there it wasn't the cleanest and obviously hard for the two staff we could see to maintain it. Again, fantastic location so perfect to stay at a very reasonable price for location and if you're not too interested in spending much time at your hotel. Make sure you go to the Holiday Inn Express not the holiday Inn.. They are two different hotels but for laundry we were sent to the other Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pazzags
Reviews.Content: Three nights in San Francisco at the Holiday Inn Exprees. Comfy beds, Freindly staff and an all you can eat breakfast from 6-30 till 9-30. Well located in the fishermans wharf region. Two minute walk to the world famous cable cars and a 15 min walk to Pier39 the happening place. Would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay....”
Reviews.Author: mollysussex
Reviews.Content: we stayed at HI Express 7th nov for 10 nights had a wonderful time, hotel very clean breakfast repeative but good, reception vert helpful and room was always clean got upgraded to a suite which was great brilliant location near to the wharf and pier 39 couldn't fault the hotel would stay here again.....

Reviews.Title: “Crowded”
Reviews.Author: romagerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October. Location is ok if you are ok at walking,if you struggle you will need a cab . The rooms are small and in need of updating. Breakfast times are very busy and you need to wait around for somewhere to sit before you get your food and that takes a lot of time as you will have to wait for each person in front of you to toast there bagals! . Overall its convenient but dont expect the usual standards of the' Holiday Inn' name.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: prash123
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a standard HI Express but it has a lot of annoying things to put people off. The air conditioning is noisy - so is the bathroom exhaust. The TV looked old in the age of flat screen televisions. No wireless internet in the room - just a wired one. You are out of luck with an iPad. But there is wireless in the lobby and a couple of free computers in the lobby. There is a touchscreen information facility near the computers but the touchscreen is dodgy. The room safe is key operated which is weird. No room fridge or minibar. The room did not have a view - you get a window facing other rooms. Breakfast is loaded with sugar. No healthy choices like oatmeal - brown bread was good quality though. Most hotels in California had oatmeal but this one did not. It can get very busy at breakfast - go early for a seat. Hotel is very clean and they are keen on composting everything. I found it strange as the breakfast was served in paper plates and cutlery was plastic. We booked a taxi the night before only to be told that there is no record of this when we had to go to the airport. Luckily it was early morning and there were taxis lining up outside the hotel. The Amtrak bus drop off point is close by and you can walk to hotel - looked safe at night. Just don't disturb the homeless on the streets. It gets a bit quiet at night. Anyway the charm of San Francisco made up for the hotel shortcmings. It is a beautiful city. We only had two full days but we saw so much of the city on foot. Don't miss the following whilst you are there: 1. Come to San Francisco by Amtrak - Amtrak train comes to oakland and their thruway bus (must be booked with the ticket) goes on the Oakland Bay bridge into San Francisco. The views from the bay bridge cannot be matched esp. at night. They will drop you at Fisherman's wharf where you can walk to the hotel. 2. Ghirardelli Square: You get great views of Golden Gate and Alcatraz from here. Very charming and a must walk from the hotel. 3. Fisherman's wharf: Not much to do here unless you like seafood. Walgreens is very close by for grocery, souvenirs etc (come out of hotel, turn right and then a right again). There is a McDonalds, Burger king, Chipotle etc. I'm a vegetarian - so ate at Gino's pizza and Chipotle. Boudin bakery is a must see for their wonderfully shaped breads. 4. Walk along the piers all the way to Ferry Building: A great walk and lively in the evenings. You'll find many people jogging and the views are fantastic. The night time view of financial district and bay bridge from Pier 14 is superb. 1 hour walk from the hotel at a slow pace. 5. Muir Woods, Sausalito & Golden Gate: Get a tour company to take you there from the hotel. Wonderful redwood and a charming town in Sausalito. They normally give you an hour at each place. Muir woods is always damp - take an umbrella and warm clothes. If you get motion sickness, sit in the front seat. The road is windy. 6. Alcatraz : We did not get time to do this but it is worth visiting. 7. Walk on Lombard Street all the way to crookedest street: It is a hilly walk - so wear good shoes. You also get great views of the city from Coit tower and Telegraph hill. 8: Ferry building: very nice charming place with views of the bridge. The shops sell some really good gourmet stuff. Yerba Buena garden was also very nice. The hotel receptionist will give you a map and I would say - just walk. You'll love the city and the views. Tip: Stay away from Tenderloin i.e don't wander off Geary and Market street (esp. at night).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Michel1030
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while visiting our daughter and were very happy. Great "walk to everything" location-- Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Sqaure. We asked for an inside room, which was very quiet. Expanded free breakfast buffet includes scrambled and hard boiled eggs, waffles, chipped beef, cold cereals, wide selection of breads and pastries, fresh orange juice, apples. Free computer use in lobby. Very small exercise room and no pool but guests may use the pool at the Holiday Inn next door. (But you will get plenty of exercise walking all over the city!) My husband thought the bed (we had a king) was more comfortable than the one we have at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Fridge?”
Reviews.Author: IdahoBill69
Reviews.Content: Great location and only 2 blocks from waterfront, trolley stop or F line, plus several great Irish and other bars. Super breakfast each day and nice big rooms. Kept clean and plenty of amenities if you needed anything. A large sightseeing company was adjacent to hotel and great sports bar at the Hyatt across the street with a 7 hour Happy Hour! Negatives were minor, but there was no coffee in the lobby after breakfast and no in-room refridgerators or microwaves. Been a long time since I encountered that in any hotel property. We took the SuperShuttle from Oakland, but the BART stops within 1/2 block on Market St and you could just as easily taken the F line right to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFool59
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed hotel, with upgraded rooms, furnishings, bathrooms. The hallways and port windows make you feel like you are on a cruise ship! Huge breakfast room for the complimentary buffet: well attended and restocked frequently, lots of seating. Close enough to the waterfront to walk to all attractions at Fisherman's Wharf: consider taking a taxi after dark. Free internet service with printers in the lobby. "Knuckles" Pub and restaurant across the street was good value and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel close to the Wharf.”
Reviews.Author: bluebonzoid
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. The hotel was very conveniently located within walking distance from the Wharf and any public transportation. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. I wasn't a big fan of keeping the coffee maker in the bathroom, but that's where it was. I didn't use it, and it cramped the room a little. Breakfast downstairs was very complete and good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travels6
Reviews.Content: Locale, locale, locale - this hotel was in the perfect location. We stayed for seven days in October and had our little infant with us. The hotel staff was wonderful. They put us in a quiet location and promptly changed out our mini-fridge when it was not working in order for us to keep our baby food cool. The breakfast spread was great but there are so many wonderful restaurants near the hotel within walking distance as well as a Safeway and a Trader Joe's grocery store. You can get anything you need within just a couple of blocks out of your hotel. There were things that the hotel did not have such as a pool or laundry facilities. But, it's an Express hotel - you shouldn't expect too much from one. Those amenities are located at the Holiday Inn if one really needs them. The two issues that we had with the hotel was the wifi was only located in the lobby and the hotel room doors were quite heavy and loud when allowed to shut on their own. Other than that, it is definitely a place to consider when traveling to Fisherman's Wharf!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: motmoody
Reviews.Content: the only let down was the breakfast..knuckles across the road is nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ruth035
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in San Francisco in October. Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf is a good location. Easy walk to Cable Car Stop and all Restaurants on the Whart. Rooms were clean and tidy and also added bonus of Coffee Machine in Room. This hotel also provides Breakfast which like most these days is self service. I thought it was one of the better ones and it had a Pancake Making Machine too. Nothing nicer than fresh Pancakes in the morning. Lots of other choices too. Certainly worth trying this place out, not the most expensive but certainly if you are looking for a good location down at the Wharf I would give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PattyBlank
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the hotel was that it was showing some wear in the rooms. The wallpaper was starting to peel off the walls and the glue was showing through. Our first room had a hole punched in the wall through the paper. Having said that, upon closer inspection, I saw that the room and bathroom were clean, as well as the rest of hotel. Upon entering our room, Joseph called from the front desk to see how we liked the room. When I mentioned the hole in the wall and the peeling wallpaper, he immediately offered another room. As I was leaving to go downstairs for the key to the other room, I was met by a pleasant woman with a clipboard who asked to see what the problem was with the room.
