We moved into the next room and enjoyed the comfortable beds, clean rooms and towels, and friendly staff. The only complaint I have is the $45.00 fee to park the car overnight. While the valets were friendly and always offered directional help, I feel the price was steep--especially when you add it on to the cost of the room. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and clean”
Reviews.Author: TheWinFin
Reviews.Content: Pros: Clean Quick and easy Great location Not too expensive Cons: Not luxury hotel isn't perfect and shows some age in hallways, etc... Bottom line: It's clean and simple. For the money you'll spend you'll get a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_027
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct 24-25 during a family road trip of California. We selected the Holiday Inn Express for location. We wanted something in Fishermans Wharf area for convenience in exploring this area and nearby Chinatown via cable car. We've travelled to San Fran as a couple in the past and used public transport and/or rental car to get around from hotels in less expensive areas. San Fran is *very* hilly for walking and hard to park and drive in. Some areas are unsafe for walking at night as well and it's easy to underestimate the length of excursions. With prior knowledge of this, and a toddler in tow we decided to simplify the trip by paying a little more to stay in a good location for exploring a select set of sights and leave the car parked. Do not confuse this hotel with the nearby Holiday Inn - they are two different properties. The difference with an Express is that they do not provide the full range of hotel services (eg. no pool, no concierge etc.) However, this doesn't mean it is chintzy. It is still an impressive property and has vallet parking, a free breakfast buffet (good, lots of selection) and small but nicely appointed rooms. The decor was nice - sort of a nautical theme. Everything was very clean and new looking. The cost for any hotel in the Fishermans wharf area is out to lunch and we wanted a reliable brand name hotel for safety and cleanliness with our toddler. We paid a sum that would be considered a fortune for some other places but from research I know to be quite modest for this location. Hence the Holiday Inn express surpassed expectations. I might try the regular Holiday Inn next time because our little boy loves to have a swim when we are no vacation. I belive there was some sort of arrangements to use amenties from the other hotel but we did not explore this further, being so busy with the many activities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cabman50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a Great location from which to explore San Francisco.  Close to the wharf and public transport.  The accommodation is modern, clean, and well kept with helpful and friendly staff. Our room was fairly basic but nice and had a large double bed. Free wi-fi was included for use in the lobby area.  The only real downside is the typical express breakfast, which at best is pretty poor. Finding a table to eat at can also be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Anconvet
Reviews.Content: Property was clean and conveniently located in Fisherman's Wharf. Employees were always friendly, courteous and helpful. Only negatives were that the Free Breakfast wasn's always good and the in-room internet requires a wired connection. The only WiFi available in the hotel is in the Lobby area

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: Retired8110
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn Express was above and beyond what I expected. The location couldn't have been better. We were within walking distance of pier attractions, pubic transportation, shopping and best of all the wonderful wharf restaurants. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Even the complimentary breakfast was far better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brandyb4
Reviews.Content: It was a nice place to stay in San Francisco although expensive. There was no fridge in the room but you could get one brought to you for an extra fee. The lobby area was very nice and the breakfast was average. Front desk staff was helpful and let us check in early. Wireless was only available in the lobby but you could plug in your laptop with an ethernet cable in the room. Room was a little small and we had no view but the bed was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Trojans9
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 10/19 -10/25. it was a very good place to lay our heads down. Freindly staff, great room. Always clean and neat when we returned. A bargain when you get complimentary breakfast. As breakfast is not cheap in this area. Just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. They were great in setting up all our tours for us. Would be my first choice when returning to the Bay area

Reviews.Title: “good location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aussiecocky
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Room a good size, clean and comfortable but we had no view. Even provided tea bags, a rare sight in US hotels we stayed in during our stay. Appreciated the hand rail in the bath/shower. Breakfast was good - we were a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews. Bananas, and plenty of them - they are a luxury item in Australia for the past 6 months. As our flight left in the evening, we appreciated the late check out and then they stored our luggage until the shuttle bus came late afternoon. We had an excellent experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and customer service”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaMcFly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and I highly recommend this hotel! I struggled with whether to give 5 stars or just 4 only because I feel the breakfast buffet could offer a more varied fresh fruit selection. Having said that, the hot food selection was very good for the number of people that I saw being fed each morning. We received a room upgrade that was totally unexpected. Our room had a good view and was large, clean and the beds and bathroom were comfy. But I really was impressed with the customer service - just outstanding! We had quite a few questions and requests for favors and they met them all. Oh and you can't beat the location. The hotel is close to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, cable car stops, etc. I've traveled to San Francisco many times and have stayed at different hotels. This is definitely one of the best that I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: daisyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Staff was exceptional. Helpful and very pleasant. We had a suite. Our room was overlooking the street in the front of the hotel, 2nd story. We were surprised that it was not noisy. We enjoyed watching the traffice and people on the street. Our room was very clean and comfortable and up to date. In fact the entire hotel was kept very clean and neat at all times. Our bed was comfortable. The bath was very nice and plenty of hot water. The breakfast was included, the coffee was very good. Breakfast was same everyday and not too exciting. Usual hotel breakfast. It was great to get off the elevator and have breakfast. It was quick that way and we did not have to decide where to have breakfast. Location of the hotel was terrific. Very close to the wharf and all sites in the area. Only 1 block away from a cable car turnaround and 1 block to the f line trolley. We walked everywhere and used the MUNI pass to get around for further adventures. The bus stops are only a half block away for further ventures, such as the Golden Gate Bridge Park for the museums and other sites at the park. Only 1 block to Walgreens where you can purchas a MUNI pass. I would recommend this hotel. Only thing is it is not inexpensive. We paid more probably because we upgraded to a suite and it was Columbus day weekend and Fleet week. We had a great time and are planning a return trip next year. daisyCalifornia

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: MAT1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on our California honeymoon road trip. Check-in was quick and easy. Our room was small but clean and cozy. Lovely king bed was very comfortable. Overall hotel decor is modern and up to date. Location was fantastic, really close to the Wharf, Alcatraz, streetcar stops, Ghirardelli square, and lots of great restaurants at all price points. Hotel is attached to an amazing bike rental place where you can get an electric bike for less than $50 for the whole day. Completely worth it as these bikes let you traverse the hills of San Francisco with minimal effort. Definitely agree with reviews regarding breakfast - the food was absolutely abysmal and inedible. It was also insanely busy! Thought it would be a perk of staying here, but we should have believed the reviews. In terms of value, this hotel is pretty pricey for what you get, but that seems to be how all hotels are in San Francisco. Overall we'd stay here again or recommend it to a friend with the caveat to not expect much at breakfast time.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: yupster
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed for 4 nights in two rooms. Double beds only. Originally the kids were in a room at the other end of the floor to us. They moved them closer on the 2nd night by holding a room for us during the day. Good service. We thought breakfast was fine with good variety. Perhaps some fresh fruit beyond banana's would be good. Scambled eggs were always dried out. Everything else was good and even if it was crowded, we never had any problems getting a table. Not sure why they use disposable paper bowls/cups and plastic cutlery? Close to Fishermans wharf (but not too close), Alcatraz cruises, cable car, bike hire, Pier 39 etc... We went up the street to the other Holiday Inn so the kids could have a swim. My wife and I went down to the common area on the 1st floor a few nights to let the younger child go to sleep. Read and use the laptop, always nice and quite down there. Overall a good hotel with attentive, competent staff. Looks like it's been renovated recently. Would recommend. Other Holiday Inn might be better for children only because of the pool. Had a great meal at a restaurant called "Pier Market" on Pier 39. Food, service and view were very good. Make sure you ask for a window seat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: SP1979
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for three nights in early October. Great location at Fisherman's Wharf. Room was clean, and we actually had a view of the Bay, including Alcatraz. Most rooms will not have a view, however, as many are interior rooms facing eachother. Free breakfast each morning was great, and only once was there a line (we were down there by 7am each day). Many choices for breakfast: eggs, pancakes, sausage, bagels, toast, english muffins, cereal, yogurt, and more. No restaurant on site, but the Hollywood Cafe next door offers take out for breakfast/lunch. This hotel is an excellent value and worked perfect for our family. Will definitely stay here on any return trips to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better”
Reviews.Author: MildredCambridge
Reviews.Content: On a recent work/vacation trip around U.S.A. we stayed in Holiday Inns in Cambridge Mass, Manhatten and then this one. We saved the worst 'til last. The room was o.k. a good size and comfortable enough, didn't like having the coffee maker (but at least there is one!) in the bathroom so re located it. Wish Holiday Inns could provide bathrobes as we all have to travel so light when flying. As we were on 3rd floor we felt we could have used the stairs instead of hanging around for the lift but couldn't find them! Having travelled for a while we appreciated the laundry, would have appreciated it a lot more if one had been located on site instead of in the basement of the sister hotel up the road. They could also provide a few laundy baskets in there. Make sure you've got plenty of quarters if you want to use it, the receptionist did help me out with change. We also appreciated the business centre for free printing off of boarding passes, but free wifi in guest rooms would be so useful. The breakfast is held in a dark lobby with nasty mustard coloured net curtains, which add to the gloom, at the rear of the ground floor. It was a complete scrum so we didn't bother, the Hollywood Diner 3 mins down the road does a really good breakfast for a reasonable price. This hotel seems to cater for coach parties which maybe why the hotel breakfast is so over subscribed. The location of the hotel is quite handy although Fisherman's Wharf seems a lot more seedy than we remembered. San Francisco clearly has a big homeless problem, more than we noticed in other cities, with many sad & broken down drunk or drug addled people begging and sleeping on the streets. It is a very distressing and sad thing to see in one of the world's wealthest countries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room but not great services”
Reviews.Author: Zilzi
Reviews.Content: The location of the Holiday Inn Express, SFO was fantastic. Easy five minute walk to Fishermans Wharf, easy access to tours and to the cable car and public transport. The room was large and room and clean. There was a coffee maker (which was located in the bathroom next to the toilet - yuck!) Moved this to the main room away from bathroom, great to have but a shame there was no fridge for milk or other supplies. Breakfast compliementary - but very lacking. Scrambled eggs must have been powdered, as they were lumpy and tasteless, and the rest of the breakfast left a lot to be desired. No other meals or facilities for meals or snacks provided in the hotel. No laundry facilities available - unless you walked up the road to the Holiday Inn on the corner. They appeared to have much more in the way of facilities when I went there to do laundry. A pool, restuarant, small shop etc. That on hindsight would have been my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but offers less than most holiday inn express'”
Reviews.Author: applestrudel
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Great location, with easy access to the bay, fishermans whalf and all the aminities of the city. The negatives are it offered so much less than other holiday inn express hotels. There was no coffee available throughout the day, no onsite laundry and the rooms were just so tiny. Just big enough to hold the kingside bed and little else. The bed was so hard and could not manage to get a good night sleep at all. Breakfast was ok, but lines far to long no matter what time of the morning you arrive. I think it was down to poor placement of the pancake maker and toaster. It held everyone up, would be far better if these were placed in a different location. Expect to pay $45 Per day for parking, cheaper parking lots available near by. Overall good clean hotel, put lacking the little extras.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect much”
Reviews.Author: gavandgracey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel for our honeymoon. I really wished we had not. It is definitly not a hotel I would recommend to honeymoon couples. We checked in and were told to leave the hotel walk around the corner and our room would be at the other part of the hotel. I was shocked, we were not offered help with luggage and the directions we were given were certainly not clear. I returned to the receptionist and explained I did not want to have to walk that far to get to the main desk and also we were on honeymoon. She did move our room. Rooms are fine, clean and comfortable. We ate breakfast one morning. It was far too expensive over $21 per person. Definitly not worth it and the desk staff at the restaurant are loud and not very pleasant. Location is fine, you are in walking distance of Fishermans Wharf, but I would rather stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: poppytigi
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel if you are wanting to stay in the Fisherman's Wharf area of San Francisco. Just one street back from the main drag, in a safe and clean area. Very friendly reception team who offer lots of advice and help. FREE use of two computers and a Board card printing service FREE. Good size bedrooms nicely furnished with a good supply of Coffee & Tea making facilities. Plush towels and adequate toiletries in the shower & bathroom. Daily maid service. Breakfast is a all you can eat buffet with cereals, yoghurts, pancakes, cooked breakfast, juices, hot drinks, toast, bagels and Danish pastries. Short 3-5 minutes walk to the famous Tram stop that will take you direct up town to Union square and just beyond. Two doors away a tourist information and tour booking office, Hire bikes, get a tour or see a show. Lots and lots of restaurants from fast food, typical American diners, Jazz bars to gourmet food restaurants, Lots of directions from the hotel: walk down to Pier 23 to catch the Alcatraz boat trip. 8 mins to Pier 39, 15 mins to China town, 20 mins to central town. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location at Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Christy31069
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with spacious rooms and had a great view of Alcatraz, when the fog cleared, from our window. Stayed for four nights from 21 September. Breakfast is free but poorly organised with crowds of people wandering aimlessly trying to get their breakfast and find a vacant seat. Pancake machine was great and enjoyed my pancake breakfast each morning. Fisherman's Wharf is the perfect place to be located and is close to the various tourist attractions. Only worry about Fisherman's Wharf is the amount of homeless people which was a bit distressing for me. Holiday Inn spoiled our stay at the end by charging us $800 for four nights parking instead of $200 (yes $50.00 a night for your car to sit in the car park is a bit steep). It took us hours to get a refund which delayed our drive to San Diego but a big thanks for the girls at the front desk who assisted us in fixing their manager's mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cooperr61
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1pm and had three days in the city. Check-in was a pleasure and I was in my room in 10 minutes. As it’s an “Express” there is no room service or pool but there is a full service Holiday Inn next door. Fisherman’s Wharf is down the street and most attractions are within walking distance. The hotel arranged a mini-fridge to keep the beers cold and there’s a Safeway supermarket just two blocks away. It’s a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Lvisco
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one thing going for it -- the location, that is, if you want to be near the wharf. The staff were disinterested, the elevators were not in working order and the only way up and down was via steps -- that took you through the kitchen/prep area. No signs, no help from the staff. The breakfast area was messy and understaffed every morning. We've stayed at many of these express hotels and they are usually much better run than this one -- find another property to stay if your destination is the Fisherman's Wharf -- there are many, many to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot in the Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Bennyboy08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf for three nights. Fisherman's Wharf is the seaside touristy spot selling the usual souvenirs and tacky goods but also a good point to stay in and venture out from in San Francisco. The hotel itself is located in a block quite close to the other Holiday Inn hotel (do not confuse the two) and is well run with welcoming staff upon check in. The room we had was basic. Normal hotel layout, bed, desk, television. The room did look a bit dated and our window (not streetside) looked out to a small courtyard which honestly looked like a prison solitary confinement exercise courtyard, so do not expect a view of anything pretty. The bathroom was a large size, with a bath/shower. The housekeeping were very thorough, coming daily to replace towels and also bathroom items such as shampoo etc. The hotel does provide free of charge any other toiletry item you may have forgotten to bring. Outside of the room, the hotel was modernly decorated. We had breakfast included in our stay which is served in a seating area next to the lobby. Breakfast consisted of the normal hot and cold items, come early as the queue for it did get quite long and there seemed to be less tables to guest ratio. There is wifi available but only in the lobby area on the ground floor. There is also an area providing computer/internet and printing facilities. We had no complaints to make about the hotel. It was a good base for us to come and go and the staff and housekeeping staff were polite and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: steve t
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed for 4 nights in sept, we were there the 1st - the 5th the hotel an staff were excellent the staff went out of their way to make your stay comfortable an enjoyable. the staff was very pleasant, always smiling and very helpful. they were able to tell us the easiest ways to get around the area. it just seemed like they took pride in helping us. the room was always spotless as was the rest of the hotel. the breakfast was way better than expected, lots of choices, all fresh foods, and plenty of food. it was a true breakfast buffet. they even had free internet access via PC's in the lobby i can not say enough about how professional, pleasant an helpful the staff was we will always stay here when we go to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Roddlez
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express, not to be confused with the nearby Holiday Inn is a good, basic, clean hotel in a great location only about 4 minutes walk to Fisherman's Wharf and great places to eat, as well as the F MUNI line. In particular: 1. Friendly service at check-in. 2. Rooms are clean. 3. Bed is comfortable. I suffer from a sore back so I should know. 4. Breakfast is provided for free. It is basic, consisting of various cereals, fruit, coffee and tea, juices, pastries, eggs and bacon and other meats, bread, toast and spreads. Served between 6.30 and 8.30, get there early or you'll find it hard to get a table. 5. Free wifi is provided in the lobby. This had download and upload speeds of about 7mb/s. It dropped out sometimes on my iPad. Rooms also have cable Internet. 6. My room didn't have a fridge, but you are provided with an ice bucket and there is a free ice-vending machine. 7. Shower pressure is not high but it heats up quickly. All in all, a nice experience. I was there from 21-25 September, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KeithfromPattaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 15th to 22nd September. This is a very good 'hotel' which should be looked upon as more of a bed and breakfast establishment. There is no bar or evening entertainment. The location in right in the middle of everything you could want. There are lots of places within a five minute walk where you can eat or listen to music etc. I had a room on the 4th floor in the middle of the hotel which was spacious, clean and quiet. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel if you want good value for money. Excellent staff. The plug sockets in the room are 2 flat and one round pin but two flat pins work OK

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable accommodation in an excellent location just a short walk from all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions. Conveniently located near Cable Car, Street Car routes and close to many shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but ......”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in September. Good location alongside other major hotel chains; in close proximity to the Wharf and public transport. Reception staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast is an issue: not the greatest of choices; no seating available if you arrive at a 'normal' hour; and they close the doors at 9.30 prompt! Lack a little personal touch too. Gave staff advance notice of this being our 30th wedding anniversary. Would have been nice to have received an acknowledgement, even if it was just on the tv screen.So maybe it isn't a hotel to choose for a special occasion?

Reviews.Title: “Nice property with great location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony G
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel when going to Giants games. It's just a block from the 30 Stockton bus which takes you to AT&T Park. There's a Safeway, Walgreens, Trader Joe's nearby as well as many places to eat. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. Have never had their breakfast buffet as i prefer to go out for breakfast. I'll continue to stay there as i know the service will always be outstanding!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value choice”
Reviews.Author: Tigger103
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights - our first stop of a 18 day fly drive holiday. We were very pleased with this hotel which is perfectly situated at Fishermans Wharf. As other reviewers have said breakfast can get quite hectic - but we found going early helped miss the crowds - no problem for a newly arrived tourist from the UK adjusting to the time difference! Don't expect china crockery or metal cutlery though, its paper and plastic instead. Our room was probably one of the smallest we had throughout the holiday and the view was pretty poor but that didn't concern us as we wanted to make the most of seeing San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: chunerrrr
Reviews.Content: For a tourist visiting San Francisco for the first time, you can't beat Fisherman's Wharf. All the tours leave a couple of blocks away and two cable car lines and the F line are all nearby. Like many other reviewers mentioned, breakfast can get busy. Consider the location and the touristy nature of the destination the room is probably not the worst. Very friendly front desk staff. Would definitely recommend for a first time visitor to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast buffet in need of some decent management”
Reviews.Author: Ally CB
Reviews.Content: The location is great - within a short walking distance to the main attractions of Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel itself is modern, clean and comfortable. My main gripe is with the breakfast: it was absolute chaos. All the food, both hot and cold, is together and entails a long queue to get to it. This is ridiculous! Cold food should be on one side and the queue just for the hot food. The fact that everyone needs to queue for the toaster, also points to the fact that other sorts of bread should be available such as rolls. The whole breakfast needs putting into shape. It really isn't that hard to provide a decent one, even if it is "free".

Reviews.Title: “clean room but NO internet in room”
Reviews.Author: DeborahCambridge
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious but the lack of internet in the room I think in this day and age is appalling. Having just stayed in other Holiday Inn Express in Boston and NY where there was internet it came as more of a shock. Speed of internet even in foyer was poor. Breakfast was included in price but was quantity over quality. I will not stay here again as it is impossible to function on business trip if you have to dress to go downstairs to send an email!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: AW54AbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are excellent, very comfortable beds, quiet and spotlessly clean. Lack of Wifi in the rooms was annoying The breakfast buffet was hit and miss, badly laid out so a long wait to get food. The bacon and sausage were awful. Only other complaint was the lifts which took forever, couldn't find the stairs!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: julie0773
Reviews.Content: We had been to sfo and had stayed here.The location is very good. We were able to get the cable car and the taxis easily.We enjoyed our stay here.the rooms are spacious,airy and neat and clean.The property is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, no wireless in the rooms, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mccafjohn
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, remodeled, small rooms and no wirless connection on the room. We use iPads, therefore we had to go to the loby for the wireless signal or tether the 3g from our phones. The 3g Verizon signal was also slow. Good decent breakfast with lots of choices to get you started. Eggs like mentioned but very edible. Centrally located, get a transit pass. Close to cable cars, street cars, ferrys, buses, Ghiradelli's and can walk to pier 33 ferry landig for Alcatraz. Only 3 stars due to no wireless in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, a few minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: pigsmilk
Reviews.Content: Just finishing our stay here (with 3 yr old). Booked based on location and reviews. Overall, it was a good stay. The location is great and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We were pretty much able to walk to all the places we wanted to go, but it was far enough off the main area of Fisherman's Wharf to keep us clear of constant noise and foot traffic. My two complaints:that the walls allowed noise to come through that I felt should have been prevented..number two was breakfast..the free hot breakfast was one of the selling points for me due to traveling with a small child, and it was definitely sub-par. I fully understand that it is a mass produced buffet, so I was not expecting the Ritz. However, it seemed like most of the items were lacking of flavor and rather bland. I also thought the choice of dishes were lacking. It really wasn't very good. I would stay here again based on my overall experience, but I would first look at other places in the area that include breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: NancyMinooka_IL
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of many attractions including the cable cars. Clean and comfortable with friendly, helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast is better than average and helps reduce cost of daily meals.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn_MK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a triple centre holiday including Las Vegas and LA. Really enjoyed my stay, rooms were clean and comfortable and had everything you needded, they were cleaned daily and had plenty of storage space. Location couldn't have been better, only a few moments walk to the shops and restaurantrs and Fishermans Wharf. The on site diner isn't very nice but that might just be because us Brit's can't do pancakes for breakfast! Staff were very friendly, the virgin rep was also really lovely and helped us with all aspects of our trip. I can't really fault the hotel, was just right for what we wanted!

Reviews.Title: “cancellation and extra charges”
Reviews.Author: rich396
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservations in June of this year we had no reason to think we would not be able to keep our vacation plans for San Fransisco and northern California. I had a medical problem that would keep us from our reservations so I phoned in July to cancel our reservation and was informed that the cancellation policy is the full price of the room for both nights, over $500! Horrible cancellation policy! Then there is the extra charge for a small refrigerator that might hold a bottle of wine and a couple of bottled waters that costs $5 a day and the maintenance man brings the fridge to your room. Lastly, it took 10 minutes to check in and we were first in line behind two other couples checking in, I would not recommend this hotel and we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HoagyCo
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to San Francisco and were glad we stayed at this place. It is conveniently located a 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf and the F-line light rail to the city. The room was clean, spacious and well appointed. The free wi-fi throughout the hotel was appreciated. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful. Complimentary breakfast in the lobby area is provided but it pays to get there early as there are limited tables. Try Knuckles across the street for a reasonably priced meal, and Boudin's Bakery on the wharf (especially upstairs for happy hour). Would definitely return here next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: Suzy044
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Express hotel. It's fine, but nothing more. There are no facilities within the hotel itself - an outdoor pool is at the Suites part and maybe other things but we didn't bother. And to be fair, in a town like San Francisco, you're not there to spend time in the hotel so it doesn't really matter. But, the hotel is a bit soulless and I guess that's what you get from something like a Holiday Inn Express. We chose it because it had ok reviews and offered breakfast and as we are a family of five thought it a good option - but - the breakfast is awful. It's a mad scrum for the dreadful food (rubbery eggs regardless of whether they were scrambled or as an omelette), and hordes of people shoving to pile it all up (and quite a few seemed to be packing it into their bags too) and not enough tables. It was so bad in fact that we ate at the Hollywood cafe next door on our last day. On a good point, the rooms are kept clean and the reception staff are friendly and helpful (especially Brandy/Randy - sorry, can't remember your name as suffering from jet lag but she was just superb from helping us storing our cases during the day as we had a night flight to offering advice on buses!). So to summarise, it's fine as a base and the location is great, but if you think you're going to spend some time in the hotel choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “all fine here”
Reviews.Author: Bogueyman
Reviews.Content: does what it says on the tin / you would expect - good location, clean and tidy ( bathroom blinds need a good dust though ) - friendly staff / good size room. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was close to Fisherman's Wharf and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: 11brenda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf for 3 days. The hotel was very clean, the staff was always willing the help with any questions we had. The continental breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: JAM1London
Reviews.Content: We were alocated a room above the reception area and I thought that noise would be an issue. Although we heard the engines of the coache's parked outside it really wasn't too bad - I've experienced worse in other hotels! Our mini suite was spotless and comfortable enough for 2 nights. The location was fabulous. We could walk within 5 minutes to Fisherman's Wharf. We were also about a 5 minute walk to the cable car. We arrived there about 9am, and there was no queue. However, when we walked by later on in the day the queue was really long. We caught the cable car to Union Square, which is great for shopping. However most of the large shops do not open until 10am. Breakfast at the hotel was good considering it was included in the price. We always managed to get a table. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful - thank you.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok.”
Reviews.Author: cdcmgc
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a comfortable room. The breakfast was fine. However, in spite of the fact that we required a handicapped room as my husband is ill with cancer, there was NO One to help with the luggage. When we asked they said, "This is a limited service hotel." We have stayed at multiple Holiday Inn Express hotels all over the country. We have never had this happen before. In addition, the icemaker did not work and no one could help us with that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL79
Reviews.Content: Basic Hotel but all you need for a base In a good location for access to all parts of the city Small but clean pool

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: ststephens97
Reviews.Content: Experience tainted by poor breakfast arrangements and poor attitude of staff, paying $400, yes $400 for a nights' stay one would expect a decent breakfast at least- not at all, i was yelled at by an angry mexican looking man when i tried to prop open the main door into the breakfast area- he yelled, "Mister close that door!!! was shocked at being spoken to like this from someone representing a major chain like Holiday Inn, this man then began hurriedly removing breakfast items when i was already in line. i was one of several people at the reception desk complaining about breakfast-at least I got the $50 parking fee waived. DONT STAY HERE, THEY DO NOT VALUE YOUR CUSTOM, BREAKFAST IS RUBBISH AND YOU PAY THROUGH THE NOSE TO PARK!! STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kay S
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the money. The location was an ideal central location and very easy access to the trolley, muni and city buses. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was good but sometimes a little crowed during peak hours of the morning. The front desk staff could be a little more knowledgable on the restaurants and on general questions about the area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pick”
Reviews.Author: Koko99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 night in the start of our 2 weeks california road trip. I booked it through hotwire for a really good price and it was one of the best hotels of the trip. Location is central, we did almost everything by foot, if not we rented bikes. Tip : just don't go to fisherman's warf, it is way too crowded and there is not that much to see. Do: hike up Russian hill, see lumbar street while you're there and grab a bite at Za pizza, it was a magnificent way to finish the day. We also rented bikes for one day, went to tour the city, passing in the golden gate park, coming back by the shore and crossing the golden gate bridge to finish with ice cream in sausalito before taking back the ferry to fisherman's wharf. Perfect day for people who are already in shape because you do have a lot of hills to go. Back to the hotel, the room was clean and modern, it was perfect for us. As for the breakfast, i read other reviews complaining about that and don't understand. It is a free breakfast, so don't expect caviar on your toast. For our part we found it really good, with everything you need to start your day : coffee, toast, cereals, eggs, yogurt, etc.. And if you want a quiet breakfast, go early. We ate there 3 days and never had to wait for anything. Tip: go early! You are in San Francisco by the way, there is no time to sleep in, so much to see :) Would definitely come back or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: keshla65
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two nights at the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco.  What a disappointment!  I've stayed at various Holiday Inn Express hotels and have never regretted it until now. To begin with, because of the location this hotel is not cheap --- you are definitely paying for the location, two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf.  This did not surprise us and we were prepared to pay for the proximity.  However, I was surprised at what we experienced at check-in.  Although the parking is all valet, guests are charged $45.00 (PER NIGHT!) to park in the hotel garage!  I find this outrageous, even though public parking in the area is expensive.  If the only people parking there are guests of the hotel, why are guests charged as much as if they are parking in a public lot?  At the check-in desk the clerks were busy, distracted, and somewhat dismissive.  When I asked for help with our bags I was informed, with a roll of the eyes, that because this was an "Express" hotel, there were no bellhops.  However, I saw several staff members who seemed dressed as bell hops pushing carts of luggage to and from the elevators!  We had to wait nearly 20 minutes for a luggage cart to become available so we could cart our baggage to our room. As for the room, it was tiny with a lovely view of the roof and air ducts.  The bathroom was also tiny, with a toilet so "low-flo" that it took 2 or 3 flushes (so much for water conservation).  The bed was adequate and the room was quiet. The free breakfast buffet was also a big disappointment.  The breakfast area is extremely small, considering the number of rooms the hotel has.  And the food was blah, at best.  Better to walk around the corner to Denney's and spend a few dollars than fight the crowds in the dining room for a rubber egg, overcooked bacon, and a stale bagel. We would definitely not return to this hotel, nor would we recommend it to friends traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: texas100
Reviews.Content: Close to the Wharf. Good location. Staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, poor breakfast facility”
Reviews.Author: tony7
Reviews.Content: stayed here on monday for 2 nights right on the wharf, really nice clean, efficient, only downfall was the breakfast, standing in line for 20 mins is not my idea of customer service, we stood for 35 mins on the day off our departure, as the was a convention in and the just brushed passed everyone as if invisible!! my first reaction was of disbelief, then anger, i paid good money to stay here and these people come in and walk past as if were nothing!!!i shouted that there was a line here, and was ignored, at checkout, i was asked if i enjoyed my stay, i replied yes, apart from the breakfast line to which the reply was yeah i know, its bad... incredible!!! knowing its bad and doing nothing is lacklustre service to me, so will stay somewhere else next time.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, breakfast line incredibly long!”
Reviews.Author: nancyk4
Reviews.Content: Stayed right in the heart of tourist area, blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, the waterfront area. Room was very nice, hotel staff very friendly. My only complaint was waiting in line for 30 minutes for breakfast. With the number of people in this hotel there was only one line for breakfast. I can't believe that someone hasn't looked at this problem and addressed it with multiple lines/stations for breakfast. This is why I wouldn't come back here. What a waste of a morning waiting for food. My husband and I thought the beds were also very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kellis18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and have a few comments. Typical Holiday Inn witht the breakfast component. When they say it closes at 9:30 they aren't kidding. A guy will come and shut the doors, take away the cream and milk, turn the coffee machine off, he is nuts about this....very determined to STOP everything right at 9:30 and starts the closing down process about 9:20 and won't let you in to get the last bit of food....very strange as they are only going to throw it out. The location is very close to fishermans wharf and we found it a perfect location. We walked next store to the other Holiday Inn and did a washing which was nice. However, we decided to have breakfast at their hotel which was good but cost us 50.00 before tip and tax which was crazy....that was for your basic 2 eggs, bacon toast coffee and OJ. Some how the crazy mess at the Holiday Express was not that bad, lol We took the hotel shuttle to the airport from the other Holiday Inn and the driver was again...crazy...cursing, driving very fast and tried to fit 10 people in....however the last two declined to get in and said "this guy is crazy" all the guests in the van commented on his fast driving. He should maybe find another job where driving in traffic is not involved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Whitzs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is a great value. I took my parents to San Francisco as their Christmas present and this was a great place to stay. It is steps from fisherman’s wharf, Ghirardelli square and easy access to the cable cars. This hotel is very well maintained, clean and the staff was very easy to work with. A great advantage to booking this hotel is the ease and convenience of the continental breakfast, which could be especially valuable for a family. The only downside was parking at the hotel was $45 per night, however, all parking at the hotels in the area was comparable. We would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for San Fran stay”
Reviews.Author: TheGirls17
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here while on our wedding/honey moon from Australia. We had a really good look at all areas in san fran of where to stay and thought union square of fishermans wharf. After reading other reviews we went with fisherman's wharf and i was glad we did . Union square is great and there is lots of shopping and if thats what your holidays is about then def stay there . But we wanted to experience San Fran and take it all in. We visited Union square and the shopping of course, but fishermans wharf was great lots of funky little places to look and eat at .. We had been upgrading our rooms when we arrived at all of our hotels but found there was little to upgrade to with the holiday inn hotels , except to a family room , which unfortunately wasnt available. We were on a 7 week trip and i think this was prob our least lavish and least expensive hotel so didnt expect much but it was pretty good. We did ask for a non smoking room , went up to the room to find out it had been smoked in and smelt heavily , we went down to reception and they organised a non smoking room 2nd time round was all good . Ok room was small , and no view at all except... for other hotel rooms , but wasnt a big deal. There is no wireless in the bedrooms but the pay of is its free in the foyer... Breakfast was included in the room rate , and was yummy lots to choose from and a great place to fill up before a day of tourist attractions. We ended up hiring a car for a day just so we could drive around a little and we had tickets to go to a football game and didnt want to get public transport out there , it was cheap and would highley recommend it , although driving up those hills where kinda scary lol The holiday inn hotels dont pretend to be anything there not , its a basic hotel with basic rates and facilities. I always think when i write these reviews , would i stay here again. Yes i def would , loved the location , was clean and nice and didnt cost the earth ! Thumbs up ! Just wish they had wirless internet in the rooms !! its a must these days ...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: StephWolf
Reviews.Content: Overall my family and I had a wonderful stay at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites San Francisco at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel rooms were neat and clean. The free breakfast in the morning was decent, enough to get us started in the morning. The front desk was also very accomodating to us when we found out that our travel agent had accidentally booked one of the guests in our party at the Holiday Inn next door! They immediately resolved the situation and had the reservation transferred. The location was also within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf which was nice. My only complaint would be the outrageous parking fees which with taxes came to around $50 a day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: funlovingcouple157
Reviews.Content: First off, don't make the same mistake that we made with this hotel. USE PUBLIC TRANSIT!! The bus literally pulls up in the front of the hotel and can take you anywhere in the city. With the use of a PDA, it was easy to navigate around the transportation network using the GPS on our phones....just use the public transit option. Back to the hotel...it is located in the middle of everything!! We found the hotel rooms spacious, the hotel staff was willing to help and assist in any way possible, and the computer that had printers hooked up came in extremely handy. This hotel is literally two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf going one direction. Heading the other way is Ghiradelli Square and all the great shops/restaurants in that area. We loved this hotel and all that San Francisco had to offer. Use the public transit to save yourself from going up and down those insane city streets, enjoy Fisherman's Wharf, and take in some of the great restaurants on Columbus Ave.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the city, one of the best in the world.”
Reviews.Author: RitaGurgaon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a convenient walk from the fisherman's wharf, one of the happening places in the city. You can stroll down to Pier 39 or 41 and take your city sight seeing tours and the cruise. It is also very close to the tram station. The break fast is sumptous but the hotel could do with some variety rather than serving the same stuff daily. There is an Indian restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: juliemj
Reviews.Content: Perfect home base for our vacation in San Francisco. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, the Ferry Building down the Embarcadaro, Chinatown, Little Italy and Coit Tower. please note: we love to walk and are in pretty good shape. Others might find public transportaion easier on the feet. The hotel was great and staff very well informed. Wasn't crazy about the breakfast, though. If you didn't get there early there were long lines and all the hot food was stone cold. Stayed for four nights, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: PerthFrequent_Flyer
Reviews.Content: I think that the hotel was very pricey for what was offered but it is very convenient for Fisherman's Wharf and the cable car turn-around. The hotel was average and the rooms were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you absolutely want to stay around Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Drarig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Holiday Inn two nights in a recent trip in California. I understand that this location is at the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and that it attracts a significant number of tourists, so you have to be ready to pay a premium (plus if you have a car, add $50/day) to stay at a 'decent' Holiday Inn. My room on the 4th floor was clean and quiet. Check-in process was efficient but with no frills, as the lobby was buzzing with customers waiting to get their room. The breakfast area in the morning is a mess, especially at peak time (between 7h30 and 8h30). Next time in San Francisco, I will pick a more quiet neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “small room, wonderful staff excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PNK123
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed for 3 days. The room was small with no space for clothes. However, the location is perfect. The staff is lovely. There is a complimentary breakfast each morning. Eggs, pancakes, sausage, fresh fruit, yogurt, muffins and bagels.. juice, coffee. Our son was not feeling well one night and the hotel went out of there way to help us get him to a doctor. We would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: pkbspencer
Reviews.Content: Great location - 2 minute walk to Fishermans Wharf. Good value breakfast and foc internet. Large rooms...no complaints

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAFF, EXCELLENT LOCATION, EXCELLENT HOTEL.”
Reviews.Author: Jarne
Reviews.Content: When I usually book a hotel, I do one of those online bids and keep my fingers crossed that the hotel given is halfway decent. I didn't bid this time, instead selecting the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman'sWharf and I am glad I did. Even though the place was packed, our room was very quiet and our bed very comfortable. The breakfast was great and the free internet was a plus. We were so close to everything yet far enough to avoid hearing all the outdoor noises. The staff at the front desk and phone staff were very respectful. My advice to prospective tourists and on line bidders is to refrain from the bargain bidding web sites and choose this hotel outright. The comfortable setting, free breakfast, internet and fine staff makes the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf a wise and cost efficient selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for san francisco stay!”
Reviews.Author: stopyourwhiningtoo
Reviews.Content: Great room, pull out couch and two beds, clean, large room. Very nice for us. Hotel staff pretty helpful, nice and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mustangguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location for Fishermans wharf, the cable cars, among other things. It is about a 15 minute walk to the Alcatraz tour boats but that is nothing. Pier 29 is about 8-10 minutes away. The front desk staff is amazing and the breakfast is pretty good considering it is includes. A few negatives at this hotel are that the regular rooms have no microwave or fridge which we found out after we booked and the hotel was full. So a styrofoam cooler and the ice machine became our friend. There is no wireless in the rooms just the lobby area. The positives: The bed was comfortable and the room very quiet. There is a Safeway 5 minutes away to buy snacks and deli food if you want a change from restaurant meals. We had no car and took the pay shuttle from the airport and back. Parking is $45 per night so that could add up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: islandjule
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the HIE Fisherman's Wharf. When I made the reservation, I had one reward (free) night, and had to pay for the 2nd night ($259). Upon arrival, I looked at my confirmation from HI and discovered that the second night was actually booked at the HI property a couple of blocks away. Since this was 4th July week-end and the reception lines were long, I was worried about getting this sorted out (I did not want to have to move our fam of 5 to another hotel the next day). Although the staff was busy, they were all very pleasant and told us not to worry that the general manager would figure out something for us. We went up to our room, and finding that it did not meet our specifications (we needed sofa bed or roll-away), we called down to reception - again, worried about the response. Again, the staff was so pleasant - told us to come down and get a new key. All our interactions with the staff (whether reception or housekeeping) - everyone had a smile and "can do" attitude. Made for a very pleasant stay. The new room fit our needs perfectly. Basic amenities. Clean. Great location for exploring the city. Basic (free) breakfast had something for everyone in my family (fruit, yogurt, cereal, sausage or bacon, toast, cereal, eggs, cinnamon buns). My only grip is that this is obviously a high-traffic area and although newer hotel, the carpet should be replaced soon, as it is showing wear. However, all things considered, I would recommend to travelers looking for hotel to easily explore SF.

Reviews.Title: “Another winner selected from Tripadvisor reviews”
Reviews.Author: mattin54
Reviews.Content: I booked this room in March and got a good deal. We stayed the week of June 19th for 6 nights. It was a good choice. It is relatively new with very nice furnishings, etc. The beds were comfortable and the room was always nicely cleaned. The room is not huge but it is comfortable and we never felt cramped. It is an easy walk to The Wharf, public transportation, and many places to eat. My daughter and I rented a car for the week and if you park at the hotel it currently is $45 per day. I went online and found parking around the corner at The Anchorage Garage for $25 per day. There is more than enough room for the breakfast crowd and the food selection was good. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Sasha0406
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and choosing lodging was a daunting task. We eventually settled on this hotel for easy access to public transportation, not necessarily Fishermans Wharf. We were pleasantly surprised at the ideal location, renovated hotel interior, firm king mattress and very good free continental breakfast. Location was amazing. All this at a great value. The staff was very helpful with whatever we needed, whether it was extra towels or directions in the city. We will certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a San Francisco hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: PK_Maryland
Reviews.Content: First just to be clear, because it can be a bit confusing, we are reviewing the Holiday Inn Express at 550 North Point. There is a Holiday Inn right next door (with the same address) which does not offer the same amenities. The HI Express delivered as advertised (free breakfast, free internet in the room) and we had a junior suite which includes a microwave and mini-frig (a must have for us), The hotel seems relatively new; the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The location is about a 2 block walk to the Wharf, close enough to be convenient but far enough that it's quiet here. The hotel breakfast was OK but it's free so you can't complain. It's crowded at breakfast but they have plenty of tables and we were always able to get a table with no problem. There are two very close restaurants right near the hotel we'd recommend (Hollywood Cafe for lunch and Cafe Pescatore for lunch or dinner). Compared to the cost of other SF hotels and what you get at the HIE, we'd recommend this hotel for your stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: FussyTraveler67
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and nice. We had a regular room, not a suite, and it did not have a microwave or refrigerator. They had a very good breakfast with both hot and cold food until 9:30 a.m. The internet was hooked into with a cable and it worked very efficiently. They also had free computers and printers in the lobby. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect. I don't like to walk really far but it was a lovely, short walk to Pier 39. The office where we caught out tour to Muir Woods, Sausalito and Alcatraz was on the same block. There were tons of eating choices within walking distance and the cable cars and bus stops were nearby. We stayed here one night before our cruise and 4 nights after and we could walk to the pier where our cruise embarked and disembarked from. We didn't have a car so we really appreicated the location. It isn't cheap but is a good deal for San Francisco since it is a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BryRee
Reviews.Content: I am a single mom and took my two teenagers here for Spring Break. It was in a great location, just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and even bike rental places nearby. There was also a tour excursion company on the corner which was very convenient. The room was nice and the breakfast was good. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: TinnerWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at Fishermans Wharf Holiday Inn was delightful. Good rooms, nice accomodations, and a wonderful morning breakfast. Service and ammenities were super. I'll definitly stay there again, the next time I visit Frisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit expensive for a holiday inn express”
Reviews.Author: illini_knight
Reviews.Content: For a hotel in the heart of fisherman's wharf, you cannot really beat the value and the short walking distance to the big sites. I found it to be a bit expensive (compared to other big cities), but I guess that is normal for san fran. Service was fine, breakfast was normal holiday inn express breakfast (who doesn't like the cinnamon buns?), and the room was normal holiday clean.

Reviews.Title: “City life $$$”
Reviews.Author: tmrad70
Reviews.Content: Positives : great location to all the sites in the city. Excellent lobby and breakfast area. Negatives : being in the city means crazy prices, nothing is cheap or even reasonably priced including here. Very small rooms, but clean. Old tube TVs with only fair reception. Expect more for the $. Also $44 just for 1 nights parking, alternative is to park 3 blocks away and pay $20. I went with the $44 for the convienence. I guess that's just the way everything is in the big city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ThreeLegsIsleofMan
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel - staff very helpful. Breakfast rather basic with plastic everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: zippy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Found the hotel easily by BART and F Line trolly from Airport. Paid extra for the mini suite which gave you a microwave, fridge and sink area, but not a great view or anything extra. The room was nice with everything you need. The best part of this hotel is the location, as soon as you step out you are right in Fisherman's Wharf and very close to the cable car and trolly stops. The breakfast was also very good. Plenty of choice with amazing hot cinnamon buns. Although I was disappointed not to see these on our 2nd and 3rd morning? I had a great stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel experience of my life, and as a former SF resident, I can honestly say, any other hotel is better.”
Reviews.Author: Birdietravels
Reviews.Content: 1) arrived and the room we reserved was "dirty" so were downgraded for the night to a FILTHY room in the older building. 2) we booked this location, though more expensive then the Hilton across the street, for the refrigerator (needed for medication), which wasnt in the room. A very rude gentleman reluctantly brought one to our room after a lengthy phone conversation. 3) D "just the initial" refused to call a cab for us, was very rude, and told us to go "find the bellman," who was no where to be found. 4) When we complained to the manager, Robert, about how unimpressed we were with our experience, he stated, "well, I'm not impressed either," gesturing to my sister. In short, rude staff, FILTHY accomidations, no customer service standards, and false advertising on amenities. Hundreds of hotels in the city, pick any other.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RitzMary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay while visiting the Fisherman's Wharf area. It's quiet, clean, the staff is friendly and there's a free breakfast in the morning. It's only a few blocks from the cable cars and Pier 39. There's also a Safeway Market and Trader Joes within walking distance. We loved the location!!!! The only negative comment I can make is that the room was on the smaller side. I would stay here again without hesitation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KTO_Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location. We could walk to anything we wanted or needed to. Rooms were equivalent to most higher-priced hotels I've stayed at recently--don't waste your money on a more expensive hotel. Breakfast buffet in the mornings perfect. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi770
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here in late April. Fabulous location – you can walk to Fisherman’s Wharf, Pier 39, Ghiradelli Square, Powell Street cable car, F-Line street cars. City tours such as Hop On/Hop Off and Duck Tours are right around the corner. If parking was included in the room price this hotel would be a great value; however, parking is outrageous - $50+/night ($45 + $5 tax), then add more for tipping the valet. Apparently others have found cheaper parking nearby but the lots we saw didn’t allow overnight parking and/or didn’t allow in/out parking. If I had to do it all over again I wouldn’t rent a car until we were ready to leave the city. Our rental car sat in the expensive parking garage for 2 days because with all forms of public transportation readily available we just didn’t need it. Our 4th floor king room was an average size with no view (we looked into another hotel room so we had to keep the drapes closed when we were in the room). Room was very clean and quiet. Internet connection was nice to have but very slow. Missed having the mini fridge you get in most HI Express hotels, especially since there’s a Safeway and a Trader Joes around the corner. Staff is very polite and helpful; however, I had to ask them to stop calling my room between 9:00 p.m. and 10:00 p.m. each night to ask how I was enjoying my stay. Nice gesture but a bit late! Minor negatives: 1) This hotel appears to cater to large school groups from the USA and abroad. At times there were large groups of unaccompanied minors wandering the halls, rough-housing, messing around with the elevators (one elevator was broken on 2 different days during our stay), etc. It was just kids being kids, but it appeared that some older guests were intimated by the groups of teens roaming around on the floors/taking over the elevators. 2) The free breakfast was terrible (eggs were inedible, OJ was like water with orange food coloring, bread/bagels were stale, milk tasted sour, etc. and even my favorite HI Express cinnamon rolls were not great). There are plenty of small breakfast places near the hotel (we tried Hollywood Café and Pat’s Cafe) but they aren’t cheap. One exception is Café Puccini in the Italian District - great breakfast omelets, lots of food, and very reasonable prices. Wish we had found it on our first day and not our last! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tones11
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, good buffet breakfast, can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bellas_adventures
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and just needed a base to explore the city. The hotel location could not be better if you are a tourist as it is close to everything you need. Another plus is the free internet in the lobby. Are small but clean and have everything you need. The only downsides with this hotel was the breakfast and the noise levels. Breakfast was included, which was great, but you had to be there really early otherwise everything ran out and they had some kind of strange fake microwave omelette which tasted very bad. I can recommend the sticky buns and the coffee though. This hotel was also always very noisy very early in the morning. People going past in the corridor sreaming at six or seven in the morning every morning is not a good thing. It seems as though this was mainly due to the several school kids staying there at the same time and the teachers would shout at them in the corridors. All in all though I would still recommend this hotel as it has that good location and staff are polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “There is cheaper parking nearby”
Reviews.Author: rod002
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine - excellent location - clean and tidy with helpful and pleasant staff. The hotel parking was $44 a day which we thought was expensive and we did want to keep our hire car. Next to Walgreens store only a minute or twos walk from the hotel is a secure multistorey for $20 - $25 a day no trestrictions - speak to the gate man or security guy.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location at a Fair Price”
Reviews.Author: sumort
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews here I was a little worried about the hotel, but I really shouldnt have been. The room was large clean and newly furnished. We had a view onto the street which was fine. The staff couldnt do enough for us, and were really helpful every time we asked for it. The breakfast was great, if yu didt eat the egg products, everything else was fresh and tasty, plentiful and there was a lot of options, a fantastic free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice en friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: Philippemouse
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay and the people working in the hotel are very friendly Situation is perfect to discover the wharf and Frisco We come surely back Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good location for families.”
Reviews.Author: MrStrange
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights arriving on a Saturday evening. Check in was easy & pleasant and because we were staying 10 nights we got a free upgrade to a mini suite with fridge and microwave on the 4th floor. Room was pleasant, 2 double beds( not the expected kingsize), possibly a little dated, clean and fairly quiet with very little traffic noise and only one Saturday night did we hear any noise near midnight from outside or inside. Room had wired internet access and heating/ A/C, and free breakfast although it was really busy so after using it once we opted for a long lie most mornings. Exiting SFO we easily were directed to the taxi rank and got a cab straight to the hotel for about $45 plus tip. Taxi's are available outside the hotel across the road at the Hyatt, and we also used 'knuckles' at the Hyatt for meals when we had a long day sight seeing. A few points are to pre book your Alcatraz trip from the UK to guarantee a place on your preferred day, and we also bought a CityPass online and exchanged the printed voucher at the Pier 39 Aquarium. This gives you 7 days travel on the cable cars, buses, trolley cars that run down Embarcadero from Fisherman's Wharf to Market Street ( near Union Sq). Plus admission to 5 attractions. We also got the open top double decker bus which gives you 2 days of hop on, hop off, around SF and worked out at $88 (£56) for 2 adults and a child although most tourist brochures/guides usually have money off vouchers to reduce the cost. There a quite a lot of homeless people in SF and the Wharf but never had any trouble. Also watch out for the Bush Man.

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault this hotels location”
Reviews.Author: mike424u
Reviews.Content: Great location just off the wharf, close to all local shops and restaurants. Good size rooms, clean and tidy makes an ideal base from which to site see all of sanfransico. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Free Wifi, Breakfeast was good. Real value for money, no frills hotel. Very friendly and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff”
Reviews.Author: gi_n_ra
Reviews.Content: The front desk had the friendliest staff I've ever encountered. All of the reps were very helpful and happy. Brandy and Ally were especially memorable. Rooms were clean and spacious. The rooms were not glamorous but I wasn't expecting that. They were great rooms for the price and especially the location. Free continental breakfast along with internet in the rooms as well as in the lobby at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location with easy access to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: A-team04
Reviews.Content: What more could you ask for when travelling with a teenage family! The hotel met all our needs and expectations. (Bytheway the taxi ride from San Francisco airport to the hotel was ~44USD, ALWAYS USE STATE TAXI'S ONLY!). It included complimentary breakfast with some hot breakfast options which the kids enjoyed ( scrambled egg or cheesy ommelette, pancakes, bacon or meat options for non-vegetarians & also cereals, yogurts, juices, fruit and alot more) and the free internet access was great so that we could keep in touch with our friends and all loved ones. This was better value than some of the 5 star hotels we stayed in on this holiday to California ( including Palm Desert, Grand Canyon, Las Vegas & LA ), It was a 2 min walk to the cable cars (5 USD/person one way to Union Square -main shopping area), which was just across the street from the hotel. It was also local to the Piers - about a 15 min walk to Pier 33 (pier to Alcatraz ferry) and Pier 39 (where we ate at the fantastic Bubba Gump restaurant, which is not cheap - a meal for 4 = 80USD). We hired a taxi to The Golden Gate Bridge from outside the hotel (~24USD including 6USD that he wanted to get back as we were only travelling one way!!!!!! I've now come to learn that there seems to be hidden costs everywhere in the US) to travel one way over to the end of the bridge to the other side & then we walked back one way over the bridge, which was a 2 mile walk over the bridge and in total ~ 5 miles back to the hotel inc. the bridge walk, admiring the views along the bridge (which was amazing and highly recommended). The hotel check in & check out was smooth and the staff were friendly, helpful & approachable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to all & will most certainly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable valuey for money”
Reviews.Author: Jem711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Located near the wharf it is a short walk from all the tourist attractions near the bay. Lots of restaurants only a few blocks away and a Walgreens (large convenience store) a few doors down open until midnight came in very handy. The room was clean and spacious, the only complaint would be that we stayed on the ground floor so could hear a lot of street noise at night, but otherwise a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for solo travellers”
Reviews.Author: kpnutsni
Reviews.Content: Quite often solo travellers get poor value for money and a lower quality of service when it comes to hotels and restaurants. You often get stuck in an uncomfortable table in the corner or in a tiny room overlooking a brick wall! However, on my arrival at the Holiday Inn Express, I was overjoyed to find myself in a large, well appointed room. The room, with its large bay window overlooking the main street, contained 2 double beds, a large sofa and a small kitchen with fridge and microwave. The bed was probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in and I felt at home right away. During my week long stay the staff were always helpful and very friendly. The hotel is well situated, with Fisherman's Wharf only a few minutes walk away with excellent choices for food, such as Boudin's, just around the corner. I know a few travel guides would say that the Wharf is a tourist trap and should be avoided but the fact is I am a tourist, and I loved it! Perhaps the only disappointment was the hotel's complimentary breakfast. It really is poor. The choice of food is limited to a few very high calorie/sugar items which have to be eaten off cardboard plates with plastic spoons. However, an excellent little place around the corner (Beach street grill) soon sorted out my breakfast problem! All in all this is an excellent hotel and would very happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bibbmon
Reviews.Content: We were here for three nights during our stay in San Francisco. Very nice comfortable and the breakfast was really welcome coffee in the room was great too. I would recomend to anyone that would like to stay in the best part of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Minutes walk from fisherman's wharf”
Reviews.Author: evabreee
Reviews.Content: best place to stay if u want to go down to the wharf, good breakfast and very clean and modern rooms

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Touring San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: birdieIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: My sixteen year old daughter and I recently visited San Francisco during her Spring Break. The location of the hotel worked well in touring the city for the first time. It was convenient to everything at or near the Wharf area. We toured Alcatraz, rode cable cars, trolleys, city buses, toured with CitySightseeing, went to Muir Woods, the wax museum, Golden Gate Park, SFMOMA, Chinatown, rode the Ducks, toured de Young, Sausalito, the Academy of Sciences Museum, Pier 39 and the Aquarium of the Bay, and enjoyed a tour of the Bay with Blue and Gold Bay Fleet tours. Using the San Francisco CityPass and CitySightseeing San Francisco's Freestyle options we covered the city in our 5 day stay. Highlights having done so were an evening tour of Alcatraz, Sausalito, our tour of Chinatown with Linda Lee tours, and the Duck tour with Captain Van.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall. Recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: paganini15
Reviews.Content: Overall I had a great experience at this hotel. The hotel was clean, affordable and very comfortable. They had a free breakfast every morning and free internet in the room, how do you beat that! The staff was also very courteous and helpful. All in all the hotel is in a great location. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, hopefully not our last!”
Reviews.Author: Rod-Kis
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Ghiradelli, Pier 39, Cable Cars, Lombard Street, Buena Vista (originators of Irish coffee ) and China Town is approximately 8 blocks away and have walked it before.... Joseph at front desk recommended Caesars ( Italian ) two blocks away and had a great meal, also had great Dungess Crab at Alietos. Go to Muir Woods, Napa and book your Alcatraz tour early especially if you want to go on a Saturday as they do fill up. Parking at hotel is outrageous but no different than most in downtown.. Take Cable Car to Union Square for great shopping and drive to Baker Beach (Presido) for great shots of back side of Golden Gate. If you have time go see the Aquarium in Monterrey, is pricey but the best I have seen. Have stayed at the Hyatt across the Street and HI is a better deal, yes breakfast is crowded and eggs are fake- eat something else. Mgr. Martha Flynn bent over backwards to help with room request, great Customer Service!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Dad2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days on a spring break trip with the kids. It was o.k.--clean, etc. but far too overcrowded. Breakfast time was awful; there aren't half enough tables available, the breakfast items were often depleted (and we ate at different times, different days, with the same story) and no one seemed to be watching over anything. People were pushing and shoving, and very rude in their stampede to get at the breakfast. Where do these literally hundreds of people come from? The hotel cannot possible have as many rooms as people at breakfast. Likewise, the "business center," two computer terminals, is a joke--don't bother trying, you'll never get a turn... If you want to feel like a number in a crowd, this is the place for you. The prices were higher than I've ever paid at a Holiday Inn Express, yet I felt like I received a lot less....

Reviews.Title: “Highly reccommend”
Reviews.Author: sf6984
Reviews.Content: This was the 1st stop of many for us in America and found the staff to be some of the friendliest. Check in/out was was efficient and at all times the front desk staff happily went out of their way to find answers to our questions. We did use the concierge at the holiday inn (across the road) once and found her to be rude and unhelpful, so we continued to utilize the front desk staff where possible. The inclusion of the buffet breakfast (plenty of choice and no shortage of supply or places to sit) was really convenient (and tasty). Beds were big and comfy, bathroom clean and had an in-room safe. Location was perfect for us, spending most of our time connecting with activites on Fisherman's Wharf, and just a stroll round the corner to the hop on/off buses. Would definately stay here again.
