Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location!”
Reviews.Author: brocncheese
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to San Francisco. The hotel is located right at the heart of Fisherman's Wharf, which is convenient for tourists who want to take advantage of bus tours and sightseeing. My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Check in is at 3pm but we arrived at 12:30pm. We were told to return at 3pm and our reservation was confirmed. We came back at 3:10pm and were advised that our room had been given away to a large group of young students that were here as a group. They offered us a king size bed and a free movie to compensate. After a bit of haggling, we got upgraded to a mini suite for the duration of our stay, which was just a slightly larger room with 2 beds, a pullout couch, a microwave and mini fridge. I can only imagine how small the regular rooms must be. Despite the mixup, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and quickly got us settled. For those travelers that don't like being in a touristy area then this hotel is not for you. For those that don't mind, the location is perfect. It is a very short walk to Ghiardelli Square, the crookedest street, and the Alcatraz ferry pickup. Also, there is free hotel pickup for the bus tours that we selected. If you don't know where to eat, you can walk along the pier and decide from a range of different places to eat. Most of the restaurants have a seafood theme so be prepared for crab and clam chowder on most of the menus. The buses, street cars, and cable cars are also a short distance from the hotel so you can explore the rest of the city quite easily. The only negative thing I would say about the location is the large amount of homeless people that appeared to be mentally ill. Walking back to the hotel at night was a bit worrisome for two young women as the homeless people sleep on the sidewalk on the walk back to the hotel. One man even approached us on the pier, rambling about something. We ignored them and were fine but it is a bit unsettling. The negative thing about the hotel would be the slow internet connection. There is a business centre with two computers and we had to wait in line most of the time that we wanted to check our e-mails. once you get a computer, you will be waiting for a few minutes for each page to load which can get frustrating. I suggest bringing a laptop or device that can access the computers and check the internet from the comfort of your room. And the people who were complaining about the breakfast are obviously too picky. There was a pretty good spread of FREE food ranging from cinnamon rolls, cereal, eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, breads, english muffins, biscuits, oatmeal, bananas, yogurt, milk, coffee, and juice. The eggs were a bit rubbery but the rest was good. You can't ask for more at a free breakfast. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. It's clean, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect if you are a tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: iscream4life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for four nights. The location is great and close to bus lines and the cable car lines. It is a short walk to Fisherman's Wharf. This was our first time in San Francisco. The hotel lobby is very nice and has a free breakfast bar. I've read bad reviews of the breakfast but really it isn't bad. There is cereal, tea, coffee, milk, yogurt, bagels, fresh bananas etc. You can't beat free! I didn't eat the meat and eggs but was able to fill up on the heathier options. The breakfast bar is open from 6-9am. We didn't have a problem with crowds. There is free wifi in the lobby and the rooms. Our room was small (a king size bed) and there was no view, but we didn't spend alot of time there anyway. The room was clean and there was a safe for our use. The bed was comfortable. We could hear the cable cars through the window but over all it was pretty quiet. I think we got a really good deal and the people at the desk were very nice and helpful. The area is safe and seems to pick up especially on weekends. There is a place called Knuckles to eat at accross the street but it is over priced and not that great. Overall it was a very positive experience. A word of caution, Fisherman's Wharf is very touristy and there are a alot of homeless people in that area. Many of them are mentally ill. Don't engage them. We saw some drunk girls bothering some homeless people. A simple "I don't have change" is fine and then be on your way.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAY2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first 2 nights of our trip to California. Good value overall.... Took a taxi from the airport and it was just $40. The room was clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly. The location is ideal for all the attractions at Fishermans Wharf. The breakfast wasn't up to much but it's there if you want it... Failing that you will pay $10 - $15 each somewhere else. Ate out at 'Knuckles' which was just across the road and part of the Hyatt Hotel complex - Very good and convenient...

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hote. Beware of the breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Petjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Hotel for 5 nights in February 2011. Everything in the room was great- very comfortable beds and very clean bathrooms. The staff were also very cheerful and went out of their way to improve your stay. The only thing that spoiled our stay was the breakfast- it was awful. You eat off paper plates and mismatched plastic cutlery which cannot cut through the bacon, eggs or toast! As a result we ate our cooked breakfast with our fingers- honestly! Just be prepared- if you are able to put up with the breakfast it is a very good hotel in a very central location... but we would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Adrew13
Reviews.Content: Close to downtown, street cars, wharf area. Great stay. Needs to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “SAVE MONEY - STAY AT FISHERMAN'S WHARF AND CATCH A BUS OR CAB TO SEE THE CITY”
Reviews.Author: Jujubaby00
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn was the best price in town (with the family and friends discount) and included free breakfast and free wi-fi as well (both being essential "must have" benefits on our month long tour of the West Coast of the US). We even received a free upgrade with our Priority Club membership. The parking was expensive, so we returned the rental car for the 3 nights we stayed in San Francisco and caught cabs everywhere (given that there is nowhere to park a car in downtown SF for less than $50 per day) and found it to be very convenient and economical compared to the more expensive or dodgy areas near Union Square (which is where we really wanted to be). The cab fare for four of us was cheaper than buying bus or cable car tickets, not to mention the convenience of hailing a cab at the exact time we wished to travel. The hotel rooms were modern and quiet and the breakfast was adequate if you like cereal,/yogurt,/fruit and toast/muffins/cinnamon scrolls, but we advise you to steer clear of the hot food - highly processed and unpalatable for anyone who cares about their diet. Our family voted it the worst free breakfast of all the hotels during our trip, but it was much better than paying for it or having to go out in search of a restaurant first thing in the morning. There are lots of restaurants and shops nearby to keep the tourists happy and a couple of supermarkets with pre-packaged dinners to go if you want to save money on eating out. With so many restaurants to chose from in SF, we ate out each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: arnieTsv
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, great location (only a short walk to the trams and bus stop at the door) and a comfortable and quiet place to stay. Simple nice breakfast included and free internet. No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value, look no further.”
Reviews.Author: TallmanWPB
Reviews.Content: Overall, great hotel and very close to everything. We stayed here 2 seperate nights as we began our trip and ended so we were closer to airport after traveling to Monterey. This hotel is walking distance to everything. Very close to Wharf and restaurants, seals, etc.....Hotel was clean and staff very nice. Free breakfast in the morning with hot items like eggs and bagels, etc... Can't beat the value these days at most Holiday Inn Expresses. I would stay again for sure. Expensive parking so we parked on the street for free right out in front of the hotel. Just read the sign so you know which side to park on. Very happy with our stay. Only shortcoming was the older tube TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: HS300
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually an annex to the larger Holiday Inn next door - but it was BIG on service, friendliness and location. We stayed in a family room with two double beds - and found we needed to get a fold away bed, because the double beds were just too small to share with teenage children. The location is great and walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirarelli Square. Lots of restaurants nearby and a great mix of cuisines and price ranges. One very minor point: If you choose to use the laundy facilities, they are located in the main hotel next door. Be prepared to STAY there and do not leave your property unattended. The staff in this hotel are OUTSTANDING and made for a very enjoyable and comfortable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Convenient --what more do you want??”
Reviews.Author: seasonal-jamaican
Reviews.Content: Location at Fisherman's Wharf is exactly with the Marriott, Holiday Inn, Hyatt, Hilton and 2 blocks to Sheraton. Fisherman's Wharf is low rise (this is 4 floors) near junk shops, boat tours and Ghiradelli Square. Not exactly classy, but most folks will get here sometime during a trip. The Sea Lions are a draw, and the Alcatraz boat is a short walk away. Advantage to this area is that most of these places are newer or recently renovated. Holiday Inn Express is 10 years old, and beginnning to show just a little wear. Wallpaper is coming loose at seams, tub needs a little work, but probably better than average shape for San Francisco as a whole. The Hyatt across the street is probably the nicest of the bunch, but all are pretty similar. Here the pluses are the breakfast included in the morning. I would rate average to slightly above for this type property, with bananas and yogurt every morning, as well as warm cinnamon rolls. Also, there were plenty of table to handle the off-season quantity of folks, although that may change in the summer. The internet in the rooms is provided through a cable hooked to your computer. In this day and age this seems antiquated, and frequently you get a pop-up on your screen about the service which is quite annoying. However, it is free internet, which is not always the case in San Francisco. Others have complained about looking out into a courtyard with just other rooms. We had a view of the street to the north, and the bay beyond. Only problem here is that on the 4th floor you are nearly even with the street lights, as well as the neon signs of many businesses. We had a tattoo shop behind glaring at us all night, a light that could not be blocked out by the curtains. Just be careful what you wish for. Overall we were very pleased with the accommodations. The cable car was 2 blocks away. We rented a GoCar a block away that was an absolute blast. There is an Enterprise rental car office 2 blocks away that we rented a car for a day trip to Napa. Hotel does not have a restaurant, but Hyatt across the street has a wine bar and a sports bar that we made good use of. Room was very nice, people were nice. Certainly not glamorous, but exactly what you wish for when you think Holiday Inn Express. It fit the bill very nicely for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great value”
Reviews.Author: adgillispie
Reviews.Content: This trip to San Francisco was actually part business and part leasure. This hotel is in a perfect location - just blocks from the wharf and near lots of good restaurants. The rooms were clean and the service was exceptional. After we checked out, I realized that they had accidentally double-billed me for a portion of my stay (I was being difficult anyway in requesting that part of the stay be billed on a corporate card and the other on a personal card). But they corrected the error immediately. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Fran for any reason.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy digs at a good price”
Reviews.Author: TKColeman
Reviews.Content: Picking this location to stay was extremely last minute as there was a medical emergency that caused us to travel to San Francisco, CA from Spokane, WA. My sister-in-law actually booked the room for us as we were in a frenzy attempting to make flight arrangements and pack. She called several locations, but picked this one, because of its location, but most of all, because of the friendly and helpful service she received over the phone. When we got there they had a door man help us with our luggage, the people at the front desk were extremely professional and helpful to two "out of towners". Advising us of all the places to eat (around the neighborhood, in house or delivery) since we didn't have a vehicle. When we got to our room, it was smaller, but had everything we needed! The bed was so comfortable, I had a great night's sleep our first night. The room was VERY clean and everything worked as it should. For the rate we paid (under $100) per night, I was absolutely blown away! They also had room service until late at night as well as a restaurant and bar on the 1st floor. Though the food was priced a bit high, I was thankful to have something we could get without having to go outside our four walls. The area in which the hotel is located is not the nicest neighbor and a little scary at night... It is situated next to the subway which was a nice perk when you don't have a car in a big town you don't know. The hotel staff was more than willing to help us figure out our route to get around. It's a cheap/fast way to maneuver through the city. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone! The only thing that was bothersome was the sirens that woke you up at night. Guess that goes with the location of the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: waterwaysGY
Reviews.Content: This hotel had all the basics you would need to a high standard. The location was good as it is in the fisherman's wharf area, so it was close to pier 39. The rooms was clean and tidy with a very large comfortable bed. The hotel staff was friendly and we enjoyed 4 quiet nights sleeps and woke up to a complementary breakfast, which was good as it felt like a free breakfast due to the cheap rates this hotel offers. I would highly recommend this hotel if your looking for a base to stay to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: melharris111
Reviews.Content: This hotel was EXTREMELY clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. The location near Fisherman's Wharf was very convenient, we were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go and where we couldn't walk, we rode the trolley. The only bad thing was that in order to pick up the wi-fi signal on my handheld, I had to go down to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Disney2007
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults & children 8 & 13) stayed at this hotel in Dec-10 for 4 nights. For the rate of $108 per night we were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The room was a good size, the beds were comfortable, the breakfast was good with different food selections being offered every morning and the front desk was always helpful. There was also free wi-fi and a business centre which was very useful during our stay. The location was great with the hotel being only one block away from Fishermans Wharf where there was several restaurants and train, trolley and bus transport as well. The only downside of this hotel is that there is no laundry facilities on site and you have to walk across the road to the Holiday Inn to use their facilities. Overall this hotel offers excellent value for money and we would definately stay at the HI Express again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Suite.”
Reviews.Author: jess140710
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our suite in this hotel. One was an open concept suite that slept six people. It was centrally located to many sightseeing opportunities. We toured alcatraz one day, then took the 30 bus to the exploratorium the next day. It was wonderful. Check out Boudin on the way to the wharf.. Sooooo yummy. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with very accomodating Front Desk!”
Reviews.Author: evabree
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 27th to 29th Dec 2010 for 3 nights. Minutes away from Pier 39 and the criuse round golden gate. Good breakfast and very clean room with excellent view facing the pier. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located,great value for your money, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ATMCalgary
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the midst of Fishermans Wharf. You do not need a car ( hotel parking is 43 a day) as the transit is near by. One bus #30 to great shopping at Union Square. The hotel is clean and friendly. Rooms are adequate, but clean. The breakfast served well for a family of four. Hours are 6:30-9:30. Get there by 815 and you will find shorter lines and a chair.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a 1st time visit”
Reviews.Author: oconnorn
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for a return trip to San Fran (previous visit,stayed at the very nice Hotel Rex, a short stroll to the Westfield Mall). This visit we chose to stay at the opposite end down by the Wharf. The hotel was in a very good location for all the sightseeing and bike rental companies.Laundry facilities were in the next door HI. Internet access is 2 computers in the lobby, busy at times especially the morning. We asked for a room with a view.Not quite what we imagined...the cable car runs right outside the window until about midnight and then the tattoo shop across the street starts up with its music blasting its way across into the room. For some strange reason they have the speakers pointing right across to the hotel rooms and the windows open. Extremely annoying to have to listen to this for 5 nights. Was happy to leave the HI Express.The Fishermans Wharf area is quite tacky...stalls line the streets and souvenir shops are everywhere. I much prefer the Union Square end of San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected...but OK.”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: Considering this place had higher ratings than places like hyatt regency, I thought this would be a good option. Several problems. 1) INTERNET. It was included which was good, but it is not WIFI, you have to plug in a cable from the wall. The cable they had was very short so you had to sit at the desk to use the internet..no surfing from the bed, for example. Also the speed at times was not up to par for "high speed". 2) HOUSEKEEPING was marginal at best. Didn't replace plastic liners for the ice bucket. Didn't refill the shampoo. Knocked on the door in early morning...8am. 3) VALUE. For the price I could have stayed at a 4 star hotel like hyatt regency which is FAR superior, but that is only because at the time of year I was there (mid December), the business hotels tend to be empty so you can get good deals. Location is good, but overall I'd probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: kittruesmith
Reviews.Content: We took a quick vacation to SF just before the holidays and was very happy with our stay at the Express. We didn't have reservations but we were able to get a room. A quick and efficient check in. The room was large for a hotel in a major city. Excellent amenities. Nice restaurants walking distance. We will be here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Hambafrika
Reviews.Content: A great location and suited our needs perfectly. Rooms were LARGE and very comfortable. We only ever use hotels to sleep, so a room that we could expand in, shower in and be comfortable at night is great. Rooms were spotless, quiet but no views. Not that we wanted views - we wanted San Fran! If you want a hotel restaurant (they only do a help yourself breakfast which we never made) dont book here - they dont have one. I cant see the point of staying and eating in the same hotel so this suited us. Besides, being so close to Fishermans Wharf, why would you want to stay in the hotel? Conjoined to the hotel is an electric bicycle franchise - do it! They are amazing and zoomed us across the Bridge to Sausalito. Boy did we laugh zooming past the panting tourists struggling up the hills! Can I suggest the Blue Mermaid for chowder? Great place. Also Lou's Pier 47 for some music........

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, No Frills hotel in the Fishermans Wharf Area”
Reviews.Author: 1birdie23
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the end of December with my mum and sisters. Standard rooms with two double beds. No interconnecting rooms at this hotel but we were able to get two rooms next to each other. Beds very comfortable. Hot buffet breakfast included which was adequate. We stayed in the off season so were always able to get a table for breakfast - would imagine though during summer the breakfast area would be very busy. Disappointed when we got there to find that the free wifi was not available in the guest rooms - only in the hotel lobby area which was a bit of a pain. No reason these days for free wifi to not be available throughout hotels. Usual small bathrooms - seems to be standard for American hotels. Room was clean. No sitting area in the room - small table with two chairs. No external view from our 4th floor room - Not sure if any of the rooms at this hotel would have a view. Fantastic location for walking the fishermans wharf area and only a small walk to the tour buses and cable car stops. Recommend this hotel as a reasonably priced, no frills option for sightseeing in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amymck1
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying here, it was clean and the rooms were a good size,the breakfast was very good and even better that it was included, we were very close to fishermans wharf pier 39 and most shops. we would deff stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: BridgetandNeil
Reviews.Content: Our friends, mu husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. It is in an absolutely great location, the rooms are spacious and clean. Free breakfast in the morning is an added bonus and the reception staff could not do enough for you. We would definately stay here again and tell our friends about it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Odd building set up led to confusion, inconvenience, and bad service”
Reviews.Author: nct5x
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was a good price for the location. It's blocks from Fisherman's Wharf and close to the convention I attended at Fort Mason Center. Overall, the room was pretty good value for the money and location. However, my main complaint is the very strange set up of the hotel. It is almost like three separate hotels. There are two buildings across the street from each other. The second building is subdivided again into two separate spaces that have different entrances and you can only get from one section to the other by going outside. Once I checked into the main building, I had to drag my luggage across the street and go to the second building. It was very confusing which entrance to use, and if you went to the wrong one you had to go outside again to go to the other section. If you are in the section with the Denny's (like I was) the 'front desk' there isn't open all the time. So you have to go to one of the other buildings to get service. I dropped my bag off with the bell hop when they were open, and when I came back to get my bag that desk was closed. I had to call one of the other front desks to get any help, and it took repeated calls and at least 30-40 minutes before a bell hop appeared to help me. I was trying to catch a shuttle bus to the airport and the added wait made it very close. Further, it was confusing at which of the three possible entrances the shuttle was going to appear. So I was constantly checking back and forth to make sure I didn't miss it and no one was there to guide me otherwise. This set up needs to be fixed!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: senoraflowers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It's clean. It features a breakfast buffet that includes items like eggs, bacon, muffins, cereal, etc. It's about a block away from a Walgreens (families traveling with children will understand the importance of having a store like this close). My only complaint would be the cost of parking, which was $43 plus tax per day at the time that we stayed. We were, however, able to get around that by parking on the street for free at night and in the lot behind the hotel during the day. That lot was only $7.75 per day. So, other than the parking fee, it's a perfect place to stay with kids, and I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fishermans Wharf location”
Reviews.Author: JackieRaymond
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Express, Fishermans Wharf in Sept 2010. Excellent location, very near to Fishermans Wharf and walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants etc. Clean and comfortable rooms. Great hot and cold breakfast with excellent choice of food , included in price of room. No swimming pool but guests can use pool at Holiday Inn next door. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT POSITION.”
Reviews.Author: Alidah
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here. Rooms very comfortable and clean. Great positio, close to the Wharf and Markets. Denny's just around the corner. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Ripoff on the Parking! but location central to mass transit...”
Reviews.Author: candelaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the weekend, and called ahead about the parking rate; was told 43.00 per night. I asked if there was any choice on other parking and was basically told no. After two nights of familiarizing ourselves with the area, we found plent of other garages that charge way less. Also, the hotel added tax on which basically made it $50.00 per night. Park elsewhere and save 20.00 nightly rate. Dissatisfied with their information about parking and "breakfast" was very low quality. Not likely to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kchacksfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nts mid-Oct. Room is large and very clean. Location is excellent and literally 2 mins walk from Fishermans Wharf. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is OK, better than I had expected after reading the reviews. Suggest going early when its quieter (this wasn't a problem for us as we were suffering from jet lag). San Francisco is a wonderful city and we had a great time. Our children are 4 and 9 and we did expect them to be a bit bored until we reached La but they also loved it. The Alcatraz Tour is a must, which we combined with thehop on/hop off city bus tour which you can use for 2 days and is a great way of getting around the city. The people are very friendly and we would definitely like to go back. PS There's a fabulous Ugg Flagship Store in Sutter Street nr Union Square. The parking is extortionate but you definitely do not need a car. We decided to pick the car up at the end of the San Francisco trip, ready to drive to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JulieIles
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. The price included breakfast which was very good and more than we could eat! A good choice of cereals, bread, bagels, muffins, scrambled eggs, yoghurt, fruit juices, tea, coffee, etc. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was spotlessly clean and very quiet at night so we slept very well! Great location for the Wharf, cable cars and Golden Gate Bridge- all very accessible! We could even print off our boarding passes in the hotel lobby! We weren't out very late at night but we felt very safe in this neighbourhood. Having read many other reviews before choosing where to stay this was a brilliant choice and we would thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but outdated room”
Reviews.Author: Calgarysputnik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 year old daughter in October. The room is not very practical, lot's of empty space but nowhere to hang your stuff. The Bathroom was very basic and overall the room needs a modern look. The + side however is that we had a fridge and microwave. The breakfast was pretty good, considering that it's included in the room price. Staff were helpfull and friendly. Location is perfect, close to the Wharf, Tram and Safeway. I would recommend the hotel for the budget traveller and first time visitor to San Francisco but if your looking for a nice modern room, don't stay here. On a side note to potential visitors to San Francisco, take a taxi from the hotel unless your on your own, as those shuttle buses are a rip off. Also stay away from Luigi's Pizzeria at pier 39 what a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: merylstreep
Reviews.Content: One block away from Fisherman's Wharf, which is the hub of activity. Walking distance to cable cars and trolley buses. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. Staff very pleasant and lovely buffet breakfast available.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jen_h_scotland
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, great location, front desk staff excellent. Housekeeping staff so friendly and made sure that we had everything that we needed. We had a room on the 3rd floor which had a view of the TransAmerica Pyramid and Coit Tower - after reading the reviews I was sure that we would be looking into another room. I block from the cable car turnaround making access into the Downtown area easy and stress free. Room was excellent with 2 king beds - I had only booked a queen room so it was an added bonus to have plenty of space. Breakfast was ok - the muffins were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - expensive parking!”
Reviews.Author: Duffnutt09
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location for all main attractions, room clean and well decorated although the TV had seen better days. Breakfast was a bit of a bunfight though best to get down early. Only real complaint is the high cost of parking at the hotel $43 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great, though touristy Area”
Reviews.Author: morphius909
Reviews.Content: Just got back from San Fran. This is a fairly good hotel. I booked with the Friends and Family Rate and so I saved a bundle. Got the 4th floor. The front lobby area and common hallways/areas are actually very nice and modern.I found the front desk clerk quite friendly. The rooms looked average though, with old box style TVs, No Wireless Internet (had wired though) and furniture that is a bit worn. The rooms and hotel in general were kept quite clean and organized. Breakfast was chaotic. It would open at 6:30am and would be packed. It was standard HIE breakfast and suited myself and my family just fine. Watch out for parking. 43/night! If I visit San Fran again, I'd probably stay again thanks to consistent service, standards and location.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN & GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LLH1
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are super clean. The maids do a great job. They do try to do the "conserve on towels and changing linens by request" thing but just ask and they will give u more towels etc. The bed was very very comfortable. We had a quiet room (i think it was 212) it was not on the street side which I could see those rooms might be noisey, but we did not hear a peep. Towels and linens extremely clean and fresh. Breakfast had alot of options (very fresh bannanas everyone was eating them). They have an in room safe - make sure you use it because when we came back from dinner our window was open as if someone had been in our room (ODD) and this was a good while after the maids had been there but nothing seemed to be missing just dont leave anything valuable out. The front desk is very helpful with directions/transportation. Muir Woods was a disappointment, just a forest with a path, we thought trees would be more grand. Segway tours were really fun, but try to do when its not too cold. We took a day tour(this was our bus tour) and they did not give you enough time they would say "you got 6 mins" so take a shorter tour and dont take the 8 hr tours (comprehensive tours) or you feel gyped. The guy never shut up I just wanted to run away from the tour group cause no one wanted to hear his personal views, boring - I felt sad I had wasted a day being rushed to death so they could fit everything in - Im sure the hop on and hop off would be better so you could do it at your own pace. We spent over $100 and it was a waste, better to take bus and take your time. Go to the View Lounge at top of Marriott and you will have an awesome views of city at night, little couches cool lounge but be prepared to spend a little money. Pizza $16 for itty bitty pizza and $6 for beer(u can dress casual) - stick to a couple of cokes and enjoy the killer view. For the ladies - this China Town is not the same as New York - dont expect to find all the fake purses - we only found one store with those and 2 in fishermans wharf and not the selection - We heard they were raided and theres not barely any of that anymore. The Palace/Exploratorium was very pretty with a beautiful lake in front of it. The Japanese Tea Garden was very cute too and some days are even free admission. This hotel is within walking to a beach too great views - come out of hotel take a right- then very first right- then at intersection take a left and keep walking a few blocks and bam you are right there with plenty to do. Get a "Fishermans Wharf pass" they are like $60 a person and you can choose like 4 things to do, it would of saved us a ton of money if we had known about it - you can a good selection to choose from - from tours to Go cars, to alcatraz etc -u will need to look up online where to get them cause there is a ton of tour places. Sausalito is a cute town wish i could of seen it more but was rushed to death so it was a blur to me on my tour. Union Square was hopping if you are into upscale shopping. My husband loved the chowder get it from the vendor right a Fishermans Wharf sign where you can just get a cup and he said it was great and it was half the price of it at some restaurants. We had a great time but remember you walk alot even if you do take the bus but the Wharf is flat so nothing to worry about there. The hotel will call for a taxi. If you want more of a retro/upscale restaurants go down towards the ferry buillding they have alot of yuppies down there and the places looked pretty cool right on the bay. Hotel will bring you a fridge if you request it - tell them its to store medication in and its free - if not u pay $20/day - u will need it - get drinks from walgreens right around the corner - at night you are tired as heck so u need to have some stored up. You can print your own boarding passes there too and they have a couple of computers to check your emails. We had a king size bed, which we prefer and the rooms was a decent size for us two. They have everything you need here and if you are feeling poor - In and Out burgers, Burger King and Macdonalds are just around the corner. For couples if you plan on dressing up alot there is a revolving restaurant we found out about at the top of the Hyatt, we did not go but heard it was nice. I think you will be happy with the location but whatever you do wear comfortable shoes and bring decent socks. They say dress in layers and they are so right. Almost all sweatshirts they sell are $15-$19 dollars they sell alot of windbreakers at the gift shops for $20. My husband got a major SF jacket for $20 wish we could of bought more fleece jackes and coats because they are so cheap but we couldnt fit them in luggage. Again people be comfortable the day really wears you out but you feel anxious to get up early cause there are so many fun things to see and do. Saturdays are the worst for the crowds our other days were more enjoyable -Im glad we had some weekday time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here again and recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: CherylAnnRD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our 25th wedding anniversary through Orbitz choosing this hotel because it was close to Fisherman's Wharf! It was a wonderful hotel with knowledgeable, friendly staff always willing to help you get to that special attraction, how to get there and make your stay memorable. This hotel was in walking distance of the Bay attractions, public trasportations including trolleys, the world famous cable cars, Gharadelli Square and maps were readily available along with staff that could get you anywhere in the city! Our room was kept immaculate, well stocked daily and we tipped our appreciation daily! Joseph, the front desk, was wonderful as were his colleagues. No question was left unanswered! They changed money, wrote out bus directions and gave advice as requested. The daily continental breakfast was well managed, fully stocked and clean. We tipped them too because they did a great job! The hotel has a computer set-up to print out airline tickets and that departing the city so much easier! Right across the street was Knuckles bar which was crowded but it was game day and we had Eagles-49ers tickets! Great food and drink put you in the mood for football! Thinking about it we were hardly in our room because of touring. Our view was a wall but the sleep comfort was the priority! Stay here and you won't regret it. You want Bay views okay but how much are you really in your room? Looking to plan another visit and we will be staying here! A+, HI Express and thank you for making this anniversary more special! Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ccookwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while in S.F for a family vacation. The location was excellent, close to the wharf. We were able to walk to Lambardi St (up hill) fairly easy from the hotel. We also rode bike across the bridge from here with no problem (take the fairy back!) The continental breakfast was good and plentiful. The staff was fabulous, always willing to help with directions, ideas pretty much anything you asked for!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: JoetteJ
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights October 2010. The room was spacious and clean. The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do and close to public transit. My daughter enjoyed the complimentary internet in our room and we both liked the design of the lobby and hallways. Breakfast was included but was not very good. In -room coffee was terrible, coffee in the lobby was average- lucky Starbucks was close-by. Denny's 24 hr restaurant a block away, handy for late night munchies.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth staying at!”
Reviews.Author: lysgar
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here on our trip to San Fran. The lady at the front desk was very nice and helpful in telling us things to do around the area. Great location; a short walk from some awesome San Fran landmarks like Ghirardelli square, and the Fisherman's Warf. The room was very clean and comfortable. What i liked best was the location and my nights sleep I had-comfy beds! What i liked the least was leaving of course.

Reviews.Title: “Parking is Outrageously Expensive”
Reviews.Author: kmaster
Reviews.Content: The location and hotel are fine. But BEWARE if you have a car. Overnight parking is $43 per night (and then you have to tip the valet as well). Why don't they just riase the price of the hotel room and include the parking - this makes you feel like they are gouging. We found a nearby parking garage that was only $30/night (still a lot). Hotels are becoming like airlines - they try to attract you with competitive rates and then gouge you with "extras" you need Just be honest about your charges up front folks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to everything!”
Reviews.Author: nissismusic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Francisco to celebrate our Anniversary. We loved the location of the hotel to the wharf because it was an easy walking distance. The F Line was right around the corner which took us down the the Ferry Building and the Bart line. We never had to rent a car with the easy access from the hotel to everything. The hotel had an incredible free breakfast buffet, rooms were clean and staff very helpful and friendly. The Wine Country Tour was a lot of fun with a shuttle from the Ferry Building and then a ferry back. A full day of history of SF and areas to the first stop to wonderful knowledge of wine making. V'Lattui a must! We had an amazing trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: GemsofSeduction
Reviews.Content: I stay here when I travel home to visit my family. I usually fly into SFO then stay here one night and drive up north where my family lives. The hotel and staff are just great. The layout is beautiful and the location is perfect. The second time I reserved the hotel I accidentally went one block down to the Holiday Inn at Fisherman's Wharf. That hotel was nice as well but I prefer the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites much more.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have chosen a better location if I tried.”
Reviews.Author: dave2step
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights while visiting San Francisco, and as far as Fisherman's Wharf goes, this is the best location you can find. You are literally just a few blocks walking distance from everything you want to see at Fisherman's Wharf, and from the cable cars and public transit for everything you want to see outside of Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are adequate and comfortable. Don't expect much of a view from your window though, as most rooms look into little concrete "courtyards" for lack of a better term. No big deal though. We never did try the complimentary breakfast, as I don't have the patience to wait in line and bump elbows with other guests, but it was obviously quite popular based on the long lines to get in. There is an IHOP, a Denny's, and a few other little breakfast restaurants right near the hotel, so we opted for those instead. The walls can seem to be a little thin at times, but otherwise it is a great place to rest your head while experiencing everything this interesting city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient base to see the sights.”
Reviews.Author: TwoTripsters
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location for most amenities, close to Fisherman's Wharf. The service was friendly and efficient. Breakfast was good with plenty to eat, though a pity about the paper plates and plastic cutlery. The rooms were large with comfortable beds. The only downside for us was expensive parking within the hotel: in excess of 40 dollars per night. There is a very good place to eat opposite the hotel entrance. Otherwise no complaints and would recommend for reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: sheerah69
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this Hotel is the location. You are less then 2 blocks to Fisherman's Wharf, sidewalk performers, sidewalk shopping, and many great seafood restaurants. To catch various bus lines, trolleys, and cable cars.....they are right out your door or 1/2 - 1 block away. There is a Safeway about 1 1/2 blocks away and a Starbucks on every corner. I have to say it was absolutely fabulous and #1 in my book for location. The hotel it self is excellent. Very clean, great beds and pillows, and extremely quiet. I am a very light sleeper and I never heard anyone in the halls, rooms next to us or above. I did hear some traffic but that doesn't bother me. Room was a great size with a large bathroom. The staff were very accomodating. We arrived there at 9:30 am and they allowed us to check in. We then asked for a fridge and they gave us one. It was supposed to be $5 a day, but the front desk lady said "You need it for medication, right?" Wink, wink, nudge, nudge, and they never charged us for it. We didn't leave until late the day of our check out and they locked our bags up with the bellboy and it was terrific. They weather was not very nice when we were there, but my son still enjoyed the pool. Very nice, clean, heated pool, that he enjoyed very much. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are going to be using the muni transport at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Fulham1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August 2010. The hotel is located two blocks away from the main Fisherman's Wharf area so is convenient for shops, eating and entertainment. The hotel itself is modern and well furnished. The rooms are comfortable with a good quality bathroom. Breakfast is provided inclusive in the price. This consists of cereals, bacon, eggs, muffins and pastries. One small note of caution. The earlier you get down for breakfast the better. Whilst the staff work hard to keep things stocked up the crowds from 8:45 to 9:30 mean that supplies temporarily run short and that queues build up and that it is difficult to find a seat. Try getting there earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: deshodge
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel from checking in to checking out. Everything was just great. It was an easy walk to Fisherman's wharf, Pier 39, and Ghiradelli Square. It was very clean, quiet, and safe area. The staff was absolutely fabulous. I arrived at the hotel early and our room was ready. Ask for an upgrade and it was done with no problem and no extra cost. Checking in and out was a breeze. I felt safe the entire time. There was internet service in the room which was a real convenience. The rooms also had a microwave and fridge which came in real handy. The breakfast was fabulous. There was a selection of everything from cereal to a hot breakfast. It was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SoniaE3
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel and price. The location was excellent for our first time visiting San Francisco. Easy to fill up on their breakfast too, which was a money saver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller77_10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay here, was handy for getting to place. Staff friendly, very clean and good bedrooms. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - A Canadian Opinion”
Reviews.Author: Denishe
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and at time of booking we were unsure as to where to stay - Union Square or Wharf. We where happy we chose the Wharf. This was an excellent location, it is located in the centre of the Wharf area and close (easy walk) to the Wharf, Pier 39, Cable cars, Ghiridelli Square, Lombard Street, Little Italy and so much more. The Hotel was clean, comfortable, quiet and staff where friendly. The free breakfast was an added bonus. The cinnamon buns are yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Apache95
Reviews.Content: My family and I loved this hotel!! The staff was sooooo friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was superb. Had a couple of issues with toilet and door on closet, but when we notified the front desk of this, they had sent someone up to look/fix within 15 min. Hotel is in a GREAT location. We had a fantastic view/suite on 4th floor overlooking the bay and Alcatraz. My family and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, could be better”
Reviews.Author: KJC348
Reviews.Content: Nice location, if you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf. FW is "ground zero" for everything touristy, better or worse. Disappointed by no refrig/microwave in the room. Room was smallish by American standards, although adequate. Bathroom very nice, bed comfortable, enough drawer/closet space. Breakfast was free but designated eating area ,off lobby, was crowded. Eggs & omelets (poor), cereal, fruit, juices (watery), coffee(watery), etc. If you can't afford breakfast out, it's OK but much better can be had in a block or 2 walking distance, especially "Pescatore" up the street @ Best Western Tuscan. Short walk to FW, Powell-Mason cable car, Cannery/Ghirardelli Square, etc. Property is close enough to FW but far enough away to be quiet, and is clean and well maintained. All in all, one could do better, but decent value. Also, parking very expensive, $45/nite in attached garage, so if you can avoid bringing or renting a car do so.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: VA_travel_hokies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights with our two teenage sons. It's just two blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, and was within easy walking distance of tourist spots, shopping restaurants, Pier 39, tour bus stops, etc. The room was very clean and the beds were extremely comfortable. The breakfast (included) was excellent - the best I've had at a hotel with "free" breakfast. They even had mini omelets and cinnamon rolls. The staff was very helpful. Downside: It cost $50 per day to park our rental car, but that's probably a typical price for San Francisco hotels. Free wi-fi only available in the lobby, not in the rooms. I highly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly medicore”
Reviews.Author: MarkOliverCanada
Reviews.Content: Staff fantasticly friendly. Room just like any of 1000s of other chain hotels and motels. Clean. Breakfast was not good. Greasy bacon and sausage and runny cold scrambled eggs. Only fruit was bananas. Watery juice. Big problem: only one working elevator. Sign on the other one was out of service and someone kept changing the numbers of days it's been down. It was up to seven when we arrived and still counting (14 now). Great location near the wharf. If you just want a regular room to sleep and shower no problem. Nothing special though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean, great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Tslammer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 30th and July 1st, The location is excellent. One block from the cable cars on Bay street and two blocks from Fishermans Wharf. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly. The b-fast was good with eggs, bacon/sausage, muffins, bagels, served in the morning. The price was good and It was the best hotel we stayed at durring our 8 day california trip. Parking is spendy, so we picked up the rental car the last day after we checked out. Rental car places are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Matresses has bugs”
Reviews.Author: moesul23
Reviews.Content: during my stay I was bitten 4 times by mattress bugs and my husband was bitten 3 times. The hotel denied the existence of any bugs. Stay away from it

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, clean, good breakfast included, good value”
Reviews.Author: dhoag123
Reviews.Content: Terrific location - 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. We stayed 3 nights. Buffet breakfast included eggs, sausage, bananas, bagels, toast, delicious cinnamon rolls, coffee, tea, juice, some other stuff. There's lots of hotels in this class and price range - what makes the difference (for us) is the staff. The staff at this hotel is super-friendly and anxious to help. My son sprained his ankle and one of the front desk personnel found him a cold chemical-compress. Ady at the front desk was awesome. Free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: Neridajane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for two nights and thank goodness it was only two nights. We were given a room on the ground floor. You could hear every single noise going on outside the room as the room was almost in the foyer. People walking past talking with no regard to people sleeping in these ground floor rooms. Twice we were woken by house keeping at 9.00am. To park you car cost $45 US dollars. What a joke. The FREE breakfast is just revolting, worse than school camp food. Definitely will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ateacher1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, close to Fishermans Wharf and the front desk was so friendly , especially Brandy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Midyear Holiday”
Reviews.Author: aussiedean
Reviews.Content: Would just like to pass on my feedback on this Hotel. Stayed for 5 nights and must say I was very impressed. The Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean, bathroom was excellent. Would be back in a flash if I come back to San Francisco. Oh yes the breakfast was also an added bonus. Good variety of food available. And finally a great location ......tram is close by for travel to Union square. Easy walk to the water front for the trip to Alcatraz. As Nike said ....... Just do it !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were so right”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyTravellers06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 for 4 nights after being recommended by a friend. We also read lots of reviews on Tripadvisor for this hotel and it was a good move to book the hotel. Very quiet considering how many people stay here, good complimentary breakfast but the breakfast room gets VERY busy. Very helpful staff on reception and lovely clean rooms with a very comfortable bed which is much needed after a busy day sightseeing in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: macavity22
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We travelled from England to stay for a week. This hotel provided a good price from the outset. We checked in really easily on a Memorial Day weekend Saturday. On booking in I asked if we had a twin room as I was with my Mum. We were booked into a double. Despite the busy day the receptionist could not have been nicer! She initially told us that they were full and that we could have a roll away bed. Then she commented that we were there for a week and should be better looked after and found us a twin room. The hotel is just a couple of minutes walk from Fishermans Wharf in one direction and the cable car turning table in another. The Market Street trolley goes from a block away taking you right up to the vicinity of Union Square. And that costs just $2 each. The room was fantastic. Immaculately clean, in good condition and with good facilities. Mum was pleased to get a good quality coffee from the machine in the bathroom. The shower was good and the beds extremely comfortable. Breakfast is part of the cost. Obviously not amazing and more of a buffet style. There is a hot breakfast with scrambled eggs and bacon. I personally found these rather hideous but everyone else seemed to eat them. Their cinnamon rolls were to die for though and there was plenty of choice for breakfast cereal. I was a little surprised that there was no Wifi in the rooms although this was available in the lobby. There is internet access in the rooms but via a cable so you would need a lap top. Fortunately I had brought along my laptop. So despite the internet I thought the hotel was fantastic and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fit All our Needs-Perfect hotel w/ great customer service”
Reviews.Author: AnnandTom
Reviews.Content: This hotel had it all, clean, convenient with friendly and helpful staff. We stayed at this location so that we would not need a car during this portion of our trip to CA. Complimentary breakfast offered good variety.We were within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and Lombard Street (Crookest Street), and close to trolly terminal. The front desk staff were invaluable. They helped with all our needs - directions, dining options and "coordination of transportation". Kudos to HIE and the entire staff for making this portion of our trip so nice:)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great price!”
Reviews.Author: mjkearns10999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for three nights at the beginning of our California coast trip and one night at the end of our trip and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel seemed to have been recently updated and the rooms were nicely appointed, very clean and quiet location (rooms were not overly large in size but what you would expect to find in a big city, I've stayed in much smaller rooms in NYC for three times the price). The staff was always very helpful with any questions we had. The complimentary breakfast buffet was a nice perk and there was plenty of food to get us started on our days of touring the city (we usually ate breakfast around 7am so it may get crowded later in the morning). The parking was $43 per day plus tax and I could see how other travelers would think this was high but having paid $50-$75 in NYC for hotel parking, I did not feel this was unfair, plus you can take your car in and out as many times during the day as you like. The location of the hotel was just two blocks away from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and the public trolleys. It was a great hotel for a great price and we'll definitely be back on our next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: LovetoTravel154933
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights - great location for many of the attractions in San Francisco - walking distance to many with the cable cars very close by as well. Clean, comfortable rooms. Breakfast was very busy each day - line ups - but the food was fine. I would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good HI Express Property...beware the car park fee”
Reviews.Author: 0362Paul
Reviews.Content: As with all HI express hotels in the USA that I have ever used no real complaints about this one. Great location, good size room and perfect for a family with young kids. Breakfast was free though it was badly organised and there were huge queues each of the two mornings we were there. None the less perferctly ok. Watch out for the car park. 2 nights costs us as much as room.....my fault..should have etaken the hire car back but worth noting.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: VerTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn on the Warf and loved it. The room was very clean and quiet. It is very close to all of the Warf attractions and for the price it is the a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Peach14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights with a teenage daughter and son. This hotel was in a great position with easy access to all of the tourist sights and transport. The hotel was far enough away from the seedier parts of Fishermans Wharf to feel safe but there are a lot of homeless on the streets. The rooms were clean and roomy and the front desk staff were very helpful. It is a busy hotel and the breakfast is a little uninspired. The access to the internet in the business centre is limited to the over 18 year olds which drove my kids mad. Some amenities (pool) are not located at this hotel but next door at the Holiday Inn so best to check if the amenities you require are on site. This wasn't an issue for us as it was cool when we were there,

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good hotel and NO Complaints”
Reviews.Author: sarahHove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights with our daughter (25) and son (18) and could not fault the quality. The bedrooms were very comfortable and the beds made and towels replenished every day. The staff were all welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was plentiful and provided a good start to the day. The location of this hotel is ideal as it is on Fishermans Wharf near the Alcatraz Ferry, two of the cable car start points, the F Line (lovely old refurbished trolley cars) and the journey into Union Square takes approx 20-25 minutes by cable car. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and all four of us could not fault it. Our room may not have had a view but we spent so little time in the rooms that it did not matter - the main thing is the beds were very comfortable and you are given a choice of pillows (soft or firm).

Reviews.Title: “A great deal considering the location!”
Reviews.Author: Riverwood
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my teen-aged daughter and wanted to book a place close to the action. This Holiday Inn Express fit the bill. I was originally skeptical about the "included breakfast" but was pleasantly surprised at how much was offered. Within a two minute walk, you are in the thick of what there is to do. Whether it is the cable cars, the ferries, Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 or one of the many vendors who offer some type of transportation around the city (double-decker bus, "Go-Car's" or bicycles) it was always right around the corner. The front desk staff was very accommodating and even stored our luggage the day of departure. We didn't want to to schlep our bags around since we were catching the red-eye. They gladly stored our bags and let us access them a few times during the day. The housekeepers were equally friendly. The rooms were very clean and they did a great job. The only negative was the teenagers who ran down the hall past our room late at night. We were near the elevator so this type of noise is to be expected. While the hotel is on the "no frills" side of things, you do not feel like you sacrificed anything. When we go back, this will be a place we will most certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Situated For The Wharf”
Reviews.Author: SteveHammer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during March. The hotel is perfectly situated for all the attractions of Fishermans Wharf. It's your typical HIE so you know what to expect from the rooms. Lovely view of Alcatraz from our window, Although very busy when we were there it was very quiet in the rooms. Good selection of items for breakfast although it tended to get very crowded in the breakfast area about 9.00. On piece of advice though. If your planning on hiring a car and touring around California, and San Francisco is your first stop. Dont pick it up until your leaving SF. This hotel (and most others) charge in excess of $40 a day parking. It's only a $7 cab fare to the rentals on O'Farrell Street. I would also definitely recomend the hop on / hop off City Sightseeing buses. They leave from just around the corner on Leavenworth St. We purchased a 48 hour ticket and certainly got our moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “RUBBISH RUBBIH RUBBISH”
Reviews.Author: merangutang
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel which does not honour its booking confirmations. I booked & paid in advance via an hotel internet site & I will NEVER NEVER do this again. We were a party of 5 & booked 2 rooms, each with 2 beds. On arrival we were informed that they could ONLY provide us with 2 rooms but each only had 1 bed. I would have walked out but as the rooms had been prepaid--had little choice BUT I created a big fuss & eventually was given what I had booked-very reluctantly & the manageress had the nerve to inform me that as I had not booked direct then I went to the bottom of their allocation list. I was shocked. This dump has no bellboy--no conceirge--does not allow outside phone calls from your room & our rooms were VERY VERY SMOKEY--despite requestng non-smoking rooms. Anybody who stays in this dump must be a lunatic. Their so called complimentary breakfast is a joke---fit for pigs only. The only good thing is the location, which I admit was excellent BUT do not park your car here or you will be RIPPED off almost 50$ per day including a tip.. We were a family group of U.K. tourists

Reviews.Title: “good value, great sleep, clean room.”
Reviews.Author: nikw32
Reviews.Content: Was a little disappointed in comparison with a previous Cali hotel visited before this one, but you pay for what you get. Before I continue, beds were super comfy (and I'm fussy!) and we slept like babies each night. Checked in to find that our booking was not known of (booked online from Australia, and confirmed before we left). Was quite unnerving, but was eventually told that booking went through, it just wasn't transferred to 'the system' for some reason. As a result, we slept in a pretty dodgy room with a view to other rooms (kept curtains closed) and moved the next day (a bit of a pain) to a better room, with a view of other rooms and also some buildings towards somewhere. (Note to others - confirm with hotel before you leave home). Room was clean, beds awesome. No bar fridge (express hotel). Breakfast was horrendous. We went elsewhere each day, even though it was paid for. It just wasn't worth the experience. People everywhere, not enough room to sit down, huge queues for horrible, cold, powdered 'eggs', patties of something and toast. NOT worth it. Found a lovely place down the road, owned by a Mexican family - the best eggs benedict! Otherwise, a great location, close to the wharf and a walk to the Italian quarter (had a nice dinner up there!). We walked to Union Square too, just pack good walking shoes to get there without blisters :-) Overall, enjoyed San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “great value & location”
Reviews.Author: millyPerthWestAus
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco with children ( 9,11,13), we had a 2 bedroom family suite, which was spacious, even with the sofa bed pulled out. The beds were comfortable and you have a choice of soft or firm pillows, well done!! The staff were friendly, very helpful with directions and recommendations. Shuttle from the airport was $58 and took about 30 mins. The hotel was walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square and cable cars/ trams, that took you everywhere else. Complimentary breakfast was good value, especially for fussy eaters, staff were always topping the food up and cleaning away. We stayed during "Spring break....." and even with the extra people around, we didn't feel rushed or had to wait long. Generally a nice clean hotel and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and so very close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: outoftownernow
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco, when we booked our hotel we were aware it was close to the Pier, but it was well within walking distance to the trolley and cable cars too. We would have skipped renting a car for the days we were in San Francisco had we known just how close we were to things. Parking below the hotel is $49.00 a night, something we were not aware of is the parking situation for the whole city. I do believe we could have parked on the street down the street, but waiting for a free spot would have been tricky. They also clean the streets a few nights a week, so you could not really park overnight some days. The hotel is clean, and quiet. It was one of the best Holiday Inn Express hotels we have experienced. The breakfast was really quite good, plentiful, and fresh, It is also close to a Walgreens, and a Safeway Grocery store inside a mall like structure, but you dont really see it advertised on the outside. Everything we needed or wanted all within walking distance. The car stayed parked for the weekend that we stayed in the City. We did get a City Pass for the unlimited Muni system, (Cable cars &Trolly are what we used often) and also took in a few attractions the pass offered. I would recommend this location to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “room comfort”
Reviews.Author: mrchaos
Reviews.Content: Very few times I am impressed with the service at the check in lobby. Most of the time, in other hotels, perhaps they are busy, the service is sporadic. The rooms are satisfactory but onre of the most stringent requirement of my stay at any hotel is the quality of the pillows. I am happy with this issue.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: delia6110
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to San Francisco and decided to stay closer to Fisherman's Wharf (previously stayed in Nob Hill which was nice too!). This hotel seemed newly renovated with modern updates and very comfortable. It was convenient to everything and it was nice to have a Denny's next door to grab a quick breakfast. The staff was good. Our room was always kept clean. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “I liked the place”
Reviews.Author: AhmedTaher
Reviews.Content: Though the scene from the room was not good at all, still, we enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: jbflyaustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights on a break from Hawaii. This hotel is express as it is described. With saying that it was much more pleasant and clean and service orientated than the hotel we stayed in in Hawaii. The location of this hotel is brilliant. one block from cable cars one block from trolley cars. walkable to union square china town and other great areas. a brilliant ittle cafe next to the hotel that does real coffee not the milky style starbucks but real expresso coffee and brilliant breaky. the hotel does include a continental breaky but it is all heavily processed so if you want non constituted eggs anad fresh bakery and great coffee go to the cafe next door. the rooms were very clean and comfortabe. the staff here are very friendly and nothing seemed to much trouble at all. you feel 100% safe all the time with security guards on over night at the entrance. there is a safeway and barnes and noble a block away in the event you need some supplies.also the hotel has a business center which is free internet access and also free wifi in the lobby 24/7 all in all could not fault this property. will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love”
Reviews.Author: PenciaT
Reviews.Content: We used our points for the room. Very nice hotel not ritzy, but quaint & all of the staff were attentive to our needs

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get - not saying its bad though”
Reviews.Author: place-name-here
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near Fisherman's Wharf Pier 39 amongst all other hotels in a one block radius. If you're planning on catching all the typical tourist attractions like Alcatraz, cable cars and Ghirardelli near the waterfront then this is the place to be...if you're more into shopping in Union square, browsing Chinatown, and Golden gate bridge then look elsewhere (ideally finanical district) since transportation is required. Parking is valet only but so are all other hotels in the area; for 2 day parking it cost $98! The rooms looked recently refreshed but could have been cleaner...the ceilings had dirty handprints and the bathroom had grimy residue from use but i overlooked this which is saying a lot since cleanliness is #1 factor for me. The heating system was extremely loud which at times was welcoming since you could hear next door. Everyday i saw someone cleaning the banister or vacuuming the main areas so at least they're clean in that sense. The contintential breakfast was free so i am not going to complain on the quality since you pay for what you get. Overall for the location, quality, and price in San Francisco i thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than expected..”
Reviews.Author: karenb425
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. It was close to everything and very clean. Surronded by other more "pricey" hotels without breaking the bank. We had a king room. The bed was very comfortable. The decor was good as well as the service. They served a hot breakfast every morning for free. We WILL be back. The only down side was no view. Which was fine because the room was bright. Plus the only view you could get was of another building.

Reviews.Title: “Many Improvements Needed”
Reviews.Author: mrmouse32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and have always had an excellent experience staying at Holiday Inn Express, except for this one. The walls are not very thick and it is easy to hear entire conversations from the people staying next to you. There was no heavy blankets and so we had to request some and the front desk representative asked us to come down to the front desk and get them ourselves because the housekeeping staff were off duty. Additionally we were assigned to a room directly outside of the street car tracks and would hear the streetcar go by every 20 mins or so. The streetcar did not stop until shortly after midnight. Breakfast was ok but much different compared to the other Holiday Inn Expresses where we have stayed. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Very HAPPY”
Reviews.Author: Iammadabouttravel
Reviews.Content: We were happy at the hotel. The staff were excellent, the room was very clean, the location was perfect. We left a fair bit of our belongs at the hotel in a drawer, A wonderful man named Michael organised it to been mail back to Australia, it was back within a week, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nails1
Reviews.Content: Can Recommend this Hotel - I booked a suite for our family of six that had 2 Queen Beds & a Pull out Sofa Bed. It was great!.. They were all in one big room which was fine as it was very spacious. The Beds were really really comfortable. Suite only had one bathroom but this was clean & spacious too. Had a fairly nice outlook over the street was also really handy to everything! The staff were very pleasant & really helpful. The Complimentry Breakfast was Great too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lovetogetaway14
Reviews.Content: Our family visited San Francisco over the new year holiday. We chose this hotel because we could walk to Fishermen's Wharf. When I first called the hotel to inquire about the room configurations, I was helped by Brandy. I was very impressed by her attitude and willingness to help with our stay. Once we got to the hotel, I introduced myself and was happy to see she was just as sweet in person. She helped us out during our stay when we decided to move to a family suite and made the transition as smooth as possible. Now I must say all the front desk people were very nice, but Brandy just made a lasting impression on me. If our business wasn't so far away, I would try to get her to come work for us! The breakfast was pretty good, one day had more selections then the other, but still enough for everyone in the family to get filled up. We ate at Boudins (Fishermen's Wharf) and had some great meals upstairs. Downstairs is a cafe with some nice sandwiches and salads for something quick and cheap. If you walk down a couple of blocks towards Ghiradelli Square there is a Cold Stone, we had that for dessert most nights. We had been to San Francisco before and drove around but we wanted to hear more about the city so we went on a organized tour through Great Pacific. My husband and I and our 13 yr old really enjoyed this, we learned so much and our driver was great. He remembered everyone's names and answered all our questions, I think his name was Malcolm. I would highly recommend it. We also went on a free walking tour of Chinatown, I enjoyed it, but my kids got a little antsy. (It was very cold that morning) Volunteers lead walking tours all over San Francisco for free, just look around on the internet, they really know the city. The Pacific Heights mansion tour looked interesting but we didn't have the time. The family suite was very large and we loved the free internet. My daughter left her pink football in the room and we called when we got home and housekeeping mailed it to us. I was very pleased with our stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: BandBAdventures
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Fran on Thanxgiving nite on our way to Yosemite,we had a pleasant stay at the Holiday Inn Express,after we checked in we ran into a problem with our first room we was givin,it smelled like a baby had vomitted on the carpet,so I walked in the hall and ran into the maintance man and informed him of the smell in the room.He went into our room and agreed that it did had a smell,he picked up the phone and called the front desk and got us another room on the same floor just a few doors down even helped us with our bags,only complaint is the parking but no matter where you stay at in Fisherman's Wharf you will pay for parking,but the valet was more than helpful when we needed our car,he also gave us excellent instructions on walking the area,The whole staff was very helpful and friendly.Unless you have a suite do not expect a view. Also Lombart Street and Cotl Tower are just around the corner.The Harley Davidson shop is right across the srteet on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend - good value and service”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_Skies06
Reviews.Content: Wasnt thrilled about paying for parking but not much choice if you decide to stay around Fishermans Wharf. I had to move my car numerous times as I was also shuttling my college kid to and from the hotel and her job in town. The valet guys were very helpful and nice no matter how many times I came and went. For a freebie breakfast the meal was fine. At least it was more than yogurt, cereal and fruit. They also had eggs (okay they were not great) bacon,sausage, toast, bagels, cinamon rolls etc . If yource watching your pennies or have a large group, this is the way to go. Ady at the front desk was very helpful and I appreciated her booking our Alcatraz tour. The location is very convenient. Would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “OK but avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RowleyEssex
Reviews.Content: Good location close to all Fisherman's Wharf amenities, reasonable room and the front desk staff are friendly enough. The breakfast though is memorable for it's sheer awfulness - eat out there are plenty of options around

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dph45232
Reviews.Content: I have been to SF before and stayed in the other Holiday Inn around the corner. I opted for the Express as it was the same price but included breakfast :-) and It was an amazing breakfast. Plenty to eat and set us up for the day. The beds were truly amazing, so comfortable and a choice of pillows too. It was great to have a reception area that you could actually sit in - so many hotels don't have them these days. It also had conference facilities but these were barely noticable. Some hotels tend to forget their 'holiday' guests but they didnt. All the staff that we encountered were most friendly, polite and helpful. The 2 pc's + printer were a very useful item. The room was spacious and an ample spaced bathroom. Great place to stay to go sightseeing - we also purchased the 3 day muni pass ($18) - a great saving - (one of the cable cars is $5 one way!) Good shopping/shopping centre and all easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MaxRoom
Reviews.Content: Stayed with family for a few days in October. Conveniently located within walking distance of tourist attractions (or the transport to get there). Hop on-hop off bus tours a few minutes away as are a multitude of seafood restaurants. Our hotel room was clean, beds were comfortable and front desk staff were friendly. Free internet access handy for catching up emails etc. We enjoyed our stay here but ended on a sour note.
