On our last morning whilst enjoying the complimentary breakfast, our family were singled out of a room full of people and asked if we were guests there, room number, name (I was waiting for a question about my social security number). The "gentleman" who did the asking wasn't particularly polite, he left the distinct impression that we weren't welcome. As the breakfast area is located near reception, the hotel should either insist that guests leave their room keys on the tables while eating or come up with a better system than giving paying guests the third degree whilst they are eating. Based on this experience, although we plan to revisit San Francisco, we won't ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: LondonEmster
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean it met all my requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend - great location and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: willdc1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the recommendations of others on tripadvisor and it was within our budget and booked this hotel on the holiday inn express website. We really enjoyed our stay here - it's so well located - about 5 minute walk to the powell-mason cable car turnaround which goes to union square. It's also about a 5 minute walk to the powell-hyde cable car turnaround which goes past lombard street (crookedest street). The hotel is literally round the corner from the 'route f' trolley car which goes down embarcadero near pier 39 and also pier 33 (where you catch the ferry to alcatraz). I got an all-day muni pass which gives you unlimited journeys for the day on the cable cars and trolley buses and street buses - ideal for wandering around and seeing everything. You can get 1 day, 3 day and 5 day passes. Anyway, I digress - back to the hotel.... The hotel itself is spacious and has a large reception area - it's modern inside and in good shape. The check-in was quick and staff helpful. We took the lift up to our floor. The room was large,spotless and quiet. It had plenty of wardrobe space and a tv.The bed was soooo comfy. The bathroom was a decent size and spotless with a great shower - the hotel provided soap and shampoo. Breakfast was included in the room rate. They provided the most wonderful apple muffins I have ever tasted. Also available as part of the continental breakfast menu was scrambled egg, egg omelette, cinnamon buns, bread /toast, beef patties (thin burgers), bananas, yoghurt and a selection of cereals. Plus the usual selection of teas, coffee and fruit juices. Breakfast was self service so you could go back as many times as you wanted, but do be careful if you go to breakfast about 8.30am as they did tend to run out of things, especially my beloved cinnamon muffins! Just inside the main entrance there are 2 PCs with free internet access and also a printer. There is also a separate touchscreen for online check-in for airlines only, which is attached to a printer so you can print out your boarding card. All extremely handy. All in all, it's a great hotel which I can definitely recommend and wouldn't hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for location,room space and value for money”
Reviews.Author: carolineking2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremley comfortable,great beds and lots of space(we had a family room) Being within walking distance of everything you wish to do in San Francisco,the location is superb. The staff were very friendly and most accomadating and helpfull.I would normally judge a hotel by its price but not this as the cost was v ery low for what was a superb place to stay. Highly recomend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Not particularly impressed with the service”
Reviews.Author: kme123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the middle of a trip around the US, and paid the highest room rate ($152 per night) of my entire trip. I've stayed in several Holiday Inn Express hotels before, so had a good idea of what to expect, and while this hotel wasn't terrible, it wasn't great, either. The room itself was OK, but one of the TV channels didn't work. I reported this twice (the first time nothing was done) and was then told that the hotel didn't carry the channel. This despite it being PBS, and listed as a channel. Breakfast was OK, but was always busy. I don't really eat eggs and am vegetarian, but the hot breakfast looked really unpleasant, especially the eggs. However, what really annoyed me was that I discovered after leaving the hotel that I'd lost a necklace. I rang the hotel, described the necklace and asked them to let me know if they found it. I've not heard anything from them since. The hotel's clean, housekeeping was efficient and my room was fine, but I won't stay here again because of the service.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at any other place”
Reviews.Author: Katsuko
Reviews.Content: Went for a long weekend in June (25th to 28th, 2009) for some shopping and sightseeing with friends. Three women sharing a room. All staff from the front desk to housekeeping were polite and pleasant - really made us feel welcome. Very clean rooms. Location is fabulous - just between 1 and 5 blocks to the piers at Fisherman's Wharf, both cable cars (Powell-Mason and Powell-Hyde) and Ghiradelli Square. Take the cable cars (either one) to Union Square for shopping. Take the Powell-Hyde cable car to Lombard Street and Chinatown. Very good breakfast - nice selection of food. The only drawback about the hotel is that the rooms do have internet but it is not wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but Amenities lacking”
Reviews.Author: andiezoe66
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and thought it was a great location. We were in town for a music festival so needed to be able to drive to and from AT&T Park each day. We also went out with friends Friday night in North Beach which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. My biggest complaint was with the key cards. We had a horrible time using the key cards into the annex hotel elevator (the one with the Denny's) and into our room. We also saw other guest have the same issues. We had the key cards replaced twice and still had issues. If we were staying longer than two nights this would have been a bigger issue and I would have requested a room in the main hotel. My other problem with the hotel was how noisy it was. I was woken up early each morning by other people in the building. The walls seemed paper thin. You could hear everything. I would stay in the Fisherman's Wharf again, but probably would try a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: IowanativeinKC
Reviews.Content: Location is near to everything - including cable cars to get you anywhere in the city. The rooms were spotless. The staff was helpful. We were there 5 nights and had two separate rooms. Perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Bigcohuna
Reviews.Content: This place is in an excellent location, you can walk to everything. We are a family of 5 and had the larger suite, it suited us well. We arrived early about 10 .30 am - no problems our room was ready & speedy check in. Breakfast had a good & plentiful selection. We had a ground floor room, which was convenient. We did not have a car - you could walk or use public transport easily.We hired bicycles just around the corner. It was a little more than we expected to pay,but was good value for a family of 5 compared to others we had researched.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for a great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jaryd6
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights here for my honeymoon. The room was on the small side, and our view was a back alley, but who cares, it's our honeymoon, we weren't exactly worried about the view. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was impossibly clean. The staff is very helpful and friendly, also there to answer questions and make recs. Also, the breakfast was very good, and always crowded. Great location, bus stop is very close, and most things are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, modern and clean...breakfast included!10/10!”
Reviews.Author: crazycollie
Reviews.Content: Whenever I land at SFO, I always spend the first night here. After a long flight from the UK, its important to be in a clean, modern hotel from where you can walk to a multitude of activities - from eating at the 'Rain Forest Cafe' or 'Hard Rock Cafe' (buying the tee shirt too of course!), to seeing (and smelling!) the sealions (or are they seals? - sorry that I dont know which they are!!). its also just a short hop to the cable car or you can walk south to 'Union Square' where a bit of retail therapy might be called for..you can find everything from the Levis store to the 'Cheesecake factory' (at the top of Macey!). Unfortunately you DO have to pay for parking at the hotel, but parking is a problem in SF as most major cities, and its not cheap either..but, once again, you're in a major city so splash out for the location, location, location!!Have a super trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: timkoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Rooms very clean, staff helpful and friendly. Free breakfast helps especially with discounted room rates (reserved/paid early - nonrefundable). If you like to walk a little, it's a few blocks from the wharf, a few blocks the other way to Lombard St. A little over a mile to Chinatown. Had a great stay no complaints about anything.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: PRANDJR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and had a wonderful time. Our rooms were ready and clean upon arrival and check in was fast and easy. The breakfast was decent for being free. Eggs, toast, bacon or sausage, rolls etc. It did get busy but it was a large seating area and we always found a table. The location was excellent. Ten to Fifteen minute walk depending on your pace to Hyde Street Pier, Pier 39 and the wharf area. Walking distance to alcatrez pier as well. Also close to Cable cars and drop offs and pick ups for sightseeing tours. Staff was friendly and helpful when approached. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pembrokepines
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Helpful Staff. Clean rooms. Satisfying breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: drkathy99
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better hotel for the price on the wharf. The rooms are clean and very quiet (unlike at the Hilton Wharf where my boss stayed, she complained the walls were paper thin). Great breakfast, free wi-fi in room, nice size room, comfortable beds, great location. Staff was very friendly. Absolutely no complaints or problems. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Nick335
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing location, only a short walk to the waterfront, Ghirardelli Square and numerous other attractions. Once you make it to the area around Pier39, there are streetcars that will take you up/down the Embermercado (including a BART station). We chose to take a taxi from SFO to the hotel instead of BART (due to luggage, etc.) but we did everything else via public transit. Back to the hotel itself, the rooms were clean and well maintained. My only gripe was the lack of a mini-fridge. I personally prefer to keep bottled water in the room. Considering there's so much to see, I'd definitely recommend staying at this hotel and using the money saved to visit the attractions. The staff was awesome and let us store our bags in their locked office when we arrived early (8am).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Bill_in_Guelph
Reviews.Content: Got a Kingbed room #458 (top floor). Very quiet and comfortable. Located 2 blocks from the wharf. We would definitely stay here again. Breakfast is standard Holiday Inn Expresss fare. Knuckles across the street has a very good menu at a reasonable price. The Franciscan (seafood and pastas), Bubba Gumps (shrimp) and Hard Rock are all at Pier 39 a 10 minute walk. The Cannery and Ghiardelli's are 5 minutes west. Street cars and buses are either right in front of the hotel or 1 block north. Get a MUNI pass 1 block east and south at Mason and Bay for all cable cars, streetcars and buses. This hotel has a perfect location for sightseeing. Fog makes the area cooler than elsewhere in the city - bring a light sweater or wind jacket. It was only a 15 minute walk to the Alcatraz Ferry - book in advance and take the early bird tour. The street car takes you downtown in 10 minutes. Exit a Powell Street (Union Square) for the Powell / Mason cable car back. There is a large shopping mall across from the stop or wander through the stores at the square. Sausolito is across the Bay - warm and sunny. Nice boutique style shops. We took the ferry back to the Ferry Terminal which makes for good photo ops.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Breakfast Included”
Reviews.Author: Angus83
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel basically for the free breakfast, location, and cost. The breakfast buffet was all right, it had a wide variety - eggs, sausage, bacon, cold cereal, yogurt, bananas, bagels, toast, cinnamon rolls (which were cold all but one morning... minus points there), etc. It did get really, really busy later in the morning. You basically get what you are paying for, but we wanted to stay on a budget and not have to purchase breakfast every morning. Mission Accomplished. The location of the hotel was good for our first trip to SF. It was close to the F-line transit stop and the cable car turnaround, walking distance to Pier 39 and lots of other shopping areas and restaurants. We felt safe walking back to it, even later in the evening... we never really were out past midnight. Just stayed aware of our surroundings, which is a given. We had little interaction with the staff aside from check-in. Requested towels a couple times as did not have them enter and clean room daily. Towels were delivered in a timely manner. Our room had basically no view, we looked out on this closed, tiny courtyard. But it was nice and quiet and clean. It was really small, but looking at the exit map it appears we had an oddly placed and shaped room. And it was for sleeping in and that's about it. It served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: minack_7
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the accommodation at this hotel and the room was quiet, clean and spacious. The king bed was very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was excellent and there was plenty of choice of food. The location was great well within walking distance of a supermarket, the various forms of transport such as the cable car etc and the wharf area including Pier 39. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great Location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: bluedriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the end of July. great location if you want to be in Fisherman's Wharf - near Pier 39, the cablecar turnaround, etc Great room for the price - next to much more expensive hotels so you didnt have to pay for the location! Only downer was the breakfast. Room was too small for the tons of people staying. Only one Toaster for all of them. Too few tables and chairs. BUT the room and location were great

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Wheaties
Reviews.Content: We only had 5 hours in San Francisco, so this was the ideal place for us to be close to several attractions. Fisherman's Wharf is 2 blocks away, as is Pier 39. There are shops and restaurants lining the streets all around this area. There is even a Burger King, if you are on a tight budget. The trolleys stops are close, and there are several open air tour bus stops nearby. The open air buses are the best way to get an overview of the city if you are on a tight schedule. You can hop-off some of these and then get back on when you are ready to proceed to the next attraction. There is a lot of upscale shopping, i.e. Neiman Marcus, Macy's, etc. but also Mom and Pop shops. The only drawback to this HIE was that there were no suite rooms. The rooms are large enough, however, to use a blow up mattress or sleeping bag. The breakfast was very basic, but stocked very well with bagels and yogart. The architecture was beautiful. The hallways were clean and bright with natural sunlight streaming in. I would recommend packing a hoodie and a jacket. Yes, it sounds strange but you will need it, even in the middle of summer. There is only valet parking at this hotel, and you do have to pay for the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brentom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed six nights at this hotel - great room, great complimentary breakfast with a reasonable price for tourist season. Front desk staff and Valet staff could answer any question we had and provided good solid suggestions and information. Location is perfect - two blocks to Fishermans Wharf, and two blocks to Cable Cars which will take you to many tourist locales. My only suggestions upon completing hotel survey, was the addition of a small giftshop, where snacks, papers, and toiletries could be purchased and to clean their windows! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: LisaHBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, the breakfast was fine. It is nothing special. Breakfast was chaotic with the crowds of people trying to get their fill of bad eggs. The neighborhood feels sketchy with the throngs of homeless and cheesy stores lining the street. We walked in a four block radius trying to find a decent restaurant to no avail. If you really want to stay in the area, stay closer to Embarcadaro so you are near the aquarium, Hard Rock and Market Street.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive for Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: GrandPoohbaH
Reviews.Content: If you want a pricey breakfast this is the place to come to. Breakfast for 3 was $60. My son only had a water and cereal,my wife Tea, fruit Juice,cereal and a waffle and I had coffee,fruit Juice,Cereal and Yoghurt. Lesson learned I suppose, right across the street 10meters away lovely small cafe that did breakfast for 3 for $26. Valet parking was $40 per day, but is to be expected at San Francisco. Pool was busy with not enough sun loungers. Hotel is very central for all Wharf activities, Pier 39 only 10 minutes walk. Hotel Rooms were clean and fairly spacious, free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - fantasic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: WTFamily
Reviews.Content: Right near eveything you could want. Bus 30 to the Explainitorum right outide. Cable cars one short block - this gives you access to an experience of a ride (or two) and to the city centre. Pier 39 within a 15 minute stroll. The location was one of the reasons that we booked this hotel. The breakfast was expensive but worth every 'penny' as it was a great start to our very busy day. Word of warning the weather - changable - needing four layers and still cold, to being able to sunbathe all within about 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice Holiday Inn!”
Reviews.Author: setiramm
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Wharf. If you like to run, location is also accessible to nice running area of the city. Room itself on the small side but more than reasonable. Coming from NYC, actually seems more spacious than some NYC hotel rooms! Hotel is well maintained. Complimentary breakfast is basic and they do have hot food, which is good enough. The work out room is quite sad and pathetic. No pool. WiFi worked flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller305
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were greeted by extremely friendly staff on the frontdesk. We arrived at 2.30pm and realised that check-in was not until 3pm - however we were given a room immediately. The room was large and clean. Complimentary breakfast is a bonus but it was busy every morning and we found it difficult to get a table. The hotel is one block away from Fisherman's Wharf and a very short walk from Pier 39. I would recommend a taxi to Union Square which costs approx. $8 each way. An excellent stay was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ELC94
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in san francisco and didnt really no what to expect. after a very long flight we arrived at the hotel to a warm welcome from the staff and they brought the luggage in for us and brought it to our room. the room was very clean and the beds were so comfy (very good to get over jet lag). the breakfast was good at 7:15 in the morning but if you got there after 8 there was nothing left. apart from that me and my family were very pleased with the service and the feel of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: JOCURT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 18th - 22nd, 2009. Weather was great during this time. Read all the reviews prior to booking and arriving so we knew what to expect and we were not disappointed. King room was clean and comfortable, a little on the small side , but we were on the go and rarely in the room so it didn't matter. As with some of the other reviews we had a view of a cement courtyard. Breakfast was adequate but I hate standing in line for toast!!!! People can tend towards rudeness when they are hungry!!!! Short walk to Fishermans Wharf and with lots to see and do. Check out the "free" museum with all the old arcade games...awesome! We walked alot at night and felt very safe in this area. **Side Note** I was watching "Little People Big World" on TLC the other day. Amy goes to San Francisco with her sisters and they stayed at the Hyatt across the street. One scene when they come out the front doors shows the Holiday Inn Express perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: sftbllmomNevada
Reviews.Content: Decent size hotel, located right in the middle of the Fisherman's Wharf. Great location! A lot of bus tours, bike tours are within a 2 block walk. Plenty of food and sights, all within walking distance. I do not recommend bringing a car, as you can walk everywhere and parking is pricey, $41 a day at this hotel. We were a little disappointed when we checked in because we were not greeted as Priority club members. Usually at check in you are greeted and given water or cookies. Not the end of the world, but a little touch we have received at every other Holiday Inn Express, and we like it. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous. The room was a little small but clean. No view, unless you like looking at the concrete walls and other peoples rooms. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The bathroom was clean. The breakfast was good. Eggs, bacon, cereal, bagels, toast, ect. They had their great cinnamon buns but they were luke warm at best. They stack the buns on top of each other so they don't have to refill so often but in doing that they never have a chance to heat up. They are still good but definitely not the same as when they are fresh and warm! It gets really busy! I noticed they stopped putting out fresh buns at around 8:30. Once they stop putting out fresh food your selection goes down FAST! I would suggest getting there before 8:30 if you want a good hearty breakfast. They provide a decent size seating area but it is always full, so search for a seat before you get your food and have another family member hold it. Did not use the fitness room but it looked nice and big. We always use their computer as we would rather not bring our laptop. Their lobby is large. Overall, we had an average stay. Just thought it was kind of pricey for the size and quality of the room. Again, nothing fancy or special, but you will have a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Utah_Doanes
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel based on its location to the Fisherman's Wharf / Pier 39 area. It was very convenient to all the touristy areas, 5 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was very clean and the breakfast was nice. However, our room was very small, and our window looked out into an enclosed cement area. When I opened the curtains to let some light in, the guy in the room across the way was staring into our room. Needless to say the curtains stayed closed. The bathroom was also very small, it just all felt very cramped. Although they had high-speed internet it is not WiFi and at least in our room my cell phone got no service, if I sat by the window I was lucky to get one bar. All in all, it was close to the places we wanted to see and it was clean but it wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KKCanada1
Reviews.Content: We stayed July19-22. Our experience was very positive. We did not bring a laptop so we used the 2 complimentary computers in the lobby. There was sometimes a wait -- generally it wasn't too long. The complimentary breakfast was above average but you had to get there early. We quickly learned that July/Aug are not warm months in SF. The temp was probably +10, cloudy & windy. Not the best. We did go to Alcatraz. We didn't have tix ahead of time but the concierge at the Holiday Inn down the street advised that if we go by 7am & wait in line, we'll likely get on the 9am departure. It worked. Because of the crappy weather, we also visited the Science Museum - worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: foggydoggy
Reviews.Content: We travel to San Francisco frequently and have a few favorite places to stay. However, we made reservations at the Holiday Inn Express on North Point, Fisherman's Wharf...quite spur of the moment when the Tuscan Inn unfortunately could not meet our needs. And what a pleasant stay it was... From our very first contact with hotel staff on entering the hotel, the service was superb. The young lady at the desk, expecting a baby...I don't recall her name, was highly professional, extremely pleasant, quite honestly one of the nicest front desk encounters we've ever had...and we've stayed in many hotels in San Francisco. She was delightful, and her coworkers were professional and delightful as well. The entry is large, the lobby a tad unavoidably dark, but well appointed and spacious with several groupings of comfortable furniture and a center fireplace. Underground parking access at the entry. Sufficent elevators, while the floors are decorated in a cruise ship atmosphere/motif with porthole style windows and railings. Quiet, spacious hallways. Our room, a king deluxe, was on an upper floor, facing inside. The room was small to fair in size, not as typically small as San Francisco hotel rooms can be, but I wouldn't have wanted the room to be any smaller. My only disappointment in the room was the inside facing view. The building is accordioned and therefore, we looked out onto another wall of the building, and a small narrow outside utility corridor. ...it was a tad claustrophobic, so we just ignored that aspect. Our room was well insulated, quiet, newly decorated, lovely bathroom...small granite counter, large floor space in the bathroom and dressing area, lovely towels. Small mirror, cruise ship motif, over the smallish granite counter and sink. Very nice linens. An added plus was a keyed safe in the room for our valuables. Smallish closet with mirrors. The usual amenities. Of course the value in the Holiday Inn Express is the morning breakfast. It was well stocked with surprisingly varied items...from cereal, fresh fruit and yogurt to hot entrees of french toast, scrambled eggs and sausage with numerous beverage choices...plenty of small tables with comfortable seating, even around the fireplace. Very pleasant. Free and readily available internet in a private alcove off the lobby, for research, web surfing, and airline boarding passes. The hotel is located one block from a Muni Stockton 30 bus stop at Columbus and half a block to Muni 47...the North Point and Van Ness line. A block or two from the cable cars, Fisherman's Wharf, and an easy walk to the Irsh Coffees at the Buena Vista. :) As well, close to Barnes and Noble, Safeway, and car rental agencies... Safe area at night. An altogether very satisfactory stay, even with mild claustrophobia on looking out the window. :)

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Francisco!!”
Reviews.Author: IMelo
Reviews.Content: ** Our house was broken into last week and my camera was stolen with all of my pictures. I am heartbroken! If anyone out there can share there scenery pictures with me and of this hotel, I would truly be grateful. I will pay for them. THANKS! My email is melo.joe@hotmail.com Great hotel for the price. I would certainly recommend it to anyone. The staff were great and very helpful. Very knowledgable. Hotel is very clean (there was someone always cleaning - the reception area, the hallways etc). The location is great - within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. We love to walk so we also walked to Financial District, Golden Gate Park, Pacific Heights, Castro. The free breakfast is awesome and you can a muffin or banana to go for a snack later. The only small complaint was the view from our room, which was a brick wall, but how much time do we spend in our room? Otherwise, no complaints. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl2
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf is ideally located near Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and a hop-on/hop-off tour bus stop, but beware the valet parking costs $41/night and there is no guarantee they will have space in the garage for your car. We arrived on July 4th and were told the garage might be full. Luckily though the parking attendant checked and said they had one spot left. Not sure what we would have done if they didn't have space as the whole wharf area was jam packed with 4th of July fireworks traffic and we had tons of bags. The hotel features an art deco style and had a nice sized room with sofa bed and min refrig. Breakfast was typical fare but very crowded and they definitely stop serving promptly at the time listed, so don't be late coming down for breakfast. For dinner we ate across the street at Knucles and were very impressed with the excellent service at the restaurant and the Hyatt when we wandered into their lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/standard of room.”
Reviews.Author: Albymorkel
Reviews.Content: Have previously stayed at holiday inn and have usually experienced a similar level of cleanliness etc. This hotel was no exception. The one drawback was that we were given a room on the wharf side of the main building that proved to be very noisy at night. Other than that it is very convenient for tourists in terms of it's proximity to tourist sites. You pay for parking however that can be said of most hotels in San Francisco. Would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LTS1Bournemouth
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and very near everything. The room was OK and relatively spacious. Make sure your room is not in the Beach Street block, which is where ours was, as it is noisy from the trams going past, and you keep have to walking to the main hotel to use the pool, or collect your car, as there is very little parking at this block.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sunshine618
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights (6/29-7/3). Cab to hotel was $42 w/o tip. Airport shuttle from hotel to airport was $15 a person w/o tip. Drivers prefer cash (paying w/ a credit card holds up everyone else needing to be dropped off at their airlines.) Location near Fisherman's Wharf was excellent. Walkable to everywhere!! 3 car rental places a 5-10 minute walk away. Rented a car for a day trip to Muir Woods and Napa/Sonoma. $71 for the day from Enterprise (they provided exact directions to both and maps) - could drop off car after hours. Great upscale sports bar across the street for dinner - Knuckles. Good food & happy hour. Very small room - seemed smaller than a room on a cruise ship. The bathroom was big though w/ bathtub/shower combo. Had a queen size bed and the view was of other rooms and the roof. The air conditioning never really worked. We put it all the way down the first day and it never cooled. Wasn't too bad though since it's cold out. TV only has about 7 or 8 channels. I know you aren't in the room a lot, but still. 2 were ESPN and on the last 2 days, one of the other channels froze up. Good breakfast. Lots of choices, lots of tables to eat at. HOT coffee, juices, delicious (!) cinnamon rolls, omelettes, scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, toast, bagels, english muffins, cereals, bananas. Front desk staff were very helpful and pleasant. Public transportation in San Francisco is great. Tips: If riding the cable cars, the line at the turn-arounds is long and cold. Buy your tickets ($5 for a ride or $11 for the day unlimited rides) and jump on at an intersection. Or just pay the $5 when you jump on. We rode it from Fisherman's Wharf to Union Square and then walked back. Wear layers. You can buy a $10 San Francisco fleece on the streets. I always had it with me - very windy, nights are cold. Wear sneakers. The hills are tough to walk wearing anything else. Alcatraz is a must-see! Bay Quackers was fun. If you can do a day-trip out of the city, it's worth it. Napa/Sonoma is beautiful and warm. Sausalito is also a nice trip across the Golden Gate. I would stay here again if I was trying to save $. Pros: Very clean, convenient to everything, friendly service, good breakfast. Cons: Small room, poor tv selection, air didn't work, horrible view.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: metrochica
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at this hotel and I must say it was wonderful. Its in a great location. Its a few blocks away from the chaotic touristy section of Fisherman's warf so its not noisy at all. Its clean, the staff are super friendly, and its right across the street from the SF cable cars and around the block from the trolleys that head down the warf straight into downtown. Its also near two starbucks, a Barnes and Noble, and a Rite Aid. Its also a really short walk into the Italian section of town up Columbus. I really have nothing bad to say about the hotel except for their wacky chandelier in the lobby. The decor is really nice and I liked the big vintage posters and photos they had in the hallways. Its not a place to stay if you'd like a view though. Most of the rooms faced inner courtyards. I didn't have a problem with this since I spend most of my vacation outside of the hotel room. I'd defiintely recommend this hotel to people traveling with friends, families with children, seniors on holiday and those with disabilities. The hotel has extensive ramps and very large elevators. The hotel can also book you a $15 shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JohnMQuincy_MA
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week's stay here. It was just what we wanted, an inexpensive, clean, comfortable room in a good area. Close enough (2 blocks) to Fisherman's Wharf to be convenient to everything in the city, but far enough to not be noisy. Friendly, helpful staff. The included hot breakfast every morning was a real plus.I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers98
Reviews.Content: The rooms for this hotel were in very good condition and well maintained and appointed. Although busy, the complimentary breakfast was a great way to start the day that contained something for everyone. The reception staff were very helpful and were able to organise a half day stay below the advertised rate. This was extremely convenient given that our family had a 10pm flight out of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: flojorn
Reviews.Content: We booked a mini-suite overlooking the wharf. The room was large and clean. In the distance, I could see Alcaltraz. One of the windows opened and allowed the sounds of the area to enter the room. I loved that feature. I heard the street cars, sea gulls, and traffic to enter the room. At night, it was very quiet. The location for the street cars and buses could not be beat! Near the hotel was Denny's, Walgreens, Barnes and Noble, Safeway and all kinds of tourist shops. I stopped in a 711 store to buy a lottery ticket and won a $100! The hotel staff was very knowledgeable about what bus to take and/or how to best get to an area. The free breakfast consisted of eggs (scrambled or omelet style), sausage (links or patties), bread (bagels, english muffins, white, wheat), cereal, bananas, milk, yogurt, juices, coffee, and sweet rolls. The breakfast area does get crowded especially around the four toasters. Hey, it is a free breakfast! I didn't mind the wait. The only downside is the tv has a few channels. When we settled in for the evening, it was difficult to find anything to watch. That maybe a personal taste and may not be helpful to you. The Demand movies were $13.99 each. Bring a pen, I guess hotels have recently stopped putting pens in the rooms. Free internet access in our room. That is a definite plus! It was really free! In the lobby, near the business area, there is a way to get your boarding pass. I didn't use it because I am not sure how to. Definite would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: patty46
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights last Dec...concierge couldn't be more helpful or nice. Convenient to everything, walk to Ghiaradelli Square, Fisherman's wharf, took cable cars,did the boat trour around alcatraz, Room was very, very clean, nice, plenty of towels, breakfast is included and was exceptional, better than Hampton Inns...Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone and looking forward to coming back......

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Dabbo56
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out couldn't find anything to excite me here. Have stayed in San Francisco many times, first and last time here. We got stuck in the Beach Street section, second class at best. Our room looked out onto people's feet walking past, very noisy and quite gloomy. Completely lost power for about 3 hours on the Saturday night, no explanation, no apology, just suck it up. Would recommend staying anywhere else but here. The only bright side - the concierge was extremely helpful, the front desk staff and on-call Manager could do with some lessons in how to treat guests.

Reviews.Title: “A great time at Fisherman's Wharf!”
Reviews.Author: buffbc99
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed overnight at the Holiday Inn Express and absolutely loved it. The hotel is clean, looks new and has everything you might need. It is also a GREAT deal for the area. It is 2 blocks from Pier 45 and just down the street from all the area attractions like Pier 39, Ghiradelli square and so on...it is very quiet at night, we had no problems getting a good rest. The breakfast in the morning was a nice surprise - eggs, sausage, bagels, cinnamon buns, coffee, etc..all re-stocked regularly throughout the morning. Only until 9:30am though and they close the doors to the second. :) The room was a bit small but had a great bed, nice TV and a decent sized bathroom. We even got the room at 10:30am instead of the usual 3pm check-in - I thought that was a nice touch. Parking is expensive ($41+tax), but is typical for SF, what many people don't realize is that it is from the time you check the car in until 5pm the next day. We were able to park the car at 10:30am and keep it there until 5pm the next day...with in/out privileges as well. The noon check-out time is a plus too, we could sleep in as late as we wanted and still get ready in a leisurely fashion. The one downer for us was no pool - but the Holiday Inn right next door has one that Express guests can use. We will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value , clean and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kaff55
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a elderly relative for 4 nights. Breakfast inclusive very good. Room and bathroom very clean . Late checkout no problem. Conceirge services excellent. Hotel within 3 minutes walk to Wharf area and plenty local eateries close by.

Reviews.Title: “great place for a visit”
Reviews.Author: polygill
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from san francisco to spain,we stayed in the holiday inn express, excellent hotel with a great breakfast and very helpfull people in charge. san francisco is a great place,and not been very fond of americans in the past found it was a very friendly city,all nationalities were helpfull especially the locals.we ate, drank, and visited all the places recommended by the lads and lassies on the forum and had a great time meeting and chatting with all in sundry, including the buskers and the cable car workers.we can recommend buena vista,for the coffees,i can still taste them now. the sea food at fishermans wharf is second to none, and wipeout bar with its clam chowder! is again worth a try, it is filling for a quick luch break.all the bars were good including the fiddlers green (a spot of irish)in colombus street.the only rip off came at "jacks bar" on the front near the shopping centre. it was charging double the price of any other bar.to be advoided.we certainly would return for a second go at the chowder and the sea food and of course the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSW084
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel is very clean and looks new. I requested a quiet room and got a large room overlooking the internal courtyard which was very quiet and very clean. Housekeeping did a good job every day. There was a good choice of food available for breakfast every day and it wasn't too busy. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to most tourist attractions. I really liked this hotel and would recommend it to anyone, and if I visit San Francisco again this is the hotel I would choose.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special, but no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: laurelleaf
Reviews.Content: it's always hard finding a good value hotel in a big city, so i wasn't expecting to be wowed by this hotel, and upon staying there for 3 nights, i can safely say that there was nothing to wow us. however, it was clean, service was plesant and helpful (except for the horribly rude old man on the night shift in housekeeping), and location was pretty good. rooms are small and not an excellent value, but new-looking and basically comfortable. the free hot breakfast is nice in theory (and, to be honest, was one of the reasons we went with this hotel) but in execution is something of a madhouse, and the "hot" food is really not worth all of the chaos surrounding it. all of the jostling and waiting on line to use the toaster leaves you a bit tired before you've even started your day of sightseeing! however, to be fair, we stayed at this hotel over memorial day weekend, so i imagine we saw it at its busiest. if the room rates were a bit lower, i would more enthusiastically recommend the place. but no major strikes against it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ponyman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Arrived at 11am. They had rooms ready and let us check in early. This was great, gave us time to relax a little after the flight and then hit the streets. The location is perfect. 2 blocks from the wharf. less than two blocks to the trolley and dable cars. Walgreens within a block, and Safeway and Trader Joe's within two to three blocks. The hotel was incredibly clean. There was always someone cleaning on the lobby and public areas, and our room was clean when we checked in and always perfect in the evenings when we returned. While not the largest rooms I have stayedin they were more than adequate, and the bathroom always had plenty of hot water. I have read other reviews that the beds were hard, but we thought they were very comfortable. We didn't have a view from our room, but that was alright because it was very, very, quiet. No trouble sleeping at all. The continental breakfas twas good, although by the time we left it bagan to get a little repetive. They did a wonderful job of keeping food out at all times. I don't know how they did it because the hotel was full almost our entire stay. The staff was very good. Anything we asked for or about they went out of their way to help us. One night our air conditioner wasn't working very well. I reported it to the front desk the next morning. When we returned that evening it was cold enough to hang meat in the room and was as cold as we wanted it for the rest of the trip. Our traveling companions had been to Frisco before and stayed at the nearby Hilton. They said the Holiday Inn Express was as nice or probably even nicer than the Hilton. If you want a nice clean place to stay near Fisherman's Wharf, I don't think you can beat the Holiday Inn Express. Convenient location, clean hotel and rooms, and friendlystaff is a winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Lesmira1960
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (with boys aged 11 & 7) and arrived at 11.30am after a 15 hour flight from Australia. The staff were only too happy to store all of our bags until our room was ready. This gave us time to have a look around the Fisherman's Wharf area and get some lunch. When we arrived back at the hotel, check-in was quick and pleasant. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was good and plentiful. Having the business centre with internet access was an added bonus. The staff were always helpful and gave good directions and good advice about the local public transport. The Holiday Inn Express is in a very good location, just a few minutes walk to the Wharf, the F train, cable cars, several supermarkets and food places. It was a really good place to start our holiday and I would recommend it to anyone going to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “great location, decent breakfast, helpful staff, good size room, modern theme”
Reviews.Author: hppygrl
Reviews.Content: Were in SF for 2 nights and a lot of what we wanted to do & see was in this area. Althought we debated staying in other areas too... glad we stayed here... close to everything, yes very toursity, but we were tourist. I had delayed luggage at airport, hotel staff were always very nice and tried to be helpful. Free internet in lobby was very helpful. We purchased Alcatraz tickets in advance, a must! As well as a touristy bus tour and saved a nominal $5pp but it was easy. The Knuckle's restuarant across the street is nice for a quick meal or afternoon drink. Tolley close too, as well as other public transportation. Pleanty of car rentals in the area to walk to, as well as 2 grocery stores as we purchased crackers, bottle water etc for our drive North into Sonoma/Napa area. We asked for a quiet room, it could have been quieter but was not bad at all, did not face any major roads. **There are other Holiday Inn's in that area, very close... our driver from the airport took us to one of the other 2 and we had a short walk to the Inn & Suites, HI. Again, would stay again! Was def chilly, especially at night...

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of an Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ladydaphne
Reviews.Content: This is the best value hotel I have ever stayed at its an absolute corker! The rooms have a King size bed which is heaven after a long trip, the decor, the lobby are excellent, the breakfast area and food are fabulous myself and my wife filled our boots! There is free internet and free printer which is a first for me anywhere in the world, excellent coffee, peace and quiet, and the cable car is just around the corner and the piers are around the other corner. If you are going to San Francisco stay here accept no other.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Free Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LovesDogs5
Reviews.Content: Although there are many hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we chose this hotel because we really like the Holiday Inn Express chain and have stayed in many throughout the US. Besides the great location, I guess the biggest draw would be their incredible free breakfast - not just the standard cereals, but scrambed eggs, bacon, etc. Considering we found the restaurants in the area to be fairly expensive, this was definitely a money saver and a nice way to start the day. As to be expected, though, the eating area was always very crowded. Our mini-suite was somewhat disappointing, rather small, compared to others in the Express chain we've stayed at. At night the room was quiet even though the daytime traffic was noisy. Service was friendly. All in all, a very nice hotel. A tip for riding the cable car at the turnaround near the hotel - we went later on in the day and there was hardly a wait. Also, we'd recommend the Night Tour at Alcatraz. Booking online well in advance is a real convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: This is an above average hotel near Fisherman's Wharf. This hotel (Holiday Inn Express, opposite the Hyatt and Marriott) should not be confused with the Holiday Inn. The Holiday Inn Express is a modern, clean hotel that has a quick check-in service. I nearly stayed downtown but I'm glad I didn't - Fisherman's Wharf is the area to stay in if visiting San Francisco as a tourist. The room was very quiet even though the room faced North Point Road. If I went back to San Francisco I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Decent Service”
Reviews.Author: DebinthePeg
Reviews.Content: Visited the Holiday Inn Express 4/24 - 4/28. Overall, we were happy with the hotel. The location was perfect for us - close to the wharf and local transit. The hotel itself is very nice looking with a modern decor. Our room, single king bed, was more than adequate. Maid service was good. The breakfast was decent for a hotel complimentery breakfast. There was a good selection to get your day started - juice, coffee, tea, milk, cereals, toast, bagels, yogurt, bananas, eggs (either scrambled or omlette which seemed to be prepacked and microwaved), bacon and/or sausage. The hotel was full on the weekend and the breakfast bar was quite busy at times. I felt the hotel did a great job of refilling things and we never had to wait long for anything. We always also managed to find a table for our group of 4. There were a couple of minor things we noted. While the hotel looked great, it is very basic and didn't have any nice little "extras". I thought it would have been nice to have coffee/tea service in the lobby area throughout the day, not just until 9:30 am - we've had this at other Holiday Inn Express hotels and basic type hotels such as Quality Inns, etc. Some aspects of service could have been a little better as well. I wanted to have a tea in my room early one evening. I had forgot to take a milk back up to the room in the morning - tea with powdered whitener just isn't that great. I had hoped that the front desk could get me a milk - the breakfast room was just a few steps away - but they were unable to help as their "house man" was not on duty. While I was waiting at the front desk an older man approached and indicated that they had just returned from their day out and their room hadn't been cleaned. The gentleman at the front desk indicated that he "couldn't understand how that could happen, it had never happened before". He asked the guest if he was sure he didn't leave his Do Not Disturb sign on the door. The guest replied he was sure he hadn't. The front desk clerk then proceeded to tell the gentlemant there was nothing he could for him as the cleaning staff were gone for the day and again, the house man was not in. The front desk clerk didn't offer anything to the guest for the inconvenience - he just restated he couldn't understand how that could happen. To me, surely someone could have gone up and emptied the garbages and at least gave them clean towels? Also, don't forget that parking is very expensive, as is pretty standard with wharf area hotels. We didn't have a vechicle but noticed that the valet parking was over $40 per night. If we returned to SF, we wouldn't have any hesitation staying at this hotel again as any issues we had were really quite minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sharkterritory
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and they serve a sumptuous breakfast! Well connected to tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Martin_B___9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my wife, and I really liked it. Location is great, on Fisherman's Wharf. The room was pretty big, with free Internet access, and a regular TV. There was no refrigator, but there were ice vending machines in the halls. Service was ok, but they didn't offer to help us with our bags (we had a lot of luggage) when we arrived. They did have the room available a couple of hours before check in time, which was great for us. I really recommend this hotel. I really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular, but would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: poppinfresh0
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly and gave good directions. Breakfast was complimentary and there were many choices. Our view was a cement wall, but out the side, we could see Coit Tower. The room was clean and neat. We were out and about all day and night, so we got everything we needed out of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice but woulnot stay here again”
Reviews.Author: cmassi
Reviews.Content: upon arrival we had a queen mini suite.very diappointing with had a view of the concrete courtyard.They could at least add potted plants or flowers. A dirty toothbrush lyng on floor. That night my husband got into bed and it smelled like urine. The next day we asked for a room change. since we were staying for 4 nights. they had no suites available so we got a double room. it was much nicer with a view of acatraz. All amentities were located down the street at the holiday inn on columbus Blvd.. We had to walk there to do laundry and for the pool. Breakfast ends at 9:30 AM. So we never made it. It was a good location walking distance to most attractions. Parking 42.00 a day. Internet via phoneline so you have to sit at desk.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view of Alcatraz”
Reviews.Author: sunnysal
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price and location. I was surprized by the view of Alcatraz from my window. The parking is outrageous but there is no alternative. At least the valet was always quick. Quick walk to the wharf and shops.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE of $45+ PER DAY Parking fees!!! There is no alternative!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Czarmax18
Reviews.Content: I was out in California for a 2 week business trip. I wanted to fill the weekend with fun things to do since I have not been to California before. This stay started off by waiting to check in for 15 minutes while the person working the check in desk went through every possible thing to do in San Francisco with a couple. By the time she was done with them, the check in line was 4 people deep. I stay at numerous Holiday Inn's and I am a Priority Club Platinum member so I asked if they had any Platinum upgrades. The person behind the desk stated that they did have something available and that she would upgrade me. After we got that taken care of I asked her about the parking situation. They are extremely close to the Fisherman's Wharf I was figuring that they would have free parking for guests or at maximum $10-$20 charge. I find out that the only parking that they have available is valet parking that costs $41 plus applicable taxes that brings the total over $45!!! I asked the person behind the counter if there are any other options, and she stated that she used to tell people to go down the block because they were only $20. She continued to say that now the prices have gone up, and that they are no longer that cheap. No other follow up was done with me. She stated that they do not own the parking area, so that there were no breaks for Platinum members or anyone else for that matter. I over heard the poor lady next to me telling the other family that she was traveling with that the charge is $50 a day per car. They had 2 cars staying for 2 days. That is an extra $200!!! Afterward I did see that there is a $41 Valet Parking charge on their website after I dug around a little bit, and I would have figured that they would have other options than valet parking. I never do valet parking, so I figured that I would just park in the local ramp. Like I have stated I travel a lot for business, and nothing has caught me so off guard as paying 1/3 of the amount that I paid for a room in parking. I was unfamiliar with the area, and I did not feel comfortable driving around trying to find another place to park. To be fair there are numerous hotels around along with this one in this area, and I believe that they all charge close to this much for parking. After the whole parking shocker, I went up to the "upgraded" room. I had originally booked a normal room with a king bed. The "upgraded" room had 2 queen beds. Apparently the "upgrade" means that you get a microwave and an extra small sink. No refrigerator or anything else that would constitute "upgrade" in my book. I went back down to the desk and got my room back with the king bed. I figure that is pretty bad that after an upgrade you go back to the original room that you originally had. The room I had was extremely tiny, and the view out of the window was another room in the hotel. Overall decor in the hallways in the rooms was nice, but absolutely nothing over the top or even special for that matter. If you are thirsty go to the Walgreens up the road since bottled water and other beverages in the vending machine start at $3.00. I had to go down and exchange a towel since it was dirty. Only 2 bath towels were given in the room, so if there is more than one person that wants to take more than one shower you need to use wet towels. The bed makes a funny noise when I sit on it. I do not know what else to say about this, but I wanted to note it. They had wired internet in the room that I was in. I was able to find a wireless signal from this hotel and I called down to the desk to get the access code, and the person that answered stated wireless internet is not available in the rooms. I continued to tell her that it is asking for my Holiday Inn Express access code and she then proceeded to tell me what the pass code is. This just added to the frustration. Overall it really started off on the wrong foot realizing that I had to pay almost $50 just to park, and it really did not get any better. Due to the times I really wanted to stay fiscally responsible for my business trip, and this extra charge took me way over the acceptable costs for a hotel room. Now I am going to have to explain this situation to my supervisors and try and justify the extra charges. I am currently writing this review the night that I am staying at this hotel. I am taking time out of my trip on Friday night to warn people of what they may walk into with this hotel. There is no pool, but they allow you to use the pool from the adjacent Holiday Inn hotel. Like I have stated I travel a lot for business and I stay at Holiday Inn brand hotels 50+ times throughout the year. This one is absolutely the lowest value for the dollar that I have stayed in. The location is nice, but if you are planning on staying more than one night be aware you may be dishing out close to $100 for parking. BUYER BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for family group on holiday in SF”
Reviews.Author: salisburyjane
Reviews.Content: Location - great - convenient for restaurants, Fishermans Wharf attractions, and (although we discovered on our last night) 3 minute walk to large supermarket. Complimentary breakfast - good choice, although very busy. Delicious healthy bran & raisin muffins. Good coffee. Rooms - comfortable, well equipped (table & chairs, large t.v., iron & board, hairdrier, coffee machine). Could have used more drawer space for family of 4. Also, proper cups would have made a big difference to enjoyment of coffee! Free wireless available in bedrooms (am using it now!) - easy to use, and made our stay a lot easier. General - if we come back to SF we will stay here again. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Thin veneer of quality”
Reviews.Author: tonyofutah
Reviews.Content: At check in waited 10 minutes at the unattended reception. The free breakfast is like feeding time at the zoo with dozens of people milling around trying to get at some of the hopelessly under-resourced food bars. was given room 320 right next to the stairwell. Really great to hear the stairwell door slam shut about 9,000 times in the night. From the outside this hotel looks very up market, but is in fact drag and worn out. I can live without a minibar, but there wasn't even a bar fridge in the room. Stay at the Hyatt just over the road.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PJHIOM
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th year we have stayed at this hotel. The hotel is excellent and good value for money with good sized rooms and breakfast included, only a short walk to Fisherman`s Wharf and Pier 39, Regular bus services running past the hotel, and close to the Street and Cable cars. We would like to pass on our thanks to Joseph and all the Staff who do a great job in making you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sue21348
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely one of the best hotels we have stayed in. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a smile and extremely friendly reception stay. Throughout our stay all the reception staff we met were wonderful, nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room was cleaned daily to a very high standard, it was extremely clean and the bathroom was probably one off the best I have experienced in a hotel. The towels were changed when ever you needed them. The bed linen was changed regularly and the bed must have been at least seven foot wide. For the first three days we didnt eat breakfast in the hotel allthough it was supplied free with our room.. But after spending over 30dollars for two outside the hotel, we decided to try the hotel breakfast. It was fine. It wasnt as overcrowded as I had previously read about on this forum. We always found a table, and the food was certainly good. My husband managed to get bacon or sausage with scrambled eggs or ommeletes every morning. The hotel is perfectly situated for fishermans wharf, to my mind one of the nicest areas of S.F. It is so close to the cable car turn-around. I would so recommend this hotel to anyone. We travelled on a package with Virgin, but I'm sure we could have got it cheaper if we had booked the flight and hotel indepenty. One place the Virgin reps really try to push is a diner called Denny's, I must say we tried it a couple off times, but would not recommend it, it seems to serve mainly junk food. I once asked for fresh fruit and because they didnt have any they bought me a bowl of apple sauce, before even bothering to check with me first.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expections”
Reviews.Author: MrsKanga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 3 nights and it was far more than what I expected from a 3 star hotel. First thing I liked about the Holiday Inn Express is its location which is a short walk to Fisherman's whaft. There are cozy delis and a Japanese restaurant next to the hotel, and a Dennys right around the corner. This is perfect for those who have children who are picky eaters. Inside, the check in staff are very accommodating and nice. Rooms are big, clean and roomy. Except for the banging doors, of rooms next door, you can't hear the street noise. They have wifi, and 2 internet stations at the lobby. Breakfast items are very limited which is not a surprise for a small hotel. There are 3 Holiday Inns around the fisherman's wharf but Holiday Inn Express along North Point Street is better located and more accessible. For families on a budget looking for clean accommodations with fantastic location, I would recommend the Holiday Inn Express

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Situated!”
Reviews.Author: cariad6
Reviews.Content: Searched for a hotel on Fisherman's Wharf and came up with this gem which was perfect for our needs and great value for money. In the heart of the tourist district among the other major hotels - Hilton, Radisson etc, but cheaper! Also had a surprise by the quality and amount of breakfast available, albeit a little haphazard! Free internet service. Gym on site, although no restaurant, no need to worry as there are plenty within the area. Literally 5 minutes walk from Wharf and tram stops. Walgreens around the corner, also a great supermarket for other needs.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: mjw11488
Reviews.Content: This place meet all of our needs which were a cheap and clean place. We intended on staying 1 night, but ended up staying 1 extra night, because of weather back home. This place was modern and the rooms were the same as any hotels that I have stayed at for much more in different cities. One bad thing was there was no view from the room or restaurant/bar, but for the price, it seemed worth it. Plus there was free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the staff is so nice!”
Reviews.Author: kellyanndc
Reviews.Content: I live in Oakland and I had a large group of family visit San Francisco this past weekend. I suggested they stay in Fisherman's Wharf because it seemed like that was a better family locale than other parts of the city. Living in the Bay Area, I am usually pretty anti-tourist locations like Fisherman's Wharf. But I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised at how different the whole area was...and how easy it was to get to everything we wanted to do from there. While there was some confusion between the Holiday Inn Express and the Holiday Inn (down one block) and my family was split between the 2 hotels...it ended up being no big deal and they were both really nice. The staff was amazing and extremely helpful at both.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: kat721
Reviews.Content: Went back home with my 13 year old. His first time in the city. Our room was not ready, early check in, so they upgraded us! No extra charge. Room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was the best I have ever encountered in this city. Decent breakfast every morning. Can not say enough about this hotel or the staff! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Raj5000
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 2 nights of our honeymoon here, after being in Hawaii, and it was great. The location was very central to checking out the city, the staff were really helpful and friendly, and the rate we paid was much less than other hotels of the same level were charging. Free breakfast was a nice plus, though it was tricky to wake up by 9am due to jet lag. No complaints, and I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Anything but an”
Reviews.Author: ensign9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of nights while in town and loved the place. Views of Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge right from my window, and it's right on top of Fisherman's Wharf. My preconceptions about what constitutes a Holiday Inn "Express" must be flawed, because this was anything but an economy-class motel for overnight business travelers. It's a classy joint; to the point I was a little stunned when I walked into my room. I'm no world traveler/hotelier, but this was one of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in while on vacation. Anyway, needless to say, I'd highly recommend it to anyone heading into San Fran for any length of time. You're close to everything, the staff is incredibly friendly, and my room was top-notch. Forget Zagat's; you've got me to rely on for your hotel reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonstevo
Reviews.Content: Just what you would expect from Holiday Inn, good value great staff and great location. My partner left his wallet in the bathroom the day we were flying back to the UK, the reception team arranged a limo to drive it to the airport prior to us flying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Lea016
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 29 & 30 Dec. 2008. We are a family of 5. I rang the hotel to find out if there were any rooms that could take all of us in one room, but was told that these were all sold out and they did not put roll aways in the rooms. Had to book 2 rooms with a request for inter-connecting rooms. The guy I was talking to said he would put that request in but could not guarantee anything until we arrived, to see what was available on the day. Our flight from Australia arrived early in the morning and we arrived at the hotel about 9.45am. We couldn't book in straight away as the rooms were not ready, this was not a problem as they could store the luggage for us and we could go sightseeing. However , we were told that the hotel does not have any inter-connecting rooms and that the best they could do was give us 2 rooms side by side. That was the only down side. (Do not know why the guy on the phone couldn't tell me this.) The staff were very helpful. The breakfast was reasonable. - only fruit choice was bananas. The location was fantastic - walking distance to most things. Great restaurants near by. The kids enjoyed the Rainforest cafe. The Christmas decorations throughout San Francisco were beautiful. Even the historic cable cars get decorated for the occassion. Fisherman's wharf was extremely crowded at this time of year - was a bit unprepared for that. Decided to stay here for the location, a sister-in-law recommended it and thought we could all stay in one room. Loved San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: TerriAnn3
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for a few days during Spring Break vacation. The hotel was everything we were looking for. It was within walking distance to Pier 39, public transportation, fantastic restaurants and some of the local attractions. Our room was a mini suite with 2 comfortable double beds. The room was clean, had a small fridge and microwave, and was cheery. The maid did an exceptional job of cleaning everyday. The continental breakfast offered a great variety of items and was plentiful. Some of the foods offered included scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, toast, bagels, english muffins, cereals, cinnamon rolls, bananas, yogart, milk, juices, and coffee. The staff we dealt with was always pleasant, helpful and greeted us with a smile and hello. We had no complaints about anything during our stay. It was truly exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “A true gem”
Reviews.Author: travelgenie21
Reviews.Content: One of the few places that offers you more comforts than you expect from is rating. Great location with easy access to the wharf, friendly staff, average sized but comfortable rooms with clean and fresh linen. Free basic breakfast(eggs,sausage, toast, cinnabuns etc), free hi speed internet. Nice bed, good shower, surprise Biore facial scrub and serum along with shower essentials. Parking is expensive in any of the wharf hotels. We opted not to rent a car coz everything was within walking distance. Overall we had a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_Kate
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The hotel is clean and modern with many facilities. The rooms are great. They have free internet, a small gym, and breakfast is included in your rate. The location is wonderful. You can eat at restaurants nearby on Fisherman's Wharf or catch a cable car (two block walk) and go up to China Town. I cannot fault this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Fooled by the Low Rates”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler15
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Francisco quite often for weekend vacations. I usually stay close to San Francisco International Airport due to the fact that the hotels close to the airport offer better rates and are within a short drive to Downtown. However, during my last visit, I booked this property due to the low rate that the hotel offerred. However, the room became very expensive due to the fact that the hotel charged me forty-one dollars a day to park my car. Further, the rooms were small and the breakfast bar was poorly stocked. Next time, I will probably choose to stay at one of the airport hotels again since the rates and rooms are better and since those hotels do not charge for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location, plenty to see and do in SF!”
Reviews.Author: F1FanMississauga
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in SF. Definitely recommend this hotel. Great location. 5 mins walk to tourist area of Fisherman's Wharf. FW itself is somewhat "tacky" and 100% focused on tourism, but the hotel is far enough to be away from that, yet close enough to walk there! - Buffet breakfast was very nice - 6.30am to 9.30am. Standard cereal, toast, pasteries etc. tea/coffee/juice. Can take back to room too. - Nice room, no problems with maid service/cleaniness etc. - all excellent. - Plenty of shuttle bus companies from SF airport to FW area - anywhere from $11 - $17 each way. Look for coupons on the hotel map flyers to book your return shuttle. - For souvenier shopping, I would suggest check out Chinatown FIRST, then stroll to Fisherman's Wharf. Generally, Chinatown is cheaper and has the same range. - For tours, I went with Gray Line through San Francisco Sightseeing Tours. I took the Muir Woods tour (with ferry back from Salsolito) and the Yosemite tour. Both very good. If I could only pick one, it would be Yosemite. - Book your Alcatraz tour through the offifical website - about $26 US. Really worth seeing and the audio tour is great. On the audio tour, skip following the official route and work your own way around - you can still listen and get the general idea and miss the crowds. - Take the walk from the hotel to the GG Bridge. Allow about an hour there and an hour back. Completely flat trail along the bay and then a stepped climb for the last part next to the bridge. You'll know it was worth it! - If you're vegetarian/vegan there are plenty of places to eat in SF - way more than other cities I've visited. - Cable car ride (must do!) is $5 regardless of trip length. Do as the tour books suggest and catch the cable car one or two stops up from the turnaround points to skip the tourist line-ups. If you want more info on anything, feel free to e-mail me :-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but beware parking costs”
Reviews.Author: ticboom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Feb and found it to be a lovely hotel. Our room was really spacious and very clean. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel is in an excellent location, a 5 min walk from pier39. The only downside is that valet parking is $46 a day, which we were not aware of until we arrived. That might be our fault but it was a bit of a shock! Overall though, this hotel is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Superchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right by Fisherman's Wharf and only a 30 minute walk to Chinatown. It is a short walk to the Muni bus stop where you can catch the 30 Stockton bus to go south to Chinatown or go west to the Golden Gate Bridge. The hotel is only a 10 minute taxi ride from the Embarcadero BART station. It should cost you $8-$9 US Free buffet breakfast was a bonus. It got us out faster in the morning to go see the sights. The breakfast was nothing elaborate but it was fast and there was lots of variety. The front desk staff were very helpful and patient about sightseeing questions and let me extend my check-out time by 1.5 hours. The room was very clean and quite nice. The coffee maker in the room was great for making tea in the evening. The hotel was very quiet and we slept soundly as the beds were very comfy. There are 2 laptops for guests to use to access the internet which was great. We were able to e-mail messages home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysmom49
Reviews.Content: Since I arrived late at night on a Wednesday checking in was no problem. I didn't notice any bell person but no problem I had my daughter helping me with my luggage. The mini suite was nice, bed comfortable and having a refrigerator and microwave was good to have. Other reviews listed noise as a problem, I didn't notice any. The continental breakfast was okay. I have also noticed others complaining about the plastic utensils and plates --- to me, that is convenient especially when you want to take food to your room. What did people expect, real plates? It is a great hotel and in a nice location. Will be back in March.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Peech
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for tourists. It's just around Fisherman's Wharf and close to a lot of food outlets, both cheap/fast food (IHOP, In/Out Burger, Denny's) as well as fine dining (Gary Danko...). Walgreens, Barnes & Noble, Trader Joe's...etc are all nearby. It's also close to the tram depot so it's convenient for transport. Room is clean and spacious, with a great bathroom. I had a little kitchenette in my mini-suite. Internet was free so this was great. Breakfast was OK. Staff at the front were very helpful. No in-house laundromat but it's available at the Holiday Inn next door. Would defintely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay SF Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: TheGlobeTrotter2008
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet room and within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf without paying you know those other prices then go no further. I know it was off season, but that was part of the reason for visiting San Francisco. The trip was more about being a tourist and we figured why not stay in the main tourist spot. As other reviews mention and I agree, there is no reason for renting a car to see the tourist spots unless you are planning on doing it in a day on your own pace. Keep in mind the many tour options. Everything was in walking distance and what wasn't was easily accessible by using some type of day pass. We went ahead and bought a City Pass which was very useful. We did all the tours/museums that came with the pass and benefitted it also by using for all the local public transportaion. Anyway, the hotel is right across or next to the other main hotels, but nearly half the price. The bed was very comfortable and as I mentioned very quiet when we were not out being tourists. Plus you can't beat the free breakfast and free internet (computer on site as well).

Reviews.Title: “Loving It”
Reviews.Author: annabanannaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Paid around $50 USD/night for this hotel on Hotwire, which is a real bargain in San Francisco! Room is lovely, large and very clean. Nice and quiet.
