Room has safe, coffee maker and plenty of space for storage. Free wi-fi with good signal. No problem with staff at reception. Valet parking is expensive- $41 for 24 hours. Cable car is a 5 minute walk away. Great location for tourists. Breakfast provided is ok- bagels, english muffins, eggs, sausages, etc.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chonga65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as our first stop from Australia on American holiday. I was not sure what to expect and was pleasantly surprised. Location is excellent less than 2 blocks from fishermans Wharf & easy walking distance to cable tram and other attractions. We have 2 children 11 & 14 and it was a great location with low noise and comfortable facilities. The free breakfast was simple but nice & fantastic cost saver to start our holiday.There is a great bar acrooss the road called Knuckles and if you like beer you must go to Jac's bar which is easy walking distance. San Francisco was great and this hotel excellent way to see it all from...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ImOnHoliday28
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. We stayed here for 6 nights in August 2008 and we were completely blown away. The hotel is in a incredible location on Fisherman's Wharf with an approximate walk of ten minutes to Pier 39. There is so much to do here and everything is easily accessible as the trolley leaves just around the corner from the hotel. The room's were modern and very clean!! Spotless even!! The hotel staff were the best that I have ever encountered, they were so friendly and always willing to help us no matter what! Breakfast was included as part of our package and changed everyone morning but it was so yummy! Internet access was free the hotel even provided 2 computers for their guests to use in the lobby. The only thing that we were upset about was that our room did not have a fridge, we quickly got over that as we hardly spent any time in there. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone that is visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Swimmy128
Reviews.Content: Being only a 2 star hotel I was not sure if it would be nice or not. It turned out to be great. You are within 2 blocks of the Warf, Ghiradeli, Boudin, the f line street car stop and the mason line cable car. The hotel staff was really friendly and the rooms were fine. It is also a nice bonus that you get breakfast. It was the standard holiday inn express spread but it fills you up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KnowingMeKnowingYou
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a really good location, 5 mins walk from Fisherman's Wharf. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was large and clean and the free breakfast was very good. I would definatley recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jessc2078
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to everthing. Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square. Staff was very friendly and rooms were very clean. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Clean”
Reviews.Author: teena99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf Thursday October 2 and Friday October 3 2008. Arrived early and checked in immediately. They had a room ready., I had been told about the possibility of getting a room in the Beach building across the street and down the block. I was a little dissapointed when she told us we were in that building, but we did not ask to change it, as the main building were smoking rooms, Ours were nonsmoking. They offered to take our luggage over, but it was really just a short walk. We went to our room and were very satisfied. We loved the free wireless internet. We were only at this location for 2 nights, and we did get a ground floor room. There was a little street noise, I would recommend asking for a higher room if this would bother you. The desk at our building was open almost all the time and the employees were very helpful. We had to fax some papers for our balloon ride and something was not working. She tried and tried. She would not give up, even called the company and finally got the papers faxed. We did not eat in the restaurant in the hotel, because we have a strict rule for not going to any type of chain restaurant while visiting other cities,. The location was perfect to visit the Fisherman's Wharf area. There is a most wonderful (5 stars out of 5) restaurant just down the block called Beach Street Grill. I highly recommend eating there for breakfast. We both had excellent food, outstanding friendly service and great Momosa's. If I were to stay near Fishermans Wharf again, I would definately look into this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly Average”
Reviews.Author: JCD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and, although most people raved about the hotel, I felt it was just average. The location, however, was perfect, since we were going to Alcatraz and also visited our nephew who lives in the nearby marina district (he wanted us to stay with him, but it's a one bedroom apartment, so I graciously declined). Although we're regular visitors to SF, I felt this room was smaller than the norm, but it was quiet, since it was at the end of the hallway. We didn't need any information from the front desk, so I can't comment on their service. We're Priority Club members, but we didn't receive any upgrades or other perks (our view was another section of the hotel). The free breakfast was a mob scene, so we didn't take full advantage of it, since there was nowhere to sit (I balanced a roll and juice on my lap, while sitting on a couch). The parking fee was also a negative, but I should have asked about it before we made the reservation. It looks like most of the hotel guests booked through Hotwire and I might have felt different if I'd gotten a cheaper rate, since I wouldn't expect as much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. All in all a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RUSTYknoxville
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION for pretty much every site in San Francisco. The shopping district was a short bus route away. Hop on a tour bus and get a good look at the whole city. It's fantastic. The breakfast was standard, it was a nice change to actually see a hotel in America doing complimentary breakfasts. The rooms were standard and comfortable. Clean and staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, expensive parking, crowded breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jfmelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in Fishermans Wharf with my wife for 5 nights in October 2008 as part of our vacations at the West Coast. I got a reasonably good rate considering the location of the hotel and that we had breakfast included. The king room was above average. Clean, comfortable, and with the expected amenities. Everything looked new, and that also gave us a good impression. Free internet (cable, not wireless) worked well. Breakfast was included in rate. Completely over crowded, as the hotel probably has more than 400 rooms, and is located in a highly touristic zone. That said, it had eggs, bagles, cream cheese, etc... But dozens of people at the same time, so don't expect to be in a quiet zone. From time to time you can notice that the staff isn't able to replenish the food, so don't let to have breakfast at the last 30 minutes. Parking is extremely expensive (thirty nine dollars per day). Location is excellent. Walking distance of the cable car, pier 39, Guirardelli square and other attractions. Hotel is near other famous hotels as Hyatt, Hilton, Marriott and even Holiday Inn. As a tip, there's a 24 hours open denny's around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with best location in Fisherman's Warf”
Reviews.Author: HBBear
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful great hotel located one block from the center of Fisherman's Warf in San Francisco. Safe area which allows you to walk to many San Francisco tourist spots. Restaurants everywhere. Trolley line at your doorstep for ease of getting around. We have stayed here before and love this hotel and location. This hotel sits right next to a regular Holiday Inn but this Holiday Inn Express is much newer and looks great from both the inside and out. Here are the only two things to be aware of: First, recheck the hotel website about a week before arrival to see if the rates have been lowered. We saved about $100 per night by doing this. Secondly, the fee for parking your car is $39 per day plus parking tax of $5.46. This is very pricey and is a hidden fee unless you read the fine print. Just be prepared. Overall, a Great experience and would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Fishermans Wharf”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_on_Hols
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located - just around the corner from Fishernans Wharf. The breakfast being included in the price is a bonus - it is a bit of a bun fight but the food was fine and plentiful - cereals, yoghurt, toast, muffins etc, cinnamon buns, bananas as well as some hot options - scrambled eggs, sausages/bacon. Also you get the bonus of being able to use the pool next door at the main Holiday Inn Fishermans Wharf. The laundry also is over there. Our room had no outlook at all - just a window into an internal lightwell, but it was comfortable and quiet. There is a Denny's on site and Internet access terminals in the foyer. Basically everything we needed was there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniortravleer
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the, in my view expensive parking, this is a great hotel, good location, helpful staff, nice rooms, I did not eat thereso cannot comment.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: lamberts52
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and very central for all the main tourist sights. Hotel was clean and breakfast was OK but really the cooked food we avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: heatherdan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in Sept 2008. Location is great, rooms clean, service good, free internet access, valet parking was great service, close to all food and points of interest Down falls, no pool, parking $40 a day (ouch) Great place to stay, would recommend. But if you plan on using a car.....which I advise.....stay further out, parking is cheaper, hotels are cheaper, and you have to pay to park anyways anywhere in the Fishermans Wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: SuzyUK
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I found this hotel comfortable, in a great location and we were pleased with the cleanliness. It was easy to reach Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 and the tram terminus. It didn't take more than 10 mins to walk to Lombard Street though it's uphill all the way. The hotel is only two streets away from the water/Embarcadero & we felt safe in the area. Parking was quite expensive, though in the city it is more expensive than here, however it was valet parking and the guys were very nice. We found the reception staff very helpful on check-in and through our five day stay. Our room was an internal one overlooking an internal atrium so we had no outside noise. The room was clean and there were plenty of towels in the bathroom. Breakfast is included in the price - you help yourself to cereal, Danish, buns, toast, eggs, some odd stuff I didn't recognise (but I'm British so it might have been grits?), sausages, fruit juices and other things. The choice was good however there are crowds of people from around 7am - jetlag worked in our favour in this instance so we were there before the hoards at 8am. There was still plenty later on although some of the guests were acting as though they weren't going to find anywhere to eat for the next year!! I'd have no hesitation in returning there as it was the ideal base for us in San Francisco. We booked through Hotwire and I didn't feel we had a bad deal from the hotel because of this.

Reviews.Title: “It was just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: Portia142
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the start of a 16-day trip (for three nights). We knew we would be late arriving (having missed a connecting flight) and had phoned ahead with our expected arrival time. When we arrived we found that Reception had made of note of this and check-in was smooth. Our room was in the middle of the hotel (very nice and quiet) and it was just what we needed after a long trip from the UK. We were staying here over the Labor Day weekend, so the hotel was busy. We only really noticed this at breakfast, and whilst there was plenty of food for everyone we did notice that at around 8am one morning free tables were scare. A very minor point, and only to be expected, and it didn't cause any problems. The hotel is excellently situated, being between the ends of two cable car lines and one block from the street car (tram). We would definately stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WisteriaWay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in our 60's and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf for four nights in September 2008. Very clean, quiet modern room. Very comfortable beds. Convenient location to the Wharf which was extremely crowded when we were there. Lots of restaurants and touristy stores and stands nearby. Continental breakfast was adequate, but that's OK. Lots of tour buses and some mornings the dining area was crowded, but we always got a seat. Hotel has only valet parking which is a whopping $39.00 per day. Near cable cars and public transportation. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: jcd016
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in the morning intending to store our luggage until later in the day. The woman at the front desk checked, and a room was ready, so we checked in. The room was smaller than at the Hyatt across the street (which we had just checked out of), but pretty much standard for HI Express. It was clean and the bed was comfortable. We had no problems whatsoever during our stay. The free breakfast buffet had some hot items including cinnamon rolls, some pre-made cheese omelets, and bacon one day and sausages the next. We thought it was good enough to eat there again the second morning. The hotel is in a great location close to the wharf, and convenient for catching the streetcar, buses, and cable cars. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: BenandAli
Reviews.Content: Haing stayed in three different hotels in San Francisco, value and quality don't seem to be as good as other American cities. The good thing is that the city itself is so lovely you will forget about this. The service is basic, the room comfortable and clean. This hotel is frequented by tour groups so if faceless chain hotels are not your scene, don't stay here. You can't argue with the location, just a short walk to the Embarcardero and the cable cars to downtown. Breakfast is a chore - poor food and constant bumping into people because the buffet is too small for the number of guests. Overall, a forgettable experience but nothing too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, especially if you book with Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: CodSt
Reviews.Content: On arriving we had to wait for the front desk staff at the main building to finish playing with their hair before being checked in. They asked if we wanted a smoking or non-smoking king room and we said non-smoking. We had been put in the notorious beach building around the corner and across the street. As we entered the corridor there was an odd odour of car fumes and cigarettes but trusted the staff hadn't given us a smoking room. On entering the room the smell was awful, there was someone elses hair attached to the ceiling of the bathroom and the bed was clearly a single room. We couldn't understand it when I had signed a document at check in that said it was a non smoking king. We had a terrible nights sleep as we were on the ground floor and had buses and people being loud outside our room. As soon as we got up (not that I got much sleep - I didn't feel very safe) we asked the front desk in our building to move us. The room we moved to was twice the size and clearly a non-smoking room. The front desk, bell man etc in the beach house building are not reliable, half the time they were closed. When I needed quarters for the laundry (don't use the drier, your clothes would dry faster by blowing on them) we had to go all the way to the other building because they don't have any at the beach building. The internet was not working in our building as well. I am certain that we were given a single room because when collecting quarters a man at the front desk said we wanted to move from one and the number of his room put it in the same position as ours but on a different floor. In short, I wouldn't stay here again. They have poor customer service, unequal access to facilities based on where they put you and did not give me a room for 2 when that was what I paid for. It did not feel safe either.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lewpylew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 5 nights at the start of September with my boyfriend. Hotel was in a great location 2 minutes walk from the heart of Fisherman's walk. Central San Francisco was easily accessible by streetcar just around the corner at a bargainous 80p. Our room was on the 2nd floor. Was clean and spacious and couldn't fault it. The hotel offers a free contintenal breakfast, We only had it one day as the choices of food were limited and it was very crammed when we went downstairs which was a little off putting. Free internet access in the lobby which was helpful. Would stay here agan as couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On!”
Reviews.Author: alanjonesbath
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the HI Express for a couple of reasons. Most of the Fishermans Wharf hotel were coming in at about the same price, so went with what looked like best value. The HI Express offers a free breakfast every morning, so that sealed the deal for us. Location can't be faulted, it's right in the middle of the Wharf. You can walk to pretty much anywhere within 5 mintues, including Pier 39 and cable car turnarounds. It is on North Point Street, a fairly quite street from our experience. Our room overlooked the street, and we had absolutely no complaints about road noise, or noise from other rooms for that matter. We were on the 4th (top) floor, right at the end of the corridor, which must have helped keep noise levels down. With only 4 floors, there was never a long wait for the elevator. The hotel looks very new, everything feels fresh, and everything was spotlessly clean. No complaints whatsoever, and the daily housekeeping did a good job. The bed itself was very comfy, though the room itself wasn't that large. Fine for the two of us, but you couldn't have fitted anyone else in there. Not a problem though, as we weren't there to spend time in the hotel. We found the two internet access PC's in the lobby very handy, and on only a couple of occasions did we have to wait. Breakfast was very good for a 'free' breakfast. They had the usual selection of cereal, fruit, yoghurts, pastries, muffins, etc, plus a small selection of cooked foods like sausages, bacon, egg, etc. Free coffee, juice and milk as well of course. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and polite. Both check-in and check-out were efficent. We didn't make use of the parking at the hotel, which at around $42 a day plus tip (it is valet only), we were glad we didn't have a car. The hotel does have an undercover pull in, which is big enough to hold a couple of cars, which was handy for us on checkout day as we collected a car from Avis just around the corner, and brought it back to the hotel to load up. They were happy for us to park in the drop-off area for 15 minutes to load up. We'd have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to others, and would certainly stay there again. It's not really that cheap (we paid $200 a night at the start of June 2008), but no more expensive that anywhere else in the area, but we were happy with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Runningtraveller
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel. The entire staff were wonderful, the room was clean and a good size (we had 2 double beds for our family of four) and the hotel's decor was clean and fresh. The front desk staff were helpful, the cleaning staff did an excellent job cleaning our room daily and the breakfast staff did a fine job of replenishing food during an always hectic breakfast. The breakfast was excellent with a number of different choices (both hot and cold food available). One of my daughters' suffers from asthma. Unfortunately we could not book and be guaranteed a non smoking room through Hotwire in advance. However I contacted the Hotel on the morning of our arrival to request a non smoking room and upon our arrival later that day they had met my request and our non smoking room was ready for us(before 3 p.m. check-in) Our only concern would be the room location given to us. The room faced Beach St. and the F Line Streetcar roars by on Beach St. starting around 5:00 a.m. The Hotel's sound insulation was good but we often were still awakened by the sound of the streetcar in the morning. However we most certainly thought we got excellent value! The location in Fisherman's Wharf was excellent with easy access to public transit (both Cable Cars and the streetcar line). We rented a car for 3 of our 7 day stay and were able to find overnight street parking near the hotel every night which allowed us to save about $40 per night had we parked the car in the Hotel garage. My wife and I are both runners and we used the Hotel's fitness facility. As well it was a short run from the Hotel to the waterfront where we could run along the Embarcadero for several miles without worrying about vehicular traffic. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf. I would HIGHLY recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in many ways!”
Reviews.Author: OpaqueEntity
Reviews.Content: An amazing place. The best hotel of my trip. Arrived at night at Pier 39 after being bussed from Amtrak across the Bay and being pointed in the right direction I took the short walk to the hotel. I'd worked out the right way in from using Google Streetview which helped me a huge amount in San Francisco but with all the hotels in the area it's not always obvious. Fast check-in, upstairs and right upstairs in the lift. Lovely big comfy bed, great bathroom, lockable 'safe' in the cupboard which was useful and free internet access which I made good use of. No view (out into an internal courtyard/gap between rooms) but unless you were on the top floor at the front I don't think you'd get a view. Ice and drinks machine round the corner, first one I'd seen where you needed your door key to get to it. Talking of keys I locked mine in my room one day and the front desk were very quick at replacing them for me. Fishermans Wharf is round the corner and there are lots of places to shop and eat. Walgreens is amazing and exceptionally useful being open so late when you desperately need after sun lotion from cycling around all day! So many attractions nearby in the wharf but also Pier 39 and it's seals and shops. Bit of a gap and a walk until you get to the Ferry Building which is the only 'issue' I had but the city has so much to offer. I was exceptionally happy with my stay, just wished I could have stayed longer. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Too few beds”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead91
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Express San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf through Hotwire. We booked the room for 2 adults and 2 children (age 11 and 14). When we arrived, we were told the room wasn't ready, but to go to lunch and come back in an hour or so. When we came back, we were given a room with one King sized bed for 4 people! They told us they could not give us 2 beds because they were oversold on those rooms. They also said that Hotwire didn't guarantee the number of beds in the room. I argued that Hotwire did guarantee a room that would sleep the number of people that the reservation is made for. They offered us a rollaway at no cost, but could not put a second rollaway in the room due to fire code. They suggested I call Hotwire and ask them to move us to a new hotel. Hotwire offered nothing to help us. The hotel told us to take it or leave it, since they knew we had prepaid the hotel stay at a fraction of the cost that they could book the room for. The hotel manager spoke to Hotwire on my cell phone, but never once came out to talk to us! We had to sleep 3 of us in the King sized bed! Buyer beware ... Hotwire is very vague as to the number of beds that are provided in a hotel. The hotel can do what they want. You are caught in the middle. I'm not sure I will book a hotel through Hotwire again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great position”
Reviews.Author: gogggsy
Reviews.Content: Our family (4) enjoyed a nice stay at the Holiday Inn Express, Fishermans Wharf. Room was a good size, the breakfast was a good start to the day. Staff were friendly and the hotel is in a great location. If you plan to go to Alcatraz then book before you get here as it is vey popular and can get booked up, we were very lucky and got on the tour the first day of our 3 day visit after that the tour was booked up for the rest of the time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Louisa_P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July. Hotel is clean and welcoming and extremly well situated but I have to agree with reviewer who complained about the expensive parking charge and the fiasco over breakfast. Although as usual the breakfast is included the room rate was expensive compared to other Holiday Inn Express hotels we have stayed in. The breakfast area was packed out and often nowhere to sit. Many peopel looked around and then had to take breakfast back to their room.Staff seemed to find it difficult to keep the shelves stocked and we were left disappointed with the remaining choice. Because this is a very large, busy hotel perhaps a bit more thought needs to be given to the layout of the breakfast area- moving toastersetc..Overall I would still recommend thsi hotel as the situation was excellent and the majority of staff extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: I really liked the holiday inn express - the staff were very accomodating - the front desk staff in particular - the location and facilities very good. Breakfast was of a good standard and plentiful. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good what i wanted at a reasonable room rate.”
Reviews.Author: singaporeflyer
Reviews.Content: This is a overdue review, since i was at the hotel back in Dec 2005. As a Priority Club member, i have stayed in several 5-stars Intercontinental, Crowne Plaza and 4-stars Holiday Inn during my business and leisure trips thoughout Asia. This hotel is the first HI-Express i am staying in (not many HI-Express franchises in Asia), but since i am on a vacation and paying my own hotel bills, i don't mind and had no expectations whatsoever. I booked on the basis of the photos posted on the hote's website. When i arrived, i was pleasantly surprised by the clean and well kept condition of the place. It looks new and very well maintained, from the lobby to the elevators and to the rooms. Requested for a Alcatraz facing room and request was met. Great ! The room is fairly alright for 2 persons, and very typical of the Holiday Inns i have stayed throughout Asia. The shower/toilet was cleaned. The room provides free wired internet and Playstation console. I guess the concept of HI-Express is minimal service and facilities. So that way, they keep cost down and room rates affordable. I paid about US$90 per night and i would say its a great deal considering the clean and well maintained room, the free self serve continental breakfast and the free internet. If what u need is a good room and safe hotel to sleep in, this is it. If you like to lounge around the hotel in the day, require a swimming pool. fitness centre or a bar in the evening, try the Hyatt across the road or Sheraton around the corner. My wife and I were there for a vacation, so we returned to the room past 10pm and out the next day by 10am. So we are happy with the price and quality. Good location too. The last stop of the tram is a short walk away, and so is the pier where u can see the crab stalls. The free train ride to Union Sq is also just round the corner, and getting to ferry terminal to Alcatraz is a 8 minutes pleasant walk. Lots of food options around, from burgers to cafes. I enjoyed my 3 nights stay there. Am thinking of returning in Dec 08 for a couple of nights, whilst on the way to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Calgary-visitor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights after disembarking our Panama Canal cruise. This hotel was in a perfect location for sightseeing and only a 5 minute taxi ride from the cruise pier. We enjoyed walking to sight see at Pier 39, Lombard Street and Fishermans Wharf area. We had 3 rooms as were travelling with our extended family. The lobby was very large and contains the breakfast area. Breakfast was adequate and included. Our rooms were clean and quite large. We used the valet parking and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Above Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Floridatravels
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf for four days with my teenage daughter. Great loacation, walking distance to most of the sites of the city. The staff was extremely accomodating and helpful....very impressed with the service. The rooms were very clean. The breakfast bar was packed each morning, but hey...it's free! I was hesitant when I booked this because it was rated 2 1/2 stars through Priceline, through which I have only booked "4" star hotels. Even though the hotel isn't considered "full-service"; no bar, pool etc., it deserves a better rating. Considering the cost of most other hotels in San Francisco, and walking by some of the other 2 star hotels, I would return here without question. Florida traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: CaliTraveler020
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI-FW the weekend of August 8, 2008. We found the hotel to be a good choice for our trip. We were in the Main Building (the one with the front desk) at the corner of Levenworth and Bay. This location is located right in between Ghiardelli Square and Pier 39. About a 10 minute walk to either. We stayed on the business floor since we are Priority Club members. I was able to see both Alcatraz Island and the Golden Gate Bridge from my room, so that was cool. I believe it was room 565. There is a Walgreen's drug store one block from the hotel so that made stocking up on water and forgotten items easy and affordable. We did not rent a car and took taxi's or public transportation. The taxi from the airport (SFO) was $50 including a nice tip. A taxi to union square is $10 from the hotel. About $15 to the downtown financial district. We love the garlic crab at the Crab House on pier 39. We ate there twice. We went to a Giants game at AT&T Park. We shopped at Union Square and Chinatown. All were fun. The Holiday Inn has 2 buildings. The one with the Denny's is about 1 block East of the Main Building. Both are well located to all the stuff in the area. We go to SF every couple of years and the Holiday Inn was comparable to the other chain hotels in FW. Some are a little closer to Pier 39 if that matters to you (5 minute walk instead of 10.) I recommend the Holiday Inn if staying in the FW area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripDuo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our cross-country trip (by car). The service was superb and location; the best. Literally, right around the corner from Fisherman's Wharf and the Pier. The cable car and Gharadelli Sq. are right there too. We couldn't have picked a better location. Not to mention- safe! This hotel is close to everything yet very quiet. The breakfast buffet (included in room rate) was way above average. It had everything you wanted. The room was very large (king bed) and clean. We would recommend this hotel in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: taffytoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August and found it to be a great choice. The hotel was extremely clean and our room on 4th floor was very quiet. The breakfast was also very good and I was hesitant after reading some complaints about breakfast area and although we found it to be crowded , it was well stocked and a nice amenity. We had considered Comfort Inn at Van Ness and must say we definitely made the right choice. Very close to everything fun to do! Just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. I am very particular about where I stay and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: iheartsfCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Very new & clean, perfect rooms and surroundings. Within very easy walking distance (a few blocks) from Fishermans Wharf. The only problem is parking. Beware, I didn't read in reviews that their parking garage at the hotel can fill up. We had to drop off luggage then drive around the corner to Anchorage Parking Garage to store our car at $30 per night (24 hour parking, no in/out). It actually worked out fine because you'll either want to walk to Fisherman's wharf or ride a taxi to other locations, but just a warning. I was not expecting to not be able to park at the hotel. Other than that we had a great time and worth the money to stay close to where you are going to be. We took a tour and went to 50 different movie sites, it was awesome! We wished we had more time to go out to Alcatraz, if you get here and see it, you'll know why.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mike_in_CO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two teenage nieces and it was comfortable, reasonable and located well for tourists. Also, on-site parking was useful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: catlovertina
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn express is a nice ,budget hotel . I stayed here for 4 nights with my family and not a problem . The staff could not have been more welcome ! Great location and just a short walk from pier 39 and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Meere
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights here and had a great experience. Two blocks from the Wharf excitement, but far enough from the noise to sleep at night. The rooms were clean, so were the hallways. Front desk staff was very helpful and we enjoyed the free breakfast in the morning. More than enough choices for parents with two teenagers. I was able to use the internet and we printed out our boarding passes for free. Valet parking is pricey, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: PDWYERConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Express on North Point Rd and we were very happy with the Hotel. The rooms were very clean and decorated nicely. Although the rooms were on the smallish side they were more than adequate. Breakfast was included: a hot buffet eg. omlets or scrambed eggs,sausage or bacon, cereals, fruit, bagels, breads, (a couple of toasters for the bread or bagels), coffee,tea,milk,yogurt,juices(apple,cranberry,orange) and some really nice hot cinnamon buns. We are early risers and the buffet opens at 6:30 which was perfect for our needs. We did come back once around 9:30 and the breakfast dining area was mobbed. Eat breakfast early! The location of the hotel is perfect for visiting the Wharf area. It's a short walk (2 blocks) to Fisherman's Wharf. The Hyde/Beach cable car is also a short walk and is next to Ghiradelli Square so there's alot to do near the hotel. There's a nice pub across the street from the hotel (Knuckles) that is part of the Hyatt. We paid 187 a night but there may be better rates if we had more time to plan. It is located in a safe area to go for a walk at night. We went on a bus trip that returned late (9:30PM) and dropped off passengers around Union Square and the street people were out in force. I wouldn't want to chance a wrong turn in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisy61
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a family of four. Nice big room, good bathroom and in a great location. Breakfast was good, wasn't too busy and staff were very friendly and helpful. Good value for money. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did The Job !”
Reviews.Author: Movingmike
Reviews.Content: Our first time in San Francisco, decided to stay in the Wharf area and from TA hotel reviews decided to stay at Holiday Inn Express. We stayed for 4 nights, the room was very clean and well supplied. The breakfast fare was very good and plentyful. It is well situated to use the public transport system either to the Wharf / Pier 39 / Ferry Buildings area or up to Union Square area. Did not have a car but noted valet parking @ $37 per night which appeared to be the norm for SF. The staff were very helpful. I would use this hotel again when returning to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the area”
Reviews.Author: KB08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to SF and stayed 3 nights at the HI Express FW. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was extremely clean, had a wonderful breakfast, the staff was nice and the location was perfect. We stayed at another hotel in SF for the first part of our week (wanted to stay in two different areas while we were in the city) and this one far exceeded the other hotel. The breakfast was especially helpful and saved us at least $20-$30/day. The staff was very friendly and helpful; even helped book our shuttle bus ride back to the airport. The location was perfect because it was one or two blocks from the main attractions; close enough to be very convenient yet not too close to all of the hustle and bustle. Overall, this was an excellent hotel and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the Area”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: It was about what you would expect for this area - overpriced, parking ripoff, noisy accomodations. I thought the room was small and the beds worn out. I did like the breakfast which is a real time & money saver if you are traveling with kids. I asked a couple of questions at the front desk and found the staff apethetic at best. The Marriott across the street is nicer, and if you get the room/park combo it's about $10 less expensive per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: richnc100
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just great. Breakfast had lots of hot choices, staff was nice, good location and price was good for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pilar007
Reviews.Content: We arrived early several hours before check-in time and were pleased that we were able to check right in. The hotel is in a very convenient location, easy walking to all the Fisherman's Wharf attractions. It's also very close to the several cable car stops and has a taxi waiting area right across the street. We had a fair sized king room on the fourth floor with a king sized bed. The room was clean and comfortable but with no view. The hectic complimentary buffet breakfasts were convenient but they were often slow replenishing items that were finished. Front desk service was friendly and helpful. Price could have been a little lower but overall a perfectly fine stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - room - service.”
Reviews.Author: BadCoKCMO
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights (June 12-15, 2008) in a King room on the 1st floor. There was no view, just a courtyard of windows - but that didn't matter, because we were sightseeing from morning til night and I was too tired to care when we were finished. If you need a nice hotel, in a great/safe location, with a clean room & free breakfast - look no further. We got a rate of $187 per night through the hotels website - and when you factor in the complimentary breakfast - that's a pretty good deal. There is plenty to eat - not just danish & coffee. They had hot cinnamon rolls, cold cereal, carton milk, eggs (scrambled or omelet depending on the day), bacon or sausage (depending on the day) biscuits and gravy (daily), and then breads, english muffins and bagels. If this doesn't work for you, there is a Denny's literally right around the corner - as well as a Walgreen in case you need pop/water, medicine, sunscreen, snacks, toothpaste, film developing, socks - or anything else you forgot or think you might need. The turnaround for the Powell-Mason is only 2 blocks from the hotel. You can pay $5 per way, per person. Or buy a 3-day unlimited ride pass for $18 per person. We chose this option which gave us no excuse to explore the city more. Overall a great hotel - no complaints! The rooms were big & clean. Had in-room safe, iron, ironing board, coffee, internet, movies, video games, etc. There are 2 computers for internet access just off the lobby that are available 24/7, at no cost. Great for printing boarding passes for the flight home, booking tours, researching restaurants and attractions - and checking your emails from home - as well as sending the standard "wish you were here" email to the folks back home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Parking Pricey”
Reviews.Author: NekoCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI Express for two nights and everything was fine. We had a large clean comfortable room with a king size bed and a very large bathroom on the second floor (no view). The free breakfast was a little crazy, but to be expected located in a tourist mecca. The room rate was a tad expensive, but you are paying for location, location, location. The fee to park was outrageous; $37 per night + 14% tax. Two nights of parking cost $84.00 plus valet tips each time you take the car out. This was painful. I would recommend this hotel, if you can stomach the parking fee and all the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: cw_squared
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights (June 10-14) in 2008. The room was ready upon arrival and was very clean. We called ahead to ask for a room along the north face of the hotel as this would give us a view out towards the bay. When we got there we were told they really didn't reserve rooms in spots just details like King bed or non-smoking. So our view was just another wall of the hotel. Other than that, the staff was extremely nice and I realize that everyone would want that view so I guess it's just the luck of the draw. The complimentary breakfast was pretty good. They had cinnamon rolls, bananas, bagels, various cereals, bread for toast, bacon or sausage (seemed to alternate), biscuits, gravy, milk and various juices. There may have been more but we can't remember. The food was good (not great). And the crowds were generally not too bad except for Saturday morning. The room wasn't large but it was fine for what we wanted. Just a place to relax between excursions around San Francisco. It was very clean and had a decent decor for a regular hotel. The staff was always friendly and willing to answer any questions we had. We considered it an excellent deal for the price we got off Hotwire as the location near Fisherman's Wharf was the best feature of the hotel. A quick walk to several attractions made our sightseeing easier. We didn't rent a car because so many forms of public transportation are within a couple of blocks from the hotel. The selection of television channels were pretty sparse but we didn't spend tons of time in the room aside from showering and sleeping so that didn't bother us too much. I would suggest trying to find a deal online if you can. We saw a guy walk in off the street and they were asking $239.00 for the one room they had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bandit
Reviews.Content: Used my Priority Points for a two night stay. This is a nice Holiday Inn Express with a wonderful location. The first room we were given was on the 4th floor and was tiny, with no view. Called the front desk and asked for a room with some sort of view. The only available room with an outside view was on the smoking floor, but we decided to try it out. There was no "smoking" smell in the hallways and the room we chose had no smell of smoking at all. (Room 370). Very nice room with good views and the windows did open so we could get some fresh air! Yes, it was loud with the windows open, but with them closed, it was quiet. The beds were very comfortable, staff was friendly and accomodating and a great location! Breakfast was nice with both hot and cold items. Sure saves a lot of money! We did the Super Sightseeing Tours which is next door to the hotel. We did two tours (Muir Woods and City) as we only had one day to really get out and see the city. I am glad we did! Safe location - Cost Plus World Market right down the street, so we bought our wine and snacks there and enjoyed it in the room! I would definitelly recommend this hotel for a trip to San Francisco. Wish we would have had more time in the beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: eden2
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 mins from harbour and 10 mins from Pier 39. Room was in Holiday Express building 2nd floor overlooking main road and trams. Didnt find it noisy at all. Room was clean, comfy, staff pleasant, breakfast fine, although the 1 evening meal there was disappointing. There is a large late night Walgreen supermarket across the street which had food, toiletries, drinks etc etc, plenty of eating places around. Highly recommend Boudins on the Wharf for breakfast, sourdough soup and ambience. Really recommend taking yr own hairdryer to Holiday Inns in the US, the ones supplied are weak and lethal!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: holplan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in May. Very happy with the hotel which is in a great location. The room was pretty standard but it was spotlessly clean, the furnishings were good, it was nice and quiet and overall very comfortable. The continental breakfast was tasty and there was a pretty good choice. What more could you want ! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job with great service”
Reviews.Author: Tedf
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, one of the main considerations was proximity to Pier 35 as we were taking a cruise to Alaska. We settled on the Holiday Inn Express after trolling through the many reviews on the different hotels in the Fisherman's Wharf area, and I'm happy to say it fit the bill exactly. If you're looking for a hotel with lots of history and character, don't come here. However, if all you need is a comfortable bed, a quiet room, a safe location and friendly service it's perfect. Previous reviews had also mentioned asking for a room facing the courtyard to minimise noise - I included this when making my internet booking, and our wish was granted, with our room also being on the top floor. Our flight from Australia was scheduled to arrive around 10.30am, but a quick call to the hotel a couple of days before confirmed they had a luggage room if we needed to kill a couple of hours before check-in. Imagine our surprise and pleasure when, on arriving at the hotel around midday, we were given our room straight away. The hotel has a free business centre near reception, with two PCs with internet access, plus a printer. There's also a breakfast area on the ground floor, with a free continental breakfast included in the price. It's not exactly gourmet, and our first experience there was a little overwhelming as a large school group were staying - enough said! However, the Hollywood Cafe a couple of doors down did a great lunchtime BLT, so I'd imagine their breakfast was pretty good too. There's a pretty good sports bar/restaurant right across the street, plus there's also a Safeway and a Walgreens a block or so east on North Point. We found the staff unfailingly helpful and friendly, the bed was very comfortable, and the room EXTREMELY quiet. The hotel's just far enough away from the main action at Fisherman's Wharf to be quiet, but is just a five minute walk away.Once we checked out, Pier 35 was an easy walk of 5 blocks, towing our bags along. While this style of hotel may not be to everyone's taste, it does the job well.

Reviews.Title: “well impressed”
Reviews.Author: tony_w_62
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed here in may 08 for four nights. I had read some reviews prior to our stay and I did have my doubts but we were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Of course bearing in mind this is only a 3 star hotel and you would not expect the ritz I can honestly say the staff could not have been nicer, they were very friendly and efficient, from the check in to the cleaning staff. The room was very clean and spacious, the breakfast was very nice too. we did"nt book this hotel the travel agency did that for us, but if and when we go back to San Francisco I will definately stay here again. Thanks to all at the Holiday Inn Express. Oh and its very well located too .

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain567
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, first impressions were of modern, clean hotel. Rooms were of good size, we asked for top floor room which had a bit of a view over the harbour and also turned out to be quiet as well. Comfortable beds, soft and firm pillows allowed good nights sleep, coffee maker, clean bathroom with all the necessary bits and pieces included. Cool bucket supplied and with ice maker and vending machine down the corridor, (mini fridge would be better suited.) Internet access downstairs with 2 computers to allow one to check e mail etc.( free service in the room.) Breakfast was choice of cereals, yoghurts, toast, pastry and choice of 3 hot plates, never any rush and plenty of food. Yes would be nice to have a bar or restaraunt in the hotel but really it is location here that is important, this hotel is minutes away from all the touristy areas with all sorts of eating establishments and with easy acces to public transport. We had a hire car which the valet allowed us to leave at the front door free of charge while we unloaded our cases and checked into the room , then we returned our car to local depot. No need for a hire car in SF, public transport is fun, easy and cheap while public parking is expensive. Shuttle bus to the door should take 30-40 mins and $12-15. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay - could have been better”
Reviews.Author: u2greek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the HI Express for one night as part of our one week stay in SF and the surrounding areas. We had stayed off Market Street earlier in our trip, and wanted to stay in Fisherman's Wharf to visit Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge.. The hotel's common areas are stylish - and give an Art Deco look. Definitely gave the hotel a "new" look. Staff were all very friendly giving directions and information re: the surrounding areas. Was a little disappointed in the hotel room - small, especially for a Holiday Inn Express. Lacked certain amenities such as two soap bars (one for the sink and another for the bathtub), a small selection of TV channels. AC was very loud as the unit was right next to the bed View was awful through the one set of windows in the room - it was of the rest of the hotel. Free internet service included, along with breakfast til 9:30 Valet parking: $37! ouch, but common for the area. I've stayed at the Hyatt across the street in the past, and this time was just maybe $10-20 more, but probably worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn Sanfrancisco”
Reviews.Author: FrannyAlbertaCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the May long weekend they did give us the wrong room 1 bed instead of 2 but they did sort it out, rooms , and bathrooms were very clean A 2 block walk to the tram and the warf. No pool but the holiday innn Next door does have one you can use. There contental breakfast now has eggs and either a sausge round or bacon. I would defenetly go back. Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Quite pricey though.”
Reviews.Author: Dizneylvr1971
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here from May 3rd through May 6th. We had never been to San Francisco and wanted to be in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf, which it was. It was an easy walk there and was within easy walking distance of most of the public transporation options. We had a room on the third floor that overlooked the sports bar across the street. The room was clean and the bathroom quite large. When we first entered the room, we thought the windows were open judging by the noise level. Upon inspection, they were actually closed! Thankfully after it got dark, it seemed to get much quieter outside. I did not have any trouble sleeping. The room includes a breakfast, which was quite good. They had eggs (with or without cheese), bacon, biscuits, sausage gravy, toast, bagels and these wonderful cinnamon rolls. We were impressed by how much variety there was for a free breakfast. The room was very nice, the breakfast good, but we were not impressed with the price of $270 a night we paid. I would probably stay here again, if we could get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: muke07
Reviews.Content: we have recently stayed for a week at the holiday inn express sanfrancisco,and we really enjoyed our stay there.the rooms are very nice and we were lucky enough to have a view of alcatraz.we found that all of the staff were very friendly and helpful.the hotel is in a great location for pier 39 and other attractions,the cable car turn around is just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke Smell”
Reviews.Author: gogigboy
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Virgin as it was one of their top hotels. Wasn't too impressed, asked for a non smoking room, when we arrived all that was available was smoking. the room stank of smoke, even the wallpaper smelt, had to really complain to get a non smoking on the next day. wasn't overly impressed by the hotel, styed in better Holiday Inns in other countries.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: lucylocket57
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel and had an enjoyable stay. Our room was on the 4th floor and just looked out onto a void courtyard but this meant that it was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable and had a choice of soft or hard pillows. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. The hotel is in a good position for Pier 39 at Fishermans Wharf and easy walking to lots of other attractions. The breakfasts were ok, but not a huge choice, we did have a problem one morning finding a free table to sit at. We arranged a taxi through the hotel back to the airport, the taxi arrived promptly and for 4 people cost just under $40.

Reviews.Title: “This was THE PERFECT HOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: M&D1970
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! Stayed for four nights in room 483 and 485 (the fourth floor is the top floor so this is not a huge place). There was no view as you are sandwiched in between hotels and other buildings but we didn't come to sit in the room. We paid $62/night through hotwire.com on a rather last-minute trip and this was an extraordinary value for this normally $200+ night hotel. The hotel looks like it is brand new!! It is probably the cleanest, best maintained hotel we've stayed in and we've stayed in a lot, including upscale five star establishments! The furniture, furnishings, linens, beds ... everything ... top notch and in perfect working and very comfortable condition. The staff, including the maids, are all very friendly and helpful. The new hot breakfast is very good and saves a ton of $ on breakfast every morning. The only complaint - well, a couple complaints, is it isn't very hot. The hot items are lukewarm at best and the variety is the same every day. Some pancakes or waffles would be a nice touch as not everyone enjoys biscuits and gravy (a daily offering). The other complaint that really doesn't have as much to do with the hotel is the other guests - every morning we had pushy, rude people crowding in trying to cut in line, like a bunch of pigs waiting for food at the trough. The thing the hotel could do to mitigate this is re-think the way the breakfast is set up. Logistically it could be set up in a better way to avoid people crowding in. It is fantastic that they provide a hot breakfast, it is good and the gentlemen manning the breakfast ensure there is never anything empty, they do a very nice job. A nice touch are the two free computers they provide in the lobby for internet use. They are even hooked up to printers which was great to be able to print out city maps etc. They do get busy though and the waiting line can be long. The hotel location is perfect and so close to everything you'd want to do. We didn't have a car to worry about the exorbanant parking charges; we took the 'Go Lorries' airport shuttle both to/from the airport which worked out wonderfully. We walked everywhere or used the 3-day MUNI passes we purchased for $18 to ride the cable cars, streetcars and bus system all over SF. The passes were well worth the money. We would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat and we were sorry to leave!

Reviews.Title: “beware of expensive valet parking”
Reviews.Author: popeadventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights as part of our Virgin Golden Triangle tour and it was by far the nicest hotel.Rooms very comfortable and modern,good beds, towels and bedding changed daily if you wished. Good central location but we found Fishermans Wharf dirty, full of tramps and over-rated! Free breakfast is great. The only downside of this hotel is the VERY EXPENSIVE parking fee of $42 a night. We have never had to pay to park our car in a hotel we are guests in and found it a totally unreasonable charge. After our first night we found that we could park on the road on a meter from 7pm to 7am for free outside the front of the hotel and then moved the car into a $10 car park for the day. We later found that further along North Point there is free road parking day and night in some parts so its worth looking for, but be carefull to check the road signs each time you park as the roads are cleaned between 2am and 6am on alternate days of the week. We visited the Golden Gate Bridge\park, the Presidio, Muir Woods and Sausalito and they were all great, if you have a car drive up and down all the steep roads, great fun! Go up to Twin Peaks for views to die for of the whole of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: zracoon
Reviews.Content: The good: - great location - clean, newer feeling hotel - decent breakfast - good service the bad: - very noisy, especially noise coming from hallway - small rooms Breakfast was much better than a continental breakfast, but maybe not quite as good as a Dennys or something. Each day had some type of egg, sausage or bacon, and a variety of breads, muffins, rolls, yogurt, juices, milk, coffee, etc. No pancakes, waffles, or anything like that. Rooms are pretty noisy. First night someone adjacent to us had a cough, so we got to hear that most of the night. Also, anytime someone shut a door or talked in the hallway it sounded almost like they were in your room. Location was great. You can walk to all the areas in Fisherman's wharf, to the Alcatraz Pier 33 (15 mins) parts of Golden Gate National Rec Area, Ghiradelli, Cannery, Powell/Hyde cable car turnaround, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dani861
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire and got a great deal at $69/night + tax. Great location right near all the action of Fisherman's Wharf and public transit. Rooms and hotel new and modern. Great extended breakfast. I would highly recommend if you are going to stay in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Holiday Inn Express - beat all expectations”
Reviews.Author: blondelinda
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 2 teenage children We had been traveloling the US for 3 weeks until we hit San fran I booked this hotel direct with hotel, based on reviews on this site I was not disapointed in any way and more than pleasantly surprised The hotel is only 5 years old, very modern with all new amenities Free cooked breakfast free internet in room (if you have laptop) or pc's in lobby free too Best of all....LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION The locations was superb, right on Fishermans Wharf, next block to cable cars and all the restuarants. You just cant beat this place, specially for the $$$$$ paid I would definatly return hear, and think this hotel is in a much better location than some of the more upmarket and expensive ones

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but Watch the Parking Charge”
Reviews.Author: dwwilburn
Reviews.Content: Nice stay. The room was plenty large for the 4 of us. Breakfast was really good. However, they don't have wireless connections in the room, so I had to go down to the Lobby. Then, I never could connect to their system and ended up connecting to the Hyatt's. Weird. Also, watch out for the parking charge. It is a big $37 bucks. Looking around, the Marriott parking charge was $22 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nicksyPlymouth
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights 19th to 23 rd march, lovely room, great bed ,no complaints at all, free breakfast was more like a buffet and eat all you want very good value all round, great location for the wharf and most other things you will want to do and see, plus a bar right across the road doing food and cheap beers, would go back here any day loved it all , many thanks to the staff ,

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!!! - Modern, clean, large size rooms, Free Full Breakfast +Internet”
Reviews.Author: LisainAZ
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express - Fishermans Wharf was a great value. I would highly recommend it. I stayed 2 nights at this hotel March 7 - 9th 2008 and the staff were very friendly, the FREE breakfast was more than I expected (biscuits+gravy, eggs, bacon, sausage, juice, bagels, cereal, pancakes), and the rooms were clean with granite countertops and a wet bar, mini fridge, and comfy beds. The last night of my stay in San Francisco I stayed in the Sheraton Fishermans Wharf which was a nice hotel but I would much rather stay at the Holiday Inn Express next visit as its breakfast are FREE and the internet was FREE plus there was a big difference in price...I saved lots of money at the Holiday Inn Express. The hotel is new and very modern, perfect for families, couples, or even the business traveler. The location is perfect as you can easily walk to everything..the cable cars, buses, and all the attractions. My suggestion is to purchase a "Go San Francisco Card" you pay one price about $75.00 for 3 days and it includes all the tourist attractions you can visit...museums, Palace of Fine Arts, Exploritorium, Aquarium, Wine Tours, Alcatraz, Boat Cruises, Cable Car Rides, bike rentals..and much more. Great upbeat attitude when I called the front desk and a pleasant experience checking out. I travel 3 weeks out of a month for Business and It was a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: freddyheather
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, centrally located, staff was friendly and helpful and the room/bed was comfortable. We were not disturbed by noise at night, the breakfast was diverse and plentiful, everything was great. The location is unbeatable - you can easily walk to the Fisherman's Wharf area (Pier 39) or if you decide to see a more cultural/non-touristy side of San Fran, you can simply walk inland instead. I recommend renting a Go Car on Hyde - that is a blast. It was sort-of cold when we were there, but it was still a great trip. Holiday Inn Express was perfect as usual.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire Customer Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Aphishionado
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great value hotel near fisherman's wharf - look no further. beds are comfy. breakfast is incredible. only down side is parking - its $37 for the hotel parking. there is street parking which is free from 7-7 = after that its 3.00$ an hour 25 cents every 6 minutes! which would be a pain if you had to sleep in. would stay there again. i booked thru hotwire - it is listed as a 2 1/2 star hotel with the thumbs up for customer favorite -

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Stay at Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: ttotally
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Holiday Inn Express for Spring Break. It was very comfortable and convenient. Food and shopping was within easy walking distance from the hotel. Breakfast and high speed internet was included so that was an added bonus. I would definitely recommend this to other families and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: Kai-17
Reviews.Content: The first thing i have to say is that this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed at - for many reasons. First the location is fabulous, you are a very short walk from Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39. You are also close to the cable car stop. There are several great restuarants in the area, our favourites being Bubba Gumps and The Rainforest Cafe - both fun places, with good food and service. Our room was a good size, well equipped, comfortable and quiet. We had no view at all, we over looked other rooms, but who goes to San Francisco to stay in their room. The bed was amazingly comfortable - if only we could have sneaked it home in our cases. the free breakfast was wonderful. especially considering it was free. There was plenty of room to sit, plenty of food, and it was replenished through the morning (during the set hours) There were plenty of healthy options available too. It certainly set us up for the day, and nobody seemed to mind us taking fruit with us (for a mid-morning power snack!) . The staff were polite, helpful and willing to help when we needed assistance. Having free internet access in the lobby was great, there are two computers and at times we had to wait to use them , but if we popped back to the hotel mid-afternoon (to drop off shopping!) they were usually available. The hotel is clean, and nicely decorated and has a welcoming feel to it. Like other people who wrote reviews, we were on the first floor and had to use the lift as the stairs were all marked as fire exits. But this is such a small thing to mention, and lets face it you're going to get plenty of exercise walking up and down those hills - you'll probably be glad of the lifts. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. We plan to return to San Francisco in a couple of years, and will certainly be stopping here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bubba&MaryJo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is, as it’s name suggests, ideally located for Fisherman’s Wharf, being just a couple of blocks away. Also well within walking distance are the shops and restaurants of Pier 39, the Alcatraz tours departing from Pier 31 and the cablecar turnaround at Hyde. Around the corner there are many tourist shops selling everything a tourist could hope to buy. We also rented bikes for a day from a store here. The hotel is a fairly modern block, although the outside looks very Art Deco, and the room we had was reasonably spacious, clean and well decorated. A king size bed, TV, table and chair are in the main area. The bathroom has a bath, with shower, toilet, sink and hairdryer. A coffee pot is also provided. If it’s important to you, make sure you request a room with an outside view as our room looked out onto an internal blank space although we had a view of the sky to see the weather (rooms with an outside view won’t have much of a view anyway just onto the road). Our room was located on the 1st floor (2nd to North American readers) and, annoyingly, the only stairways we could find were all marked as being emergency exits only. Accordingly we had to use the rather slow lifts to travel up and down one floor! A continental breakfast was included in our booking - cereal, toast, coffee, juice, fruit and pastries were all available. If you prefer something cooked, we understand you can obtain a voucher at reception, which can be put towards the cost of breakfast in the Denny’s attached to the Holiday Inn next door. There’s no bar in the hotel (that we could find) if you fancy a night cap but there is a sports bar directly across the street. There is a small gym and free internet access on the ground floor. Although we didn’t require it, parking is available at the hotel but we’d recommend checking the cost first as it struck us as being ludicrously expensive (although perhaps not for San Francisco - we don’t know). Check-in and check-out where quick and efficient and the airport shuttle organised for us by reception turned up on time to take us back to SFO. ($14 each one way) Although the surrounding streets have many hotel options in competition, the HI Express was quite busy which probably says a lot for it’s great value and location. We certainly would have no hesitation in returning here and indeed, plan to do so later in the year. An excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and good value”
Reviews.Author: alikay61
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a large room with 2 queen beds and kitchenette. Very comfortable beds and room was spotlessly clean and nicely decorated. Location was great for using public transport and had shops and fast food/family type eateries nearby. Breakfast was complimentary and had a good selection of items available. 2 computers available for guests in small area off the reception and free wireless internet in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 007Cambridge
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel, within walking distance of the wharf and Pier 39. The room was very clean and spacious, with a very Comfortable bed. No problems at all. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Foreigner_in_London
Reviews.Content: I really didn't have high expectations at all of staying at a Holiday Inn, but I was pleasantly surprised. This hotel is really nice. It's clean, has new decorations, a nice little gym, lovely smelling toiletries, really friendly staff, and a good breakfast (that's included in the price). One really cannot ask for more. It's also in a fantastic location, near the seafront, which beats Union Square any day, as there are few bums loitering, unlike around all the Union Square hotels. There is no room service, but I think internet connection is free. The parking, as pretty much everywhere else in SF, is rather expensive. It's a relaxed hotel, and I felt far more comfortable staying at the Holiday Inn Express than I did at the Fairmont to be honest, and it's cleaner than the Fairmont too. It's by no means a luxury hotel, but it's definitely above average, and I would very happily go back there to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Express is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: gardengirly
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just spent a night at the Holiday Inn Express, and were pleasantly surprised with the great location and comfort of the room. We had a family suite on the second floor. It was VERY large, with a living room, small kitchenette and a huge bathroom. It was nicely decorated, with a marble sink, and nice furniture. It was everything we needed to hang out after a long day of traipsing around the city. My husband & I could read in the living room while the kids watched TV on the beds. The free continental breakfast was perfectly adequate, with a variety of pastries, cereal & fruit. And the location is great - just a few blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Ghirardelli Square & the cable cars. We had to book at the last minute, without shopping around much, but we thought it was a bargain for $225, and I'm sure with some shopping around, you could get a better price on Expedia or Priceline. If we were to come back to SF and had a week, this is definitely where we would stay - it has everything.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BCape
Reviews.Content: I'm just wrapping up a stay in San Fran's Holiday Inn Express in Fisherman's Wharf. Overall I would rate this experience as above average. The entire 4 days we were in the city it rained/downpoured, but we were entertained none the less. The hotel was nice and clean with the staff always around. Our room was on the second floor, but we hardly ever heard the road and we're pretty light sleepers. They serve a continental breakfast in the morning which is nothing extravagant but a nice little meal before you start your day. The have internet in the rooms and two computers for community use down in the lobby. The computers are pretty old though and there is always people waiting so I'd bring your own if you are going to email often. Parking is pricy, but seeing as how we were on business work paid...$37 a night. Try "Mood- Thai foor and Sushi" on Beach St. one block away. Yellow curry and pineapple fried rice were oh so good and pretty inexpensive. If weather permits I reccomend a hike in Muir Woods, over Golden Gate to Pirates Cove... Eat at Dipseas for lunch. Overall you can't beat this hotel's location. It's right on fisherman's wharf and is a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerC
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is perfectly located. Fisherman's Wharf area is 2.5 blocks to the north and the cable car turnaround to Union Square is 1.5 blocks to the south. Pier 33 for the Alcatraz tour is a 15 minute (8 blocks) walk. If you drive to SF just leave your car parked at the hotel and walk or take public transportation everywhere. Hotel is valet parking only at $37 per 24 hour period. Staying at the Holiday Inn Express gives you priviledges to amenities (such as the swimming pool) at the Holiday Inn which is located next door and the next block down. The front desk staff very friendly and helpful. The room was extremely clean. In-room safe included. The beds could use new mattresses. Ours were "dead", no spring or bounce to them. I would stay here again the next time I visit the Fisherman Wharf area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RaddogUK
Reviews.Content: Stopped here over New Years and did some sight seeing. The location of this hotel is amazing and all the other major brand hotels are clustered around. Right next to streetcars, cable car and the wharves. Walking distance to bars and restaurants. The hotel is in the same building as the Holiday Inn. The room we had was small compared to others in the hotel but clean and well maintained. The front desk were helpful although it was always busy and we often had to stand in line before we could speak to somebody. Great free breakfast, but that is the only food or beverage service available inside the hotel. Valet parking at $35 per day with unlimited access and ability to enter or leave the park. A great place to stay and cheaper than the surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: richbuck
Reviews.Content: My wife loves SF, so when her 50th birthday rolled around, that's where she wanted to go. I got a very good deal on Hotwire for two nights. The rooms are standard fare, very clean, large bathroom, firm, queen beds. A closet safe, TV, table and chairs, coffee maker, thick towels, internet access, hair dryer and all the stuff that we have come to expect in most of the better hotels enhances our stay. We're off and running. Two easy blocks, slightly downhill to the Fisherman's Wharf. Strolling, observing, stopping for snacks. I even got pulled into a street performance. They needed a slightly overweight, big guy, to pick up the girl and stand on the performers chest as he laid in broken glass. My daughter was slightly embarrassed by the whole thing but my wife was cracking up. We ate well, spent a little more than normal in the tourist trap, but for the most part it was very good... My wife is partial to fish and crab.. and the wharf is a good place to find it The next day, after the continental breakfast, (which we all loved and felt was quite complete and generous) we decided to take the bus to the Union Square for shopping. $1.50 a head, with free transfer. We rode thru the Chinese area on the way. Many older ladies got on with their shopping bags and gossiped at breakneck speed. As we passed, I noticed the stores selling food were jammed. I felt transported to a crowded Asia. I quietly commented to my Asian wife that she will look right at home on this bus in a few years chatting with all the old ladies.. That comment was overheard by the lady sitting across from us who laughed out loud upon hearing it. We chatted with her and had some laughs. We had fun shopping in the stores. Macy's has 7 floors on each side of the street, 7 for men, 7 for women. That was pretty cool.. I bought my wife a nice gift. A reasonable $10 fare to take us taxi back to the hotel.. We rested, then strolled some more, all jacketed and ready for the cold San Francisco nights. We slept well that night and came home safely. The hotel served it's purpose more than adequately. The location, the full continental breakfast, and the cleanliness of the room stand out in my mind. The beds were sturdy and comfortable.. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative is those damn parking fees in SF, $35 a night plus tax. We could have saved about 7-10 dollars a night by parking off site and walking but it wasn't really worth it to me. But the Hotwire mostly deal offset it.. I know now that Holiday Inn Express can deliver comfort and convenience to the traveler and tourist. Without equivocation, I can tell you it's as good or better than the 4 star hotels we've visited.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as last resort using points and I was impressed. Like others mention, it is in a good location. We walked to fisherman's wharf for dinner at Alioto's (highly recommend). The room was clean, nicely furnished, and the concierge was helpful when helping to find a restaurant for dinner. The breakfast brunch was good, although a little pricey, The overall service was good. I have tried to avoid Holiday Inns until staying at this property...it definitely exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coz-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as the last leg of our golden triangle trip, it was very clean and bright, much newer than the other two hotels we had stayed in, although it seemed very business like. The room was large, with 2 double beds, a nice bathroom and cleaned daily, although if you wish to stay in your room later than 8am I would hang the privacy tag on the door as the maid knocks early and loudly!!!!
