The breakfast is basic, but free, so very convenient. The location of the hotel is great, I much preferred being by the wharf as opposed to staying near Union Square in down town..... The one thing I will complain about is the valet parking, this may be more of a complaint to take up with my travel company as we were not fore-warned that we had to pay $35 per day valet parking, with no other options open to us. The transportation was fantastic, and cable cars are great fun!!! Would definately recommend San Francisco!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: zhusky
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of this hotel I thought that it would be the best bet for our family-weekend in San Francisco. Seemed to have a good location, competitive price, and is fairly new. I found the best deal by pre-paying directly on the hotel website and even chose a mini-suite as it would be myself, my wife, and my two young boys so I wanted a little extra room. So, check-in went fine and the valet parking was great. $35 + tax per day with in/out priviliges. The hotel is decorated well and is very clean. The hallways are very wide and, overall, the 'feel' is very appealing. Once we found our room (4th floor overlooking the wharf) I was a bit disappointed. The mini-suite means that there is a fold-out couch sitting in the window area and an area is setup with sink, mini-fridge, microwave. I do admit that the kitchenette area was good to have, but the room itself was not much larger than a normal room. I was expecting a bit more I guess - oh well. Once we unpacked I noticed that the walls were VERY thin. I could hear the TV from the room next to us, water running from what seemed to be every bathroom, and the noise from people in the hall was overwhelming. This was a huge turn-off for us. I realize that you get noise when you are in a hotel but this was a bit extreme. The next morning we went down for the Continental Breakfast. This is definitely nice to have, although the quality of the food was not that great. You cannot expect too much for a Continental Breakfast so take these comments as just that, comments. Check-out went smoothly, we were able to extend our check-out until 2pm, which was good as we were tired and didn't need to leave for the airport until 2:00. All-in-all, this is a Holiday Inn - which seems, to me, to have gone downhill in recent years. You can get rooms at very similar prices at almost any hotel on the wharf if you look around.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!!”
Reviews.Author: quiltlover
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff at the reception desk was friendly and helpful. We got maps and informations about SF when we checked in. No problem with our luggage to store as we were there before check-in-time (3 p.m.). Our room was nice and clean and size was o.k.,too. We did not have a view but who needs a view in SF when in town all day long... Wi-Fi was free. We liked the free beakfast. Plenty to choose from. The location was just perfect: minutes from Fishermans Wharf, close to cable car stop, a Trader Joes was around the corner (we loved it!) plenty of restaurants and shopping possibilities. There is a pool at the HI next door which can be used from guests of the HI express, too. We were glad the we stayed st the Wharf. Yes, it is a tourist area, but aren´t we tourists?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmberNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express for 3 nights and was very impressed. The room was a good size and was very clean and tidy. Excellent breakfast - my boys loved the doughnuts & pastries on offer. Excellent location and only a short walk to Fishermans Wharf and Pier 39. Great area for kids and felt safe walking around at night. We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco and would have liked to have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: FunInTheSunTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotels offered by my travel agent were booked full. I found this hotel on tripadvisor.com and had my agent book it after I read the reviews. My wife and I spent only two days in SF and were pleased to find the reviews to be right on. Hotel is in the Fisherman's Wharf close to Cable Trolleys, Pier 39, shopping, bars, dining, city wide transportation, and site seeing. We had a great time and were able to do everything on our list.

Reviews.Title: “just ideal”
Reviews.Author: LincsHobnob
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for just 2 nights but would have been happy to spend a week.If this hotel was in London it would getat least 4 stars.The rooms are absolutely spotless,bathrooms are large with really great showers and loads of lovely fluffy towels.The complimentary breakfasts are fine,excellent doughnuts of real american proportions! Staff were very helpful,I had a problem getting hold of our car hire firm so the receptionist did it for me with a smile. The hotel is an easy walk to Fishermans Wharf and to the tour bus stop.This hotel is ideal as an introduction to both San Francisco and to America,no standing on ceremony,relaxed and above all courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good tourist location”
Reviews.Author: doconner
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire because it was the best deal we could get for our trip. The location is great for first time tourists to SF because it is close to Fisherman's Wharf, a Trolley Car, and a short walk up Columbus to 'Little Italy' and Chinatown. Lombard Street and Coit Tower are also within walking distance. The hotel itself is clean and the beds were comfortable. They were not able to offer us rooms with 2 beds, so gave us rooms with King beds and offered up a roll-away bed for free. The Free breakfast included a few cereals, toast, donuts, fruits, cinnamon rolls and muffins. Coffee, juice, and milk were also available. Free internet access in the lobby Easy, although long, trip from the airport: - Take the BART ($5.15 - 30 minute ride) from airport to Embarcadero/Market Street - Go to street level and catch the Muni #10 ($1.50 - 10 minutes) bus towards Vanness/North Point. - Exit at North St & Jones St

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Room”
Reviews.Author: NatDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights as part of my California coast trip. Hotel itself is nice, rooms big and comfortable. Continental breakfast served from 6.30 to 9.30 its a cold buffet with tea.coffee, juices and cereal toast , pastries etc... i thought it was good. The location is in fisherman wharf which is the touristy spot, it was very handy for us as we went to see Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge. Plus you can go downtown in 10 minutes. I really liked it but i think i d rather go into downtown next time i visit for a better choice of bars and restaurants. But apart from the location i really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Central to eveyrthing”
Reviews.Author: SandSMc
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, quick check in. We had the building around the corner, but not too much of a trek. Room big, good air conditioning. Beds big and very comfortable with a pillow system, you get a choice of 4 different types of pillows, just pick the one you like. Good to have coffee and tea facilities but did not supply enough as we brits like our tea, did not use their cafe, but found a couple of great breakfast places just up the road towards the cable terminal, they do every breakfast you can imagine, service was friendly and very reasonable, could sit outside, enjoy the early morning sunshine and enjoy a leisurely breakfast. Great view of the bridge from the cable terminal, everything close by, loads of shops and the Piers. The bus tours are within a block and are very informative and interesting. Had a great stay, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiinEssex
Reviews.Content: Overall, very good and we would stay again. Good points - rooms, cleaning, continental breakfasts, location, swimming pool (in Holiday Inn next door) and reception. Poor points - lifts (slow) and coffee facilities in room. Why a coffee percolator and in the en suite?! Only enough coffee/milk/sugar for one maybe 2 cups. Overcome by 'borrowing' tea bags, milk and sugar from breakfast. Why not get the coffee in rooms right? No homeless seen in area. Excellent location for Fishermans and transport to other parts of city. Overall, very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: million196
Reviews.Content: I love the location for this hotel in San Francisco. You do not need to rent a car because you have all the transportation around you needed at all times of the day and night. We also took numerous tours which picked us up in front of the hotel. If you decide to rent a car the rate per night at the hotel w/tax is approx. $42.00. The Holiday Inn Express is very clean and unusually large and soundproof. The beds should be upgraded because they have seen many years of abuse. We used our points and did not have to pay anything and were put in a mini suite which included a fridge and microwave. The view was of the Wharf from our room but being we were on the run the entire week it was a pleasure to come back and leave from that location. The breakfast could be better and maybe more of it being you have a lot of people from other countries who took advantage of filling bags for dessert - I blame this on all of San Francisco who charge ridiculous prices for all food especially breakfast. I was told Denny's around the corner charged for 3 people an average of $72.00. New York is much cheaper than this City. Also, the homeless are out of control every place you walk in the best of areas they are begging, trying to touch you and sleeping in the streets. In fact they are out of control and make it very uncomfortable because no police and very little security around. They are even outside of the hotels but I felt fine because I had my husband and 15 year old son with me. If I was alone it would not be enjoyable. When you stand on the line for the Trolley Cars they are grabbing on to you and begging. Every park, every landmark, every place there are tons and tons of them even sleeping on the Trolly's before they roll out in the AM. I was interested in taking one of the Trolley's and stepped on the bus because I thought one of them worked for the transit and almost got cornered by 4 of them until my husband came behind me. This City is NOT SAFE for single women. I think they need to stop protecting them and clean up San Francisco because it is a beautiful place to visit. Everyone we met felt the same way in fact one women from England went to the baseball Giant Game the same night we attended and 3 of these homeless men sat next to them and every time they moved the homeless followed them until one fell and split open his chin and was bleeding but refused help and paramedics left the scene. I called them bums and almost got my head chopped off by many of the tour guides that we took trips with. One place we stopped to take a picture I walked with my son ahead of my husband and he felt someone right behind him when he picked up the bag that we were carrying and thought it was me but instead had a homeless right in his face. If people would stop visiting they would have no choice but to do something about it.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job nicely!”
Reviews.Author: sheamy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a two day stay in San Fran and have to say it was perfect for what we were after, Close to Fisherman's wharf & Pier 39, the vintage tram (a must!) which takes you to the shopping haven that is union square, and also close to the alcatraz ferry (one of the highlights of our 2 week stay in the US!). The hotel itself was well presented & felt modern. Apart from the poor view from our room, I was pleased with it overall, the free wireless was a bonus and the complementary continental breakfast hit the spot. All in all I would definitley recommend this hotel for a short stay in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location,nice,clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyme1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 2nd trip in as many years to wonderful,diverse San Francisco. Can not wait to plan another trip to my favorite city in the country! Stayed at Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf.We like staying in the wharf area so chose this hotel . The hotel is located close to anything you need. Stores, shops,food, the wharf, Ghiradelli, the Cannery. great area. The hotel was very clean. plenty of room to move around in our room, and very helpful friendly staff. We had requested a refridge in the room (daughter's dietary needs). When we got checked in and arrived in the room there wasn't a fridge. Called the front desk and within minutes one was delivered to the room. Have only positive comments concerning the staff and front desk.Back to the room, the beds were comfortable, everything looked fairly new and nice bath products left every day.The maid service was good. Funny thing not once~never ,saw a maid, maids cart or any sign of them our entire stay. Rooms had always been cleaned by the time we returned from our days excursions.The only negative I can think of is there was absolutlely no view from our room. It was an "inner" quiet room as we requested, but our only view wasa wall of other rooms. Maybe if we stayed on the highest floor (4 I think) may have had a view. The street side rooms may have a view, but they are very noisy with traffic. Wasn't a huge deal as we use the room only for cleaning up and sleeping. Just compared to a different hotel we stayed previous vacation. Watched Alcatraz, the water every morning with my coffee..So, probably unfair to compare. The free cont. breakfast was adequate.If you want fresh, cooked to order breakfast, there are several places within steps of the hotel.I feel if it's free nobody has a right to complain.All in all I feel for the price this was the best deal we could have found. Have no complaints about the hotel itself or the staff. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow....made our trip special.....”
Reviews.Author: Donna1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The staff including Brandy who checked us in the hotel, made sure everything was correct and special. We had a great view of the ocean..alcatraz and even the top of the golden gate bridge. Our room was extremely neat and clean each and everyday. The bed made, carpet cleaned, bathroom sparkling. The breakfast was a wonderful way to start the day of sight seeing. It was always busy and always well stocked. Internet access throught their computers was fast and we were even able to print directions. Checking out was a breeze. We stayed nine nights and we can't wait to stay again!!!! Bob and Donna...Tn fans in the land of the golden hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Parklandmom
Reviews.Content: Loved - Location and cleaniness of room. Free breakfast. Improvement needed - Closet door was broken. Shower wall was cracked and "fixed" with tape. Was not able to check in until 1 1/2 hours AFTER check in time. Room was not ready.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For A Short Stay - Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: LONGHURSTFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express with Virgin Holidays. It was only a three night stay so for this reason the hotel was fine. The room was large and the beds confortable. We stayed in one room with our 2 children and had ample space. It is in a fantastic location for getting around San Francisco. The bed linen was clean and a maid service was supplied every day. We did not have the included continental breakfast as we chose to eat at the Denny's around the corner. We had a lot of help from the desk staff who advised us about how to get around and the best plass to visit and how to get there. Just a suggestion you must visit Alcatras and book tickets at home as it is normally fully booked when you go to buy tickets on the dock on the day.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay..”
Reviews.Author: Lovestravelling31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for 4 nights this February. On arrival we were put in a smoking room to which I complained as neither me, my husband or my 6yr old smoked. Virgin apparently just allocated smoking rooms to families beware of this. Anyway was given another room straight away. Room was nice. Nothing to get excited about. The location of this hotel is brilliant though. We ate breakfast in the hotel lobby and also across the road at the Denny's located in the adjacent building. Both were OK. On check out there was a problem with a parking charge, which we were told by Virign when booking would be free. The hotel apparently didn't know anything about this. Let us off though in the end. I would recommend this hotel, we had a nice stay. San Francisco is BRILLIANT....

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Dennys”
Reviews.Author: Bamull
Reviews.Content: Stayed in H. Inn this july, hotel in good location, decent size rooms etc. We were in the second building across the street where there is a 'Dennys' situated Stay away from 'Dennys' as it is daylight robbery. ...Basic breakfast for 2 adults+1 child consisting of coffee, toast, ceral, fruit etc approx $45-50. Much better to try the 'Latte Express' deli across the road on Beach street. Great selection of cereals, juices, sandwiches, excellent coffee etc to stay or go to suit families either on a budget or those that don't like getting ripped off. Go through the sliding doors beside the concierge desk onto the street and latte express is across the road on your right hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EasyNote
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in November 2006 and had a really nice stay. The hotel is in a great location in which to explore Fishermans Wharf and is a few minutes walk to the main attractions. The rooms are ample and reasonably furnished. The staff are ok , although the breakfast bar can get crowded and is a little messy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy near Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: TVTravel
Reviews.Content: I have clients with offices near Fisherman's Wharf and must check up on them several times each year. After trying all the alternatives, I've settled on the Holiday Inn Express as the best place to stay in the area. The room cost is reasonable. The rooms are clean and set up for a business traveller (free high-speed internet, and a decent desk). I've only stayed in a room with a street view once, with all other rooms facing interior courtyards. The good news is that these rooms are quiet, while the street view rooms have heavy traffic noice. The bad news is that there is no view in a city famous for great views. Holiday Inn Express offers the same breakfast at every property I've stayed at. It gets the job done, but don't expect anything fancy. Coffee, cold cereal, toaster waffles/english muffins, cinamon rolls, and an orange colored liquid that claims to be juice. If you are driving a car, be prepared to pay a $40 daily charge to park it at the hotel. High priced parking is pretty standard at all San Francisco hotels, but can be a shocker if you aren't prepared for it. Want a restaurant recommendation? Try Pompei's Grotto. It's about 2 blocks away, just West of the zooey part of Fisherman's Wharf. Good seafood at a reasonable price. If you are searching for a fantastic mega-meal with a view, McCormick & Kuleto's in Ghiradelli Square is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pick room off of the street”
Reviews.Author: tumblewind
Reviews.Content: We picked this for its convenient location. The first night was hell for me, a light sleeper. It was on the first floor, 10 feet from a trolley line and busy street. The night lobby manager was awful. I went to get a quieter room at 6 am after a sleepless night and he refused to make a change for our next two booked nights. He said I'd have to wait until 11 when rooms had been checked out of. At 8 am the day reservations clerk, a young woman named Ady came on duty. SHE immediately changed our room to a quiet inner one. It was an unused handicap room we could get into immediately. If we wanted to wait, she even offered to later put us into a suite. We took the first room because we had to get to Berkeley by 9 am and it worked out great. Why can't a chain like Holiday Inn train all its staff to be kind and accommodating like Ady? The first guy makes me want to never book a Holiday Inn again. The hotel was in a great location to get around to all the sites, though the streets were extremely crowded during summer vacation. We didn't take the cable car nearby because of huge lines. The free breakfast was adequate - all cold foods but lots of fruits, breads, pastries & cereals, hard boiled eggs and beverages. The lobby and rooms are clean and modern. You have no fridge, microwave or exercise room (3 treadmills was it), but for sleeping and central location for touristing, it was fine (if you get an inner room).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pmezz
Reviews.Content: We need a hotel to at when friends came to visit on 7/7/07. Our friends were staying at the Holiday Inn Fisherman's Wharf. We managed to get a reservation at Holiday Inn Express. Cost per night $200 was pricey for us. But from the time we arrived, we were treated very well. The hotel looked like it had recently been renovated from the lobby, floor hallway and the room it self. The updated furnishings were well done. The free continental breakfast was okay but very limited. BUT WHAT WAS OUTRAGEOUS to us was paying $30 a night in HOTEL TAX. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mickeym1
Reviews.Content: Great location, quiet and only minutes walk to Fishermans Wharf. Excellent room, we shared with our 2 children and found the room to be a great size for a standard 2 x double room. Bathroom good size, modern, great shower, spotlessly clean. Continental breakfast very good and plenty on offer. Staff very helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheWanderingVFamily
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms. This was by far the best hotel we stayed in during our vacation to San Francisco. We would definately reccommend this place to friends and family. They accommodated us at every turn and we could not have been happier. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank You Holiday Inn Express at the Wharf you made our vacation a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate is all I can say”
Reviews.Author: DeeKajun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recommended by a coworker. The room is typical Holiday Inn, clean and safe. It is closeby to fisherman's wharf and to any public transportation you desire. The breakfast is cold. The milk was expired and sour but the staff pulled it out soon as I complained..only thing warm you can get is toast. I was somewhat disappointed that they didn't even have a microwave for the rolls and muffins. The coffee is good. There are breakfast places close by and a great bar across the street. You are close enough to go have coffee and fresh bread for coffee from the wharf. I did not see the homeless that previous post spoke of, at least not near the hotel. Once it started getting dark we did see it at the area parks. Beware you will pay $35 a day for parking. But is is underground and you have in and out privledges. I decided to take the hit just so my car was safe and had covered parking. All and all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Holiday Inn Express during our honeymoon in San Francisco. The rooms were clean and pleasant (and we could just see the Golden Gate Bridge!), housekeeping was superb - well above average, staff were pleasant and helpful. The location was excellent - great for the Wharf, bike tours of the bridge, and well located for tram and bus stops. Lots of restaurants round the Wharf area and lots to do - would be great for families. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back. Beds very large and comfortable, good choice of channels in rooms and free broadband which was a great bonus. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Johnro
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a Memorial Day Weekend getaway in San Francisco and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express at Fisherman's Wharf. The location is supberb for all there is to do at Fisherman's Wharf and easy access to transportation for other areas in San Francisco. The hotel offers your standard Holiday Express amenties and does a great job in doing so. One addition that would be nice would be an indoor pool not that I would have had any time with so much to do in San Francisco. Facility has a clean modern look to it. The rooms are nice size for a large city. The only drawback was the beds seemed to sit a little low for my preference. The staff here were just awesome. Everyone that I encountered was friendly and went out of their way to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: pebb876
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, comfy hotel. Just a few blocks from the wharf and the trolly. Vallet parking underground about $35 a day. Cont breakfast was more than expected with hard boiled eggs, cinnamon rolls, and pastry along with cereal and doughnuts. Room was comfortable and even had its own coffee maker. Interior room view was not the best, but we didn't stay for the view. Friendly and helpful staff. They were great with directions. I'd recommend for the budget watching folks who still want to stay within walking distance to the wharf. Overall, a great stay and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “VFM and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Elburtonsmiffy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent eight nights here in April, 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The hotel is very conveniently located for the many attractions of Fisherman's Wharf and only a five minute walk to the cable car terminus. The cable car (which is a San Fran "must") takes you right into the heart of the shopping area centred on Union Square. Indeed the cab fare to the Square was only $8 so for four people (we were joined by our daughter and son-in-law on day 3) this is the better deal. The hotel is all that you could wish for - spacious room, queen-size bed, cable TV, ironing board/iron, complimentary tea/coffee etc. Add to that the inclusive continental breakfast and you have a bargain. The hotel's warm cinnamon buns are to die for! Built-in ramps for those with wheelchairs etc figure in the lobbies on each upper floor and I cannot honestly think of any negatives. We would certainly stay here again if visiting San Fran once more. Do visit Alcatraz (but book in advance), Ghiradelli Square and Pier 39. We also enjoyed the open-top double decker bus tours and our tour in a World War II DUKW.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: cmwUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money and the staff are helpful. The only slight problem was a noisy party next door one night , but the desk staff attended to this when I complained and there was no further problem. The rooms are a reasonable size, I had a view of Coit Tower, and the location is excellent. The breakfast area gets a bit crowded at the weekend but that is a small price to pay. I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: ThePJs
Reviews.Content: Good tourist location, modern clean rooms and bathrooms. Very helpful reception staff. The valet parking is expensive..around $40 with tax, but very convenient - the car is parked in a garage under the hotel. If you want to save money on that, it is possible to park for less just a block or two away. The breakfast is acceptable as a "free" breakfast, but we chose to eat in the Hollywood Cafe next door for an inexpensive big American breakfast ! Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: helenf01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after an eventful journey from the airport via BART! Checkin was very quick & cheery & helpful although we did have to insist on 2 beds! Room was nice no real view but the beds were comfy & the pillows plump. Great location just 2 blocks from Fisherman sWharf. Breakfast was included & good but not always plentiful. it consisted of cereals, fruit, juice, coffee, croissants, donuts, bagels & toast. 9am was ok but dont expect everything! Staff were helpful with directions. The hotel was clean & fresh & very pleasant! Free internet access just off the lobby. Hotel is surroundedby other hotels & lots of souvenir shops. There is a 7-11 & a walgreens nearby (in different directions!) Had a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: Metwo3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I had a king room on the interior. Quiet, but I also turned on the fan to mask any hall noise. Noisy toilets, though. Room was nice size with an upholstered chair, small desk with comfortable work chair, internet access, good lighting, safe, small bathroom but lots of counter space. I used the lobby computer and printer for my boarding pass. Nice folks at front desk. Nothing exciting on breakfast bar and it did get busy, but typical for big city hotel. Luggage trolley available for your use-no bellman. I was attending a conference at the Hyatt and my AAA room rate was $35 less than the Hyatt conference rate and included more in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for family”
Reviews.Author: youngboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past week with our girls 8 and 10. It was perfect. Had a junior suite which included a kitchenette - fridge and microwave. Great for snacks. It was clean but the room was not large. We were comfortable. The breakfast was tippical but perfect with one girl up at 6:30 and starving and the other up at 8. Close to everything. Would recommend it for a convenient/safe/clean place to stay. Nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GA1Travels
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Spring Break Week, April 3 - 8, 2007. I booked a mini-suite and was notified of a free upgrade to a full suite upon check-in! Prior to arrival, the hotel booked a city tour and a Muir Woods/Sausalito tour for me and my daughter. The hotel is very clean. The continental breakfast was a benefit - saved money. I am a healthy eater and I found, the fruit (bananas, organges, and apples), boiled eggs, fat free milk, wheat toast, and raisin bran & tea sufficient for me. Plenty of muffins, crousaints, and danishes, etc. are also available. A full hot breakfast is available across the street at "Knuckles" at the Hyatt or try the mom and pop shops adjacent to the H.I. Express and eat inside or on the curb! No restaurant is at the hotel, but a sports bar, Knuckles, is across the street. Want something late nite like I did? Denny' s open 24hrs is a 3-5 minute walk from the H.I. Express. Very short walk to Fishermans Wharf! Would stay there again. The hotel is on the same street as other Major hotels. I would easily choose the Hotel again. I am a business man that has been travelling a lot since 1985.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robjoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights 20-25th March and the location is superb.Hotel check in was very good and the room,although a little"tired" was ready on our arrival and clean.It had all the usual facillities and was nice and quiet.The breakfast is more than adequate,with a good selection,(but the toasters could do with replacing).Fishermans Wharf is very good,and we would HIGHLY recommend trying the clam chouder which is served up in a bread bowl,its just gorgeous.Alcatraz is still well worth a visit but book early in the day to get a place on the boat across.We had a lovely walk over the Golden Gate bridge(get a taxi there though) and we carried on walking right round to Sausalito which dosnt take very long and then have a coffee overlooking the bay its really nice.Take a tram car for the experience,plus the streets are very very hilly,and take a walk down Lombard Street,then keep going to Coit Tower.This is a lovely city with plenty to see and do,and dont miss Chinatown.Once again there are a lot of street performers and homeless people begging and sleeping in the streets but they dont cause you any trouble.Go to San Francisco and enjoy,its wonderful,and stay at this hotel too,its adequate.

Reviews.Title: “could not fault it”
Reviews.Author: rickrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the above hotel 2 adults 3 children. I must say we had a great 3 days the hotel was better than we expected very clean, our room was spacious on ground floor, it seemed like a new hotel. Very close to all the tourist things. Breakfast was great and staff very helpful, we just couldnt fault the hotel. We will definately recommend this hotel to friends. rickrock

Reviews.Title: “Second time as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: Daisiegee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI Express in September last year for 5 nights and were as pleased with it this time as last. Excellent free breakfast which is served just off reception and it can get very busy here , but the place is quickly tidied and you wouldn't know that there had been hundreds of people eating there. We had a large disabled access room which was immaculate and very roomy. Large bathroom well stocked with towels and toiletries. Front desk staff were the same as 2 years ago, which I liked. I'd definitely stay here again as I actually like being near the Wharf but close to transport. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Titchvic
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's in easy walking distance to Fishermans Wharf which is where most of the touristy stuff goes on. We did venture into downtown SF, but felt a lot more threatened there than at fishermans Wharf. The hotel itself is quite bland, but clean and comfortable. If you are not planning on spending a lot of time on your room then this is fine. But whilst we were there it poured with rain most of the time, and we found the room quite small when we were trying to dry out our soggy clothes. In this hotel we also got a complimentary breakfast which was a good variety, and a good start to the day. We dont like to get up too early when on holiday so the fact that the breakfast was available until 9.30 was a plus for us! I knew SF was hilly, but they still surprised me - and thank god for the cable cars and trams!! We had a great time here, but mainly becauise we were out and about rather than because the hotel was great. The hotel is basic and functional - clean and the breakfast was good, and a convenient location, but otherwise I dont think we would stay here again. Mainly because we like to stay in different places each time, but also because the room was smaller than we had hoped, and that it just seemed very bland.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Ideal”
Reviews.Author: reenie13
Reviews.Content: I travel the world as an Flight Attendent and always stay at 5 star hotels so when i went on vacation i stayed at the Holiday Inn Express, Fishermans Wharf. It is situated in a fantastic location, near to all the piers and all transport to different parts of the city. The room was very clean and daily cleaned to a high standard. reception staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble, especially funny was Brandy. The fitness centre was adequate for its purpose and the free internet was a bonus. Free complimentary was nice but you have to be early but then again who wants to eat every morning when there is so much choice in the big city. Overall i thought the hotel and amenities in and close to the hotel was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “If the beds were any harder you would be camping”
Reviews.Author: travels_frequently
Reviews.Content: With improvements this hotel has the potential to be great, without them though we would rate it as average. Firstly, this hotel has extremely hard beds even with the extra mattress pad that they provide. If there is one thing you do in San Francisco is a lot of walking and a good nights comfortable sleep is an important factor. When we crawled into bed the first night we noticed how hard the mattress was. I was trying to get comfortable and my arm rubbed over the blanket. To my dismay I felt crusty areas on the blanket as it rubbed against my arm. Without getting into specifics you can guess why the blanket had crusty stains on it and was not clean, it even had a few dirt marks on it too. We stripped the blanket off the bed and we saw that there was a spare blanket in the closet, so we used that one instead. The next day, we reported the dirty blanket to the front desk, along with our TV having a continous buzzing noise too. The gal at the front desk said she would have to talk to the manager about the situation. When I spoke to the manager, she said she told the maid to check the sheets and they were clean. I told her it was not the sheets, but the blanket. She had an odd reaction (sort of like disbelief) she said, "this has never happened here before." To which I replied, "we travel all over the world and believe me this has never happened to us either." The manager also mentioned that the blankets are not washed on the same wash cycle as the sheets. She said, she would investigate the blanket problem and adjust our room rate for that night. Which ended up being a few dollars off the nightly room rate. We were moved to another room. The new room was clean, there was no problem with the bedding. We asked for an extra mattress pad to be put on the bed, this made the bed more comfortable to sleep on. Had it not been for the two mattress pads on the bed, we would have found the bed too hard and uncomfortable to sleep on and would have checked out, to find another hotel with a more comfortable bed. The coffee maker in the room is on the bathroom counter right beside a high powered flushing toilet. This is not sanitary considering the splashes from the toilet so close by. We washed the coffee maker out with hot water and soap and moved it to the desk by the TV. I'm not sure why they are not placed there in the first place, as there is plenty of room on the desk beside the TV. The coffee supplied in your room is very weak. I think the coffee supplied is for 2 cups, not for 4 cups. If your making a full pot use both packages of coffee, then it will taste a lot better. The maid service was very efficient, although they start at 8:30am, so if you want to sleep in you should put the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Rush hour starts at 6:00am, so if you are a light sleeper and wake up to traffic, bus and cable car noise, ask for a room facing the courtyard. It has no view, but these rooms are quieter than the street side. There are two computers in the lobby that offer free internet, but a lot of times they are busy in the mornings. We found that the computers had better availability in the afternoons and evenings. The complementary continental breakfast is served from 6:30am to 9:30am. This consists of cold boiled eggs, bran muffins, chocolate muffins, apple muffins, croissants, white & brown bread, english muffins (toasters are available for toasting bread) butter and jam. Plain donuts, chocolate donuts, cinnamon buns, raisin bran cereal, cornflakes cereal, fruit loops cereal, (skim, 2%, homo milk) orange, apple, cranberry juice, coffee, tea, plus fresh fruit - apples, bananas & oranges. The breakfast lull is about around 7:30am to about 8:15am. It is much busier earlier and later. The hotel is conveniently located walking distance to Pier 39. Cable cars, street cars, bus stops are close by. The cab ride from the airport to the hotel costs about $42.00. The parking rate at the hotel is $35.00 per day. We decided to forego the rental car and parking fee. We did not regret this decision as the bus service is very efficient, we only waited 5 minutes for a bus on any given day including Sunday. 15 minutes at the most for a cable car or street car. At the end of the cable car stations in a booth you can purchase a one day Municipal Transit pass (Muni) good for all buses, cable cars and street cars for $11.00. A three day pass costs $18.00 and a 7 day pass costs $24.00. The passes are excellent value, as a one way cable car ride costs $5.00 and you can not hop on and off either. $5.00 for each ride period. There are two supermarkets located close to the hotel. Safeway and Trader Joe's. We found Trader Joes brand sparkling fruit juices able to hold their fizz the next day, as there is no fridge in your hotel room. The plus they taste good too. Walgreens and Cost Plus World market are near by also, but have a more limited food selections. Other retail shops/malls open @ 10:00am. We found that souveniers are cheaper closer to the hotel and China Town then at Pier 39. Ghiradelli square is under renovations until Spring 2007 and Fall 2007 so only about 1/4 of the shops are open there. The second last night of our trip, teenagers were partying with a loud boombox next door @ 2:00am. Security reacted swiftly and put an end to the loud party immediately.

Reviews.Title: “worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: sarahWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: We spent two week in California, touring, staying in 5 different hotels, and this one was one of the cheaper ones, but just as nice. The rooms were clean and large enough for a family of 4, we had the option of free breakfast each morning with coffee and oj it was basic but nice. the hotel is close to lots of main attractions - our son is in a wheelchair and we had no problems getting around. The only down side was having to pay $20.00 per day to park the car, and should you want food or a beer you have have to go to the hotel next door - a bit of a pain, but there are lots of places to eat near by, the sports bar across the road served food and it was great. THIS HOTEL IS GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY AND IS WELL WORTH A VISIT, we would go back. GIVE IT A GO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JEFNOLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. Good continental breakfast, friendly staff and clean rooms. I would recommend this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: Jen1985
Reviews.Content: We did not stay here but did a sight inspection as part of work (I am a travel agent). This Holiday Inn is located opposite Fisherman’s Wharf and was built in 2001. Lobby and rooms feature very modern décor and furnishing. Rooms are of a medium/large and have Nintendo’s for children’s entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “great location nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: wideboy_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in oct 2006 and found it great! the location was in walking distance to many attractions including pier 39, alcatraz and fishermans wharf (great in the summer). rooms where very clean and spacious, with two double beds and en suite with bath and shower. Although main reception was across the road at holiday inn we found no problems at all. staff were very helpful and friendly giving us free internet access(un heard of in new york) the wendy's restuarant on site is open 24hrs and gives great value for money. Breakfasts especially! For the money this place is fantastic located in the best part of san fran!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eliza316
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Express in mid September '06 as a last minute change from a Union Square hotel, and I'm certainly glad I changed hotels. The Holiday Inn Express is in a perfect location for easy access to all the very "touristy" haunts of Fisherman's Wharf and beyond. Literally a block away there is a metro car stop that goes all the way back down to Union Square for a very reasonable fare. Slightly further away is the most famous cable car line in the city, and being so close allows an early jump start on the queues. I felt the neighbourhood was very safe, even the less populated areas, for example I walked back from Coit Tower in the late evening and never once felt nervous. The hotel itself is very good. As I said I relocated at the last minute and the staff were very helpful, both at check in and at check out. The room was very clean and well appointed. I did not partake of the continental breakfast, but found the free computers with internet access in the lobby very useful. Overall I would strongly reccommend this hotel as a great base to explore one of the best cities I have ever visited.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: kmc1
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel sept 06. The staff were pleasant and very helpful and the rooms were clean and spacious. Continental breakfast was adequate, however it is a very short walk to other restaurants that provide a large choice of cooked breakfasts if you prefer. The hotel is conveniently located on Fishermans wharf, just a 5 minute walk to pier 39. Public transport stops are also a few minutes walk away. If I return to San Fran I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst breakfast we encountered”
Reviews.Author: Aussieflyer
Reviews.Content: After five weeks on the east coast of USA,we had stayed in many Holiday Inns, Hampton Inns, Embasssy Inns etc. Without doubt this hotel had the worst buffet breakfast. Even allowing for the disgraceful use of disposable cutlery, crockery etc that we encountered everywhere in the USA, I cannot believe that so many reviews accept chocolate iced donuts, cardboard muffins, fruitloops, the sweetest orange juice ever , white bread for toast , overripe bananas, and flowery apples as a "great breakfast". Travel to Australia, Italy and New Zealand and find out what a good breakfast means! Avoid the breakfast and go just a block away on the corner of Taylor and Lombardo to a really great, cheap cafe for smoked salmon bagels,really good coffee etc, so good for around $10 a head that it covered lunch as well.

Reviews.Title: “actually preferred sister hotel!”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: Last year we went to the Holiday Inn next door to the Express. Read a lot of bad reviews after we'd booked it through Virgin Holidays but we actually found the hotel very pleasant especially the rooms on the fifth floor. After reading the much better reviews for the Express we decided to book it for this year's visit. The bedroom wasn't nearly as nice, nor the bathroom. There wasn't even a bar for a drink in the evening. However, the breakfast was superb! Very casual, as much as you wanted, soon replaced pastries and fruit if they ran low, all excellent. Didn't have to pay car park charges at the first hotel but the Express valet charges were exorbitent. Free Internet access was handy though it was very slow. All in all, if we return to San Francisco, I think the first hotel would get our custom as there are good cafes nearby to buy a breakfast. I'm sure there are better hotels than these two but for location they are ideal.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco - Perfect for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HSE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for our Honeymoon in October 2006. Firstly, the weather was fantastic, warm days with bright blue skys. We were told when we were in SF that this was the best time to visit. We arrived from Las Vegas so at first were slightly disappointed (we had a suite in the Luxor and had been spoilt) but the hotel was perfect for what we wanted. The hotel boasts a central location, I would say Fishermans Wharf is the 'tourist' area with plenty of souvenir shops etc, also a lot of seafood restaurants to choose from as well as the usual, Rain Forest Cafe, McDonalds etc..... Check in was smooth, we were allocated a room on the front but the AC did not work so we asked to move and were placed at the back which was much better, no noise at all. Once settled in we were extremely pleased. Guests at the hotel can use the outdoor pool at the neighbouring Holiday Inn for free. We never got the chance! The breakfast was excellent, plenty of cereal, toast, muffins, doughnuts, fruit, tea, coffee, juice, all very fresh and plenty of it and this was available 6.30-9.30. The later you went down however the busier it was but still plenty of seats. The area is great for catching the cable car/bus and I would highly recommend this hotel. All hotels seemed the same standard in the area, there were the more exclusive hotels in the City Centre (Hilton, Mark Hopkins, Francis Drake, Marriott etc) but for what we needed it was perfect. San Francisco is a fab city and Alcatraz is a must but be sure to book in advance. We also found the all day cable car pass $11 each to be very worth while. Shopping is a must here and you can pick up some fantastic bargains, whatever you are into!! - the only disappointing thing was the GG park did not seem to be too accesible, and we were curious as to how as this seems to be quite a large area to visit, we hired some bikes and cycled to the GG bridge, very good value for money and lock and helmet supplied which meant you could have lunch, or have a look round the souvenir shops. Altogether, a fantastic package and we would not hesitate to choose SF for a destination in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: kazz_usher
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel, mid September 2006! It was better than I expected! Check in - Was smooth and the staff were very friendly. I was checked in and in my room in 10mins! Rooms - Very clean! I dont think any of the rooms have fantastic views, I was over looking the road and If I listened really carefully you could hear the boats using there fog horns in the morning. Room was large. The fan in the bathroom was a bit noisy, but it turned off straight after you turned the light off. Comfy bed and lots of extra pillows! Location - Perfect, was a very short stroll to the heart of Fishermans Wharf, and although tacky, I did enjoy it and all tourists have to go! I didnt feel unsafe around the hotel and the neighbourhood seemed fine to me. The hotel is really close to two cable car turnarounds, which is really handy! Comp breakfast was perfect! TIP- Wake up early because once everything gone, its gone. Also the toasters take forever so be prepared to stand around for a long time. Staff- Very friendly, although on two occassions they did send us on a wild goose chase, so dont trust them when they tell you what directions to take...get a good map! I would definetly reccommend this hotel to anyone, it was clean, modern and safe! 4/5!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Grubby Neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: AJO_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was a standard Holiday Inn Express with adequate, clean rooms and a good complimentary buffet breakfast. Hotel Foyer was pleasant. Points for concern: - Parking is valet only and $32 + tax per night which is a rip off - Staff had a take it or leave it attitude - Fishermans Wharf is a tacky blemish on the face of a beatiful city - I would never stay there again - Hotel is in a noisy location My recommendation is that you stay at another hotel out of the area

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: jennybh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 9/15-9/18/06. It was the perfect location from which to see the sights. We spent about 1/2 hour on Pier 39, saw the sea lions, then used the F line streetcar, the many bus lines plus our feet to explore many of San Francisco's neighborhoods. The hotel itself was very clean, the staff friendly and efficient. Breakfast was fine, the usual for Holiday Inn Express. It is most definitely a budget hotel...plastic cups in the rooms, overall basic feeling to the decor and furnishings. There was some noise from the halls. We had an end room on the courtyard which seemed to minimize that. If you are used to 4 or 5 star accomodations, you will not like this hotel. That said, I think they do a great job of providing a comfortable, clean, safe and friendly hotel that leaves you with cash to spend on other things while in San Francisco. We were happy to do without a car. Get a MUNI map from the front desk to help you decode the transportation system. There is a great website called San Francisco 511 where you can plug in your origin and destination and time of departure, and it will give you the buses/trollies/streetcars you need to take and exactly where the stops are and how often they run. Lorrie's airport bus is 14.00 pp to SFO airport and the front desk will book it for you ahead of time. Or you can take the F line streetcar to the BART station to the airport for 5.50. A word on the area. We never felt unsafe here, even at night. We walked to and from Houston's, an excellent restaurant at the corner of Montgomery and Embarcadero, and were not bothered at all by anyone. People are walking all over the place; this is a VERY touristy part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel/Clean but Wharf/Sketchy”
Reviews.Author: BTC1
Reviews.Content: First trip to San Fran. The hotel was very convenient in that we could walk to many of our spots. The hotel room was tiny but very clean. The front desk staff was extremely nice and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast was substantial but get an early start to beat the big crowd, The only negative was the Wharf at night. Walking back from any of the restaurants in the area at night is pretty sketchy. I am not sure I would stay in that general area again but not because of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Nice Motel, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: dood636
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Walking distance from most of the nearby attractions. Very loud street noise. Friendly hotel management and staff, nice and well-kept property. Valet parking service was expensive (maybe $36/day), but it was always nice to have a parking space waiting whenever we returned to the hotel. Rates were reasonable, complimentary breakfast buffet was mediocre and crowded. Decent hotel, but too noisy for my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, Fisherman's Wharf is not so great”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, my family came for a short visit to San Francisco while spending the majority of our vacation time in beautiful Lake Tahoe. Having not visited the Fisherman's Wharf area for many years, the primary shock was finding the dirty, cheesy state of the wharf. Homeless folks and other unique characters along the streets caused us, my young daughter in particular, to be uncomfortable. But within that disappointing aspect of the neighborhood, we found the Holiday Inn Express a wonderful place to come home to. The hotel seemed quite new and sort of boutique-like in its decor. Rooms and public areas were quite clean and the complimentary continental breakfast was much above average for "budget-style" accomodations. Staff was friendly and always helpful. The rooms were smallish, and probably not large enough for 4 people, and our room was probably one of many without any view whatsoever. Thankfully we chose this hotel for easy access to the cable cars and other things on our "to do" list. Valet parking was $32.00 per day (before taxes). I felt our car was fairly secure in that lot, however the hotel elevator takes anyone down to the parking area unsupervised. For our personal tastes, we will likely try a downtown hotel next time we come to San Francisco, not because of the hotel but because of our personal discomfort in the wharf atmosphere. Finding a good rate may be difficult, but location is important to us.

Reviews.Title: “holiday inn express fishermans wharf”
Reviews.Author: julieturner
Reviews.Content: this hotel was as well presented as a 4 star friendly staff. The rooms are just perfect and well kept. Even though we were on a main road we hardly heard any noise or even from other rooms. the breakfast was really good although just the usual toast croissants fresh fruit coffees teas cereals but plentiful. Fully reccommend this hotel. The holiday inn is just a few minutes walk away where there is a Dennys but is in such a good spot for all food outlets and the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodging”
Reviews.Author: sheltercove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on a short side trip we took to San Franciso while we were staying at Lake Tahoe. (Good Points) The hotel is located right near the wharf area which would be a plus for most people. It is only a short walk to the cable cars and trolley. The hotel is new and shows no wear and tear yet. The breakfast is the typical Holiday Inn Select breakfast which I believe to be one of the best around. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. They put out fruit on the counter in the afternoon. (Needing improvement or that which you may want to be forewarned of) We needed two rooms. The one my son and his friend stayed in was a typical two bed room of adequate size. The one my wife and I stayed in was really small (477 I think). It reminded me of some of the smallish european rooms we have stayed in. It was adequate, but should not have been priced as high as the others. Parking your car here is 32 dollars a pop for one night. I consider that too high even for a large city. I believe you can park it cheaper at some of the local lots. Neither room had a fridge or a micro. As this is a new hotel I would have expected this to have been included. I do not think there is a pool for the kiddies, but I believe you can use the Holiday Inn pool a few doors down. Would I stay here again? Yes

Reviews.Title: “Happy with The Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Stuartbuxton
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed in the sister hotel above Denny's we found it to be of a good standard. The rooms were kept very clean and the coffee/tea facilities were generously replenished. The entrance through a badly lit car park could potentially be tricky & the management should be aware of this - increased lighting & more visible security at night would give more peace of mind. Some reviewers have questioned the quality of surrounding nearby restaurants, but Holiday Inns can hardly be held responsible for this. We would have no hesitation in staying here again. It was generally good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: H-Wilmes
Reviews.Content: We can only agree with the last couple of reviews. We booked this hotel based on its reviews in tripadvisor and its location. We really liked it: great location with good public transport connections for the rest of downtown, the rooms are modern and clean, beds are great, bathroom is excellent, breakfast is okay, staff is nice and helpfull. I do not for the life of me understand those people who complain about the location. Anyone who informs himself before going to SF knows that Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap. Big deal. If you don't want to walk the Pier or see the tourist shops, just head in the other direction. Or book a hotel in another part of town. We did not see any homeless people or beggars while we were there. We took the cable car in the evening to the restaurants in North Beach, came back late at night, no problem. This part of SF felt like our home neighbourhood, we did not feel unsafe or felt that we had to look over our shoulder. Definitely a good place to start your discovery of beautiful San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “agree with the july 21 and july 30 posts on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: FAMILY44444
Reviews.Content: the best holiday inn express eveeeeer! Not exactly great praise, but it sums up this hotel. All the national chains and two of the major independents -- Argonaut and the Tuscan Inn (even though its technically a Best Western) are all within a few blocks of each other -- its hotel heaven -- so location probably isn't as importtant as it usally is. Amenities count more. So, if you value a free wine reception at 5 and a complimentary Financial Times, the Argonaut is for you. We thought a mini suite at $150 was for us, so we stayed here, The name is a misnomer -- the "suite" is really a fair size room, but with a frige, sink, and microwave. The hotel is new, and there are nice touches. The lobby is designed well and attractively and is actually nicer than the Marriott. The breakfast buffet is at the high end of the cheap category; usual continental items plus hot danish, but no made to order pancakes like the redidence inns, for example. the back of the hotel backs up to the F line street car, and you can hear it, but just barely. if thats an issue maybe ask for a courtyard room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lofdol
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend in San Francisco and stayed one night at the Holiday Inn Express (this hotel does not allow pets, the writer below confused it with the Holiday Inn which is older and does allow them). This property is new and spotlessly clean. We paid extra for a suite and our view was amazing. From our room we could see Alcatraz and part of the Bay. You are walking distance from everything at the Wharf and it is great to be so close (even for bathroom breaks). The parking is $32 but we rode the ferry from Vallejo and parked our van for free there. It was a great trip and I highly recommend it. The hotel may not be the fanciest but you can't beat the location and the price is about the best at the Wharf. The staff at the front desk were very friendly . The breakfast bar was great with a decent variety of food and of course those awesome Holiday Inn Express Cinnamon Rolls!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Place to Experience SF at the right price”
Reviews.Author: CaptainEO7
Reviews.Content: I had looked into what hotel would best suit our needs in San Francisco for several months and decided on the Holiday Inn Express due to a combination of Location, Price, inclusion of buffet breakfast & age of the actual property. With all this in mind me and my girlfriend were satisfied with our stay, not jumping for joy but happy. The location is great for the Wharf. There are around a dozen large hotel-chain properties all situated within an area of a few blocks so whether you stay at the HI Express, Sheraton, Hyatt, etc etc you'll more or less be staying in the same area. The main drawback is that the location is two blocks back from the Wharf area and the immediate vicinity isn't exactly a pleasant one. Pier 39 is a great place for a stroll, grab a meal and browse the shops. The area around the Cannery, Ghiradelli Square & the Cable-Car turnaround is also nice. It's the few blocks in between these areas however that make the Wharf un-savoury. A concentration of very tacky souvenir stores and one-too-many colourful characters spoil the area although we still felt happy that we'd chose the Wharf as our base. We were originally planning a stay at the Westin on Union Square and whilst we saw that the hotel itself was very grand we weren't convinced that staying smack-bang in the centre of the city would have been a better option. Every one of the 4 days we spent in the city involved starting things off within ten minutes of our hotel - whether it be Alcatraz, a superb city tour or cycling over the GG Bridge. The major gripe we had with the area was how early everything closed on Pier 39. We expected to be able to browse the shops, etc after dinner each night but from 10pm onwards the whole area closes up and you're left with the choice of having a drink in one of the few restaurant bars or returning to your hotel. The hotel itself is very modern and spotlessly clean. Certainly no character and most of the rooms face into central courtyards but if it's a new hotel with good standards that you look for this hotel is ideal. The rooms weren't large but fine, especially for a city hotel and the shower, room temperature, furniture etc were all great, as was the buffet breakfast included in the price. All-in-all our 4 days in San Francisco were brilliant, taking in some memorable experiences. If you want a very clean, modern hotel and can get a good rate at the Holiday Inn Express I'd recommend staying here and using it as a base. NB - Some people mix up the adjacent Holiday Inn with the Express - the normal HI is a lot older and I'd definitely opt for the Express over it. We did like the look of the Sheraton however although all the hotels were similar in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: MHS8874
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days at the hotel. We selected it because it was dog friendly and reasonably priced for the area. The staff are inconsistent - some were great, others need to get another job. The facilities are older but good, but the beds are rock hard and the pillows about the same - after 5 days, needed a chiropractor. Its a good location for dogs because of the small park next door, but beware the homeless who sleep there. Most ignored us, but some were persistent until we walked off. Its a good jump off for the trolley and a great walk through the Fort, etc. But it is cold! We live at the top of a mountain in Colorado, but this is a piercing cold amplified by the wind and the fog. Plenty of restaurants, but all priced to take your last dollar.. do try Boudin's though - good combination of service, food, and cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,”
Reviews.Author: MillieAustralia
Reviews.Content: Agree with everything the last reviewer said. I thought we were the only family who thought that Fishermans Wharf was a tacky Blackpool. Every time we left the hotel we were harassed for money by very dodgy looking people! I would not walk back to this hotel in the dark! Beware San Francisco is also very cold and Foggy so bring a warm sweatshirt! Although generally dissappionted with what San Franciso had to offer this hotel is very good, the family room was comfortable and clean and the facilities great, although the staff were less than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Its all been said before but heres my bit...”
Reviews.Author: ALB498
Reviews.Content: Yep, have to agree with the majority of the reviews, this is a great hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a mid-priced stay in San Francisco. The rooms are clean, modern and good sized, with all the expected amenities. There is a great buffet breakfast included in the rate, where you can help yourselves to cereal, donuts, muffins, toast (English people beware of the american's evil sweetened bread, its manky) juice, coffee and warm cinnamon buns (mmm cakes for breakfast, who needs a fryup) Have to give it 4 and not 5 because it is let down by being too close to the hideous tacky tourist trap of fishermans wharf. It is convenient for all things touristy so I would have no problem staying here again, its close to cable cars, f-line, some useful bus routes and walking distance of most central places and felt safe at night, but just round the corner it gets so tacky. Its full of nasty souvenier shops (think Blackpool) overpriced, lousy restaurants (ok so didnt try them all but..) and scruffy buildings and parking lots. Not sure what the appeal is to any of those suckers filling the sidewalks, yuk! Still, dont let that put you off this hotel, just please dont spend too much time thinking fishermans wharf is all there is of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: hicksWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited from Winnipeg, Manitoba ,Canada, from May 5, 2006 until May 12,2006 and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Fisherman's Wharf. We had an unbelievable stay at this hotel. We could not be more pleased with the room (overlooking the wharf) or the hotel front desk staff. They were all "A 1" to us and could not be more helpful with anything we asked. Everything was within walking distance of attrations and restuarants. We will be returning to San Fran in the near future and would be requesting to stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For safety sake, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if you value your safety! We were constantly harassed in front of the hotel as soon as we left the hotel, and we had items stolen from our room. The staff showed no concern for these problems, and didn't do anything about them! Why stay where they do not value your business. There are many alternatives, closer to Pier 39, such as the Radisson and Wharf Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Well Done Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: esco007
Reviews.Content: We flew virgin to San Francisco, this was ok however the last time we flew State side we flew with United (Much More Professional and accommodating). Fishermans Wharf was ok as a base and for what it is the Express was first class. Good sized room and well looked after by the staff, the location is just about right for exploring we walked back from union square a couple of times, the yanks thought us mad but we English dont mind walking a few miles, on a warm spring day. The muni transport system is first class, our transport systems could learn a thing or two. All in all I would stay here again, oh and my wife thought it just right for the world famous chocolate factory, and their amazing sundaes

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in at Fisherman's Wharf”
Reviews.Author: LydNewHope_PA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before starting a cruise out of San Francisco. I did a lot of research to find a reasonably priced hotel as well as being in a great location. We certainly picked the right one. The location could not be greater - within a block of Fisherman's Wharf, the rooms and public areas are very, very clean. The reception staff could not be more helpful. A big bonus is the continental breakfast buffet. They have boiled eggs, warm sticky buns, all kinds of juices, muffins, cereals, yogurt and of course coffee or tea. This buffet is way superior to any of the other continental breakfasts we have had in the past. While checking out, I asked whether we could keep our luggage there for the day when returning from our cruise since our plane did not leave till 10:00 that night, and again was pleasantly surprised that we could. I am in the travel business and will always recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco and when we come back again, we certainly will stay here again. Thanks for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: H&SP
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco and we chose this hotel because of the good reviews and also the price that we got from the hotel website. The location of this hotel was fantastic - just a few minutes walk to Fishermans Wharf and all its sights. It is close to many restaurant and the Hyatt Sports bar across the road serves a very decent burger and cold beer. It is also close to the two cable-car turning points at the Wharf and so makes it very easy to get to other areas including Union Square. Our room was very clean and was a decent size. There was no view from the room but then we weren't there to look out of our hotel window. The free breakfast was excellent and was just what we needed to set us up for the day. The area did get quite busy but we didn't have a problem getting a seat. We thought that Fishermans Wharf was a great place to stay especially for a first visit to San Francisco. We would definitely recommend a visit to Bubba Gumps at Pier 39 for dinner and a city tour on a trolley bus. We will definitely book to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, GREAT, GREAT”
Reviews.Author: raish
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY fantastic stay......everything about this hotel is excellent. Would stay again, wouldn't bother looking around at others. This has best location, service, quality, comfort that you could ask for. Thanks to the team at Holiday Inn Express San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not having ever been to San Francisco, we reviewed all the hotels before choosing Holiday Inn Express. It was a great choice for our 4 nights. My husband and two children (ages 9 and 12)loved the location. The hotel was very clean, safe, affordable, and had no surprises. The staff was friendly and let us store our luggage after check-out until our flight that night. The breakfast and mini suite helped us save money to spend on activities. The only suggestion was my kids would have liked cable with children's programming and an indoor pool. We were able to go to Alcatraz, tour Chinatown, and bike across the Golden Gate bridge and return to the hotel to rest before the next activity. The bus schedule was easy to use when we ventured away from the wharf (thanks in part to the computer in the lobby). We had a wonderful time and would definitely stay at Holiday Inn Express again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel with our 2 teenage sons after a long flight from the Uk only to find our room was not ready. What could have been a dreadful start to our holiday was saved by the prompt attention of the reception staff who not ony found us another room without delay but upgraded us to a suite! We spent a very enjoyable 3 nights at the hotel & cannot fault it for comfort, location & staff. Anyone looking to stay on San Francisco on a budget should look at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably comfortable, clean, good service un a good location!”
Reviews.Author: malousadiua
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel in fisherman's wharf, but what I didn't know is that there is no view of the wharf here at all! I was expecting my 3 year old to be able to watch the goings-on at the wharf but couldn't do that! It was very close to the wharf though, without much noise at all. Because it is a Holiday Inn, it is reliable comfortable, clean, and what you would expect a good hotel would be here in the states. Try looking for this standard in Europe and you would expect to pay much more! This hotel tries hard to keep up with all the conveniences and it succeeds. This is a GOOD hotel! The only thing I might add is it is a bit pricey. It could be because of the location. I would still recommend it if you don't need a good view. Otherwise be prepared to pay a lot more. Another thing, there is no refrigerator in the room, which was surprising to me! Not good if you need it to store formula, etc. for a baby! But overall we had a good stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent low cost base”
Reviews.Author: navstu
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights March 19th - March 23rd on our way to Hawaii. Clean and large room with kitchenette. Excellent breakfast buffet. Freindly staff. Location ideal only minutes walk to fishermans wharf, cable cars and streetcar terminus. Lots of buses about too but never used them stuck to cable and streetcars. Would stay again if returned to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, rip-off parking, horrible area”
Reviews.Author: ps200306
Reviews.Content: This hotel was comfortable and moderately priced for the area. Stayed here for four days. The Fisherman's Wharf area is a seedy tourist trap. The local restaurants are like factories, shunting tourists in and out on the production line as fast as possible. I found the service in these places universally horrible. However, if you head north on the sea front towards the Golden Gate bridge you can have a pleasant two mile walk and end up at the Exploratorium in the Palace of Fine Arts -- well worth a visit. Back to the hotel -- the biggest negative was 32 dollars (plus tax) daily for parking. Otherwise, rooms were comfortable and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great anchor in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were wonderful. Our rooms were exactly as ordered and met our needs. The location is great for walking to tourist areas. Parking fee of $32 was a bit steep but competitive for the area. Highly recommend this facility to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice disposable hotel, poor area”
Reviews.Author: NVZ5BKUQ
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good desk service. It also offers free internet access. It is a nice frill-free place to stay and shares its facilities with the Holiday Inn immediately adjacent. Local attractions include Alcatraz, a submarine tour and a Liberty boat tour. Breakfast is a help yourself buffet which consists mainly of bread products and jam, doughnuts, pastries etc. although they do offer apples, oranges and bananas. It must all be eaten off disposable plates and trays so don't expect to see any china. It is reasonably placed to catch the two tourist cable-cars and the boat to Alcatraz, but otherwise Fisherman's Wharf is a horrible collection of downmarket shops. Pier 39 seems to be more famous for the way it obtained planning permission than anything on the pier. In March it is a windswept and cold collection of downmarket shops. I recommend that you stay in a different area of SF and travel to Fisherman's Wharf. The HI Express doesn't disappoint but it is a poor base to explore San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fab at the Fisherman's”
Reviews.Author: LondonDeborah
Reviews.Content: If you have a young child and are going to San Franciso, the holiday Inn at Fisherman's walk should suit. The hotel has an outside pool and you are in flat 1 minute walking distance from all the attractions at Fisherman's Wharf, with its bars, restaurants, and boat trips to Alcartraz. Also, the area is flat so no hills to push a buggy up. Very close to the main tram station into San Francisco. We booked with Virgin and they were perfect picking us up from the airport in a limosinine for no extra cost and the whole trip was effortless thanks to the very helpful staff on the plane.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value With a Great Locaion”
Reviews.Author: agoldman3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend and were very pleased. The staff were friendly and the hotel clean and comfortable. Yes, this is a basic hotel, and yes the rooms are a bit small. We spent very little time in the room so it was perfect for us. Walking distance to 2 cable car lines, the F-line and the warf. Breakfast was good enough. For the price, I would definately return and would consider it great for the kids too. TIP: We took the BART from SFO to the embarcadero station (30 min) for $5.15 per person and the F-line to its last stop (15 min) for $1.50 each. The hotel is 1 block from the stop. Taxi fare would be about $50 and would not be much quicker. Save the $35+ for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location - right around the corner from San Francisco's #1 tourist atttraction - Fisherman's Wharf. Pier 39, sighseeing tours, cable car and tramway's stops are right there. You'll be able to get easily to the Union Square (downtown), BART stations, all the piers and many sighseeing spots ( crooked Lombard St, Coit Tower, Columbus St with tons of restaurants (Stinking Rose is great!, Cannery with shops and restaurants and many many more by foot or a quick ride on many of SF's public transportation choices. We had an upgrade to the Executive floor witha veiw of the Bay and Alcatraz. The room was great - clean and spacious. The staff was nice. We had no problems whatsoever. Highly recommend this place if you have no Ritz-Carlton expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed with this hotel after having spent four days there with our two teenage daughters.
